column6: Devon: Leonard Cheshire, the Living Wage and fees for residential care for younger adults
column7: Leonard Cheshire Disability (LCD) claim that they would like to pay their carers the Living Wage but that they are not paid enough by social care funders such as yourself to do so.I wonder if you could please tell me:1) what representations Leonard Cheshire Disability (LCD) have made to the Council asking for increases in the fees paid for social care provided by them, in order to pay their carers the Living Wage.2) Some idea as to the fees currently being paid by the Council to LCD for residential care, per resident per week. A range of fees or a set of anonymised figures of the fees perhaps. Other councils have opted to supply statistical median and range as they were concerned that individual fees could make it possible for people to have a guess at which residents had which fees.3) Equivalent information for fees paid to other providers for residential care in care homes for people with physical impairments under the age of 65.

Kindly provide me with information relating to the Council's funding of its schools. I have attached a spreadsheet which details the precise information requested as a series of questions. It would be most helpful if you could complete the information on the spreadsheet and return this to me with the information added.

Please will you kindly tell me why your social services department use future harm as a good reason to take constituents children away from them & put them into care when the the Supreme court said in the Matter of J (Children) [2013] UKSC 9 that suspicions or possibilities were not enough when local authorities were considering the significant harm threshold & if you agree those who has been effected should use that case to appeal?http://www.ukfamilylawreform.co.uk/court.htmSignificant harm threshold: Suspicions or possibilities not enough 20th February 2013http://www.ukfamilylawreform.co.uk/significantharmthresholdsuspicionsorpossibilitiesnotenough20thfebruary2013.htmIn the Matter of J (Children) [2013] UKSC 9Supreme Court. Appeal by local authority concerning whether a child can be regarded as 'likely to suffer' harm for the purposes of s 31(2) of the Children Act 1989 if another child has been harmed in the past and there is a possibility that the parent now caring for him or her was responsible for the harm to the other child. The Supreme Court unanimously dismissed the appeal. Lady Hale gives the main judgment, Lord Wilson and Lord Sumption disagreeing on one point. Section 31 (2) of the Children Act 1989 imposes a threshold which must be satisfied before a care or supervision order can be made in respect of a child. First the child must have suffered or be likely to suffer significant harm; secondly, that harm must be attributable to the care given or likely to be given to the child. If the threshold is crossed then the court will treat the welfare of the child as its paramount consideration when deciding whether to make an order. The issue in this case is whether a child can be regarded as 'likely to suffer' harm if another child has been harmed in the past and there is a possibility that the parent now caring for him or her was responsible for the harm to the other child. The local authority in this case brought care proceedings in respect of three children who are cared for by DJ and JJ. The two oldest are the children of DJ and his former partner, and have always lived with DJ. The youngest child is JJ's daughter, her third child with her former partner, SW. The local authority submitted that the three children were likely to suffer significant harm because JJ's first child with SW, T-J, had died of non-accidental injuries in 2004. In earlier care proceedings relating to JJ and SW's second child, who was subsequently adopted, a judge had found that either JJ or SW had caused the injuries to T-J and the other had at the very least colluded to hide the truth. In the present proceedings the local authority sought to rely solely on the finding that JJ was a possible perpetrator of the injuries to T-J. It submitted that this was a finding of fact sufficient as a matter of law to satisfy the s 31(2) threshold in respect of the three children now c ared for by JJ and DJ. The High Court held on a preliminary issue that likelihood of significant harm can only be established by reference to past facts that are proved on the balance of probabilities. Mere possibility was insufficient. The Court of Appeal dismissed an appeal by the local authority but granted permission to appeal to the Supreme Court. The Supreme Court unanimously dismisses the local authority's appeal. The main judgment is given by Lady Hale, with whom all the justices agree. Lord Wilson expresses disagreement on one point, which Lord Sumption shares. Lord Reed gives an additional judgment, with which Lord Clarke and Lord Carnwath agree. Lord Hope agrees with Lady Hale and Lord Reed. It is a serious matter for the state compulsorily to remove a child from his family of birth. The section 31(2) threshold is an important

column6: Home to School travel and transport Training and Equalities
column7: Please provide all information on what the council has undertaken to meet its duties under s44 Training and Equalities, as given below. Please include types of training, training materials, types of personnel required to undergo training, and training undertaken.S44 Training and EqualitiesAll local authorities should ensure that all drivers and escorts taking pupils to and from school and related services have undertaken appropriate training, and that this is kept up to date. It is also considered good practice for those responsible for planning and managing school transport to have undertaken appropriate equality training. This training could consist of (but is not restricted to):-  an awareness of different types of disability including hidden disabilities; -  an awareness of what constitutes discrimination; -  training in the necessary skills to recognise, support and manage pupils with different types of disabilities, including hidden disabilities and certain behavior that may be associated with such disabilities; -  training in the skills necessary to communicate appropriately with pupils with all types of different disabilities, including the hidden disabilities; and -  training in the implementation of health care protocols to cover emergency procedures.

The mathematics e.g. Visa consumer transaction value £50,000 charged at 1.2% = £600.00?d.	None of the above?8.	Who is your current card payment processing provider?9. column6: Unauthorised absences from school during term-term
column7: Prior to September 2013,  head teachers could grant permission for families to take children out of school in 'special circumstances', but last year this changed to 'exceptional circumstances'.Q Was there any policy guidelines for head- teachers on what constituted special circumstances?Q Are there any policy guidelines for head- teachers on what constituted exceptional circumstances?Q Is there any form of appeal on the head teacher's decision before the child's absence from school.Q In the case of parents with children at  2 schools, what happens if one head teacher grants absence from school for one child, and another head teacher from another school refuses? In addition,  I  note the section on Devon's Penalty Notice Code of Conducthttp://www.devon.gov.uk/index/learningschools/attendance/absence-from-school.htmPenalty Notices will require the parent of a child of compulsory school age, whose attendance has been unsatisfactory, to pay a fine, currently £60.00 if paid within 21 days or £120.00 if paid within 28 days.Q Am I correct  in assuming that the fines and timescales are laid out in legislationQ What happens if the parent refuses (or is unable to pay) the £120 fine within 28 days?In cases requiring the issue of a Penalty Notice(s), each parent will receive a separate Penalty Notice for each child. Q It is probably laid out in the legislation, but what is the rationale for fining EACH parent?The proportion of lone parent households in the UK is the fourth highest in the EU with 24 per cent of of children being brought up by just one adult.Q If the absent parent has no knowledge of the unauthorised absence from school, is that absent parent still issued with a Penalty Notice?Q Is there any difference in policy if the absent parent is part of the holiday plans?I am also interested in tracking how the changes introduced in September 2013 have affected the issuing of Penalty NoticesQ How many parents across Exeter were issued with Penalty Notices in 2011-12Q How many parents across Exeter were issued with Penalty Notices in 2012-13Q How many parents across Exeter were issued with Penalty Notices in 2013-14Q is it possible to have the figures for 2013-14 as a breakdown per school?Q For 2013-14, how many of these paid £60 within 21 daysQ For 2013-14, how many of these paid £120 within 28 daysQ For 2013-14, how many of these were prosecuted for non-payment of Penalty Notice?Q How much did DCC raise countywide from unauthorised absences in 2011-12?Q How much did DCC raise countywide from unauthorised absences in 2012-13?Q How much did DCC raise countywide from unauthorised absences in 2013-14?Q What happens the monies raised by these fines?

column7: You are requested to provide the following information under the Freedom of Information Act 2000 for all stray dogs handled by your Council or by contractors acting on your behalf.Please send this information to me within 20 days using the accompanying spreadsheet.  Your reply should be sent to me at the following email address: margaret@dogrescuefederation.org A summary of the data we require is as follows.1)      In each of the following periods, how many stray dogs did the Council handle? From 1 October to 31 December 2013From 1 January to 31 March 2014From 1 April to 30 June 2014From 1 July to 30 September 2014From 1 October to 31 December 2014 2)      In each of the quarterly periods described above, how many of the stray dogs that were handled by the Council: a)      Did you return to the owner? b)      Did you dispose of by selling or giving to a dog rescue establishment? c)      Did you dispose of by selling or giving to a commercial dog pound establishment? d)     Did you dispose of by selling or giving to person(s) who in your opinion would care properly for them? e)      Did you dispose of by means of euthanasia?

The support received from Devon County Council.  This may simply be the precept, but other sources would be appreciated if known  c.  The costs of the services provided directly by DCC.  Would this be available by service, eg library, highway maintenance etc.?

column6: Various items of expenditure relating to Totnes Town Council
column7: 1. A385 Corridor and Totnes A385 Strategy.R39269 and £19,072 has been spent respectively on consultants for these two projects.  A385 Corridor Management is identified as a "critical Priority" and DCC responsibility in SHDC's Site Allocatin DPD for Totnes.  Eight sites are designated to provide S106 contributions for this purpose.  Paragraph 6.8 specifies that "each site allocated will be required to provide measures for the A385 to help reduce the congestion in the town as indicated in the infrastructure delivery programme.  The Council will also press for significant contributions towards the A385 Corridor Management Scheme from the major development west of Torbay".  Can you please indicate:1.  How the £39,269 has been spent.2.  Whether or not this expenditure was agreed with ToTM or the TC.3.  Whether or not it was subject to competitive tendering.4.  Whether or not an A385 Corridor Management Plan is now complete.5.  How this expenditure has benefitted the community.2.  ToTM Project Management£63,938 has been spent on consultants.  Could you please provide:1.  A breakdown of the items to which this expenditure refers.2.  Whether or not this expenditure was subject to competitive tendering.3.  Whether or not this expenditure was agreed with ToTM or the TC.4.  How this expenditure has benefited the community.3.  Totnes Old Bridge Pedestrian Improvements£21,520 has been spent on consultants.  Could you please tell us:1.  How the money was spent and what was the conclusion of the consultants.2.  Whether or not this expenditure was agreed with ToTM or the TC.3.  Whether or not it was subject to competitive tendering.4.  How this expenditure has benefitted the community.4.  Totnes Walking and Cycling Study£20,027 has been spent on consultants.  £2,223 of this was the sum paid to Eric van der Horst for the Totnes Strategic Cycle Plan.  Can you please tell us:1.  How has the remaining £17,804 been spent and whether or not this expenditure was agreed with ToTM or the TC.2.  Whether or not it was subject to competitive tendering.3.  How this expenditure of the £17,804 (as distinct from the sum paid for the Totnes Strategic Cycle Plan) has benefitted the community.

I would like to submit a Freedom of Information Request relating to specific ICT contract(s) for Server Hardware Maintenance, Server Virtualisation License and Maintenance and Storage Area Network Maintenance/Support which may include:-          Server Hardware Maintenance- contract relating to the support and maintenance of the's organisations servers.-          Virtualisation Licensing (VMware, Solaris, Unix, Linux, Windows Server)--          Virtualisation Maintenance/Support  (VMware, Solaris, Unix, Linux, Windows Server)-          Storage Area Network Maintenance/Support  (EMC, NetApp etc)  For each of the types of server ICT contracts above can you please send me the following data types:1.	Contract Title:2.	Contract Type: Please input one the type of contract from above e.g. Hardware Maintenance, Virtualisation Licensing, Virtualisation Maintenance/Support, Storage Area Network Maintenance3.	Existing/Current Supplier:4.	Hardware Brand:  Please state the hardware or software brand related to the contract with supplier e.g. Hardware Maintenance could be Dell, IBM etc5.	Operating System / Software(Platform): (Windows, Linux, Unix, VMWare etc.) the brand name relating to the contract.6.	Annual Average Spend: (For the whole duration of the contract, if the total value sent is per annum please state this in the response)7.	Contract Duration: (Please can you also include notes if the contract includes any contract extension periods.)8.	Contract Expiry Date:9.	Contract Review Date: (An approximate date of when the organisation is planning to review this particular contract.)10.	Brief Contract Description: I require a brief description of the service provided under this contract.11.	Internal Contact: (The person from within the organisation that is responsible for reviewing and renewing this particular contract. Please include there full name, job title, direct contact number and direct email address.)If there is more than one supplier for these contract can you please split the contract individually for each supplier. So the information above which I am requesting is for each supplier. If this service is part of a managed contract please can you send me the contract information for this managed service including Hardware Brand, Number of Users, Operating System, and contact details of the internal contact responsible for this contract.

It has been bought to my attention that the school my children attend will soon be losing its lollipop lady. Having done some additional research on this change I have discovered all councils have been asked to make savings around their road safety spending. The decision as to which schools lose their support seems to be based on the traffic levels on the road as well as the existence of other crossings nearby. As the traffic levels outside Bassetts Farm Primary School are extremely busy and there are no other crossing points on St Johns Rd I am confused as to why it is losing its crossing patrol. With this in mind I would like the following information. A breakdown of all the current patrolled crossings in Exmouth with details of which are soon to be removed. Alongside each listed patrol I would like to see details of the traffic levels on that road and on what date and time these traffic levels were recorded. Details of all other zebra and traffic light controlled crossings nearby should also be alongside each patrolled crossing. If additional information was used to make the decision of which patrols were to go please also provide this. Happy to discuss this request over the phone so please get in touch if this would help in providing me with the information I require.

column3: Highways Capital Development and Waste Management
column6: Priority for road re-surfacing in Exeter
column7: I understand that DCC takes an asset management  approach led by survey condition is used  to select and prioritise surfacing schemes. The current strategy  is to target repairs at major and minor collector roads which connect to the main road network.  As a consequence  the funding  does not extend sufficiently to housing estate roads such as Dorset Ave - which are extremely  important to the people who live there, but  serve fewer people than the adjoining collector roads .It seems to me that this approach takes little or no account of Exeter being an urban centre.So my supplementary question is Is there any data for number of vehicle movements along Dorset Avenue compared with similarly classified minor collector routes?

1. Core council youth service expenditure (original budget) - 2010/112. Core council youth service expenditure - 2013/143. Core council youth service expenditure - 2014/154. Total council youth service expenditure (inc relevant Area Based Grants, Early Intervention Grant, and Connexions) (original budget) - 2010/115. Total council youth service expenditure (inc relevant Area Based Grants, Early Intervention Grant, and Connexions) - 2013/146. Total council youth service expenditure (inc relevant Area Based Grants, Early Intervention Grant, and Connexions) - 2014/157. Youth service output in 2010/11 - all contacts (if recorded; please provide the definition of a 'contact' that the council used in 2010/11)8. Youth service output in 2010/11 - 'sustained' contacts (if recorded; please provide the definition of a 'sustained contact' that the council used in 2010/11)9. The figure in q7 as a percentage of the entire youth services demographic in 2010/1110. The figure in q8 as a percentage of the entire youth services demographic in 2010/1111. Youth service output in 2013/14 - all contacts (if recorded; please provide the definition of a 'contact' that the council used in 2013/14)12. Youth service output in 2013/14 - 'sustained' contacts (if recorded; please provide the definition of a 'sustained contact' that the council used in 2013/14)13. The figure in q11 as a percentage of the entire youth services demographic in 2013/1414. The figure in q12 as a percentage of the entire youth services demographic in 2013/1415. Please give details of any shift of youth service provision from a universal to a targeted approach since 201016. FTE number of local authority staff employed delivering youth services in March/April 2010 (or any alternative 2010/11 figure)17. FTE number of local authority staff employed delivering youth services in February 2015 (or any alternative 2014/15 figure)18. The number of youth centres funded and/or provided by the local authority in 2010/1119. The number of youth centres funded and/or provided by the local authority in 2014/15 Please send me the requested information by email in the attached spreadsheet (please send an xlsx file rather than a pdf). Notes and Definitions - PLEASE READ BEFORE RESPONDING:In questions 1 to 3, the council may define 'core' youth services in line with any internal definition that it operates. If the council does not distinguish 'core' youth services, it may ignore questions 1 to 3. In questions 1 and 4, the requested figures are for the 'original budget' for 2010/11 - ie prior to the impact of the 'in-year' cuts imposed by central government following the 2010 general election (if these figures are not available, please use figures from after the 'in-year' cuts and state this to be the case). If the council has outsourced its entire youth service funding to independent and third sector providers, please supply the funding levels given to these providers (in total) for questions 1-6 as appropriate. In questions 9, 10, 13 and 14, 'youth service demographic' refers to the number of people in the ENTIRE age group that the council's youth services are designed to cater to - it does NOT refer to subsets of that age group that the council may have chosen to target (e.g. lower income or 'at-risk' youths).  In questions 7, 8, 11 and 12, 'youth service output' refers to the number of contacts made with members of the youth service demographic. 'Sustained' contacts rests on any internal council definition, but is likely to mean above a minimum number of repeated contacts with each individual.If the council has no records of contacts, please ignore questions 7-14. In questions 16-17, if FTE figures are unavailable, headcount will do, again provid

column6: Children and Young people with Autism
column7: As part of this research, we are: Issuing the attached Freedom of Information request to all local authorities in England. Please respond to these questions within 20 working days as required by the Information Commissioner. Do not hesitate to contact us if you have questions about how best to respond. 1.       Whether the Authority publishes analysis of the numbers of children with special educational needs and disabilities in its school place planning report?  Yes/No  2.       Whether this analysis includes numbers of children with special educational needs by type of primary need?  Yes/ No 3.       If available, please provide a link to the published analysis referred to above.  4.       A breakdown to show, by educational setting, the number of children whose Statement of Special Educational Needs or Education Health and Care Plan is maintained by your authority which lists autism as the primary need from 2011 to date. We would request that the breakdown be provided as at the commencement of each calendar year (i.e. from January 2011 to January 2015 inclusive) show coverage across the recognised setting types (i.e .mainstream school; autism unit in a mainstream school; maintained special school;  non maintained special school ; independent special school; early Years Setting; Pupil Referral Unit; Home Education ; Other (please specify); General Further Education College; Independent Specialist College)For ease of reference we have attached a table in this email setting out the heading types for each year and would request you to provide the information in this format.

column7: I would like to know details of anyone who has been under the care of the County Council Guardianship/Deputyship Team* who has died with no known next of kin from 1/6/2014 to the day of your reply. *The Guardianship Team is known by different names at different County Councils, for example: Client Affairs, Protection Team, Adult Care Team, Deputyship Team, Appointeeship Team or other similar name.Please include:1.	 the deceased's full name(s)2.	the date they died3.	the approximate value of their estate(s)4.	their dates of birth or age at death whether or not they were married, divorced, single, or widowed 5.	the maiden surnames of married females or widows 6.	their  address at death7.	the date when a referral was made of this estate to the Treasury Solicitor or Duchy of Lancaster or Cornwall or any other 3rd party to research or administer and the name of the 3rd party concerned8.	if a referral to the Treasury Solicitor or Duchy has not yet been made and you think it will be made soon could you advise me of this too.9.	if a case is still  undecided or awaiting referral, please also advise of details.I prefer to receive replies by email only if this is possible and am grateful for your help.

column6: Contracts between public authorities and private enterprise
column7: Devon County Council's property services are delivered by NPS South West Ltd (formerly known as Devon Property) which is a subsidiary company of NPS Property Consultants Ltd, the parent company for the NPS Group.Norse Group Limited is wholly owned by Norfolk County Council ( NCC ).NPS South West Limited began trading in April 2007 as a joint venture with Devon County Council. Staff are located in Exeter and Ivybridge, returning 50% of its profits to the Devon County Council ( DCC ).Background material may be found at http://www.devon.gov.uk/nps.pdf   2011 You have my permission, upon specific request to myself, should it be necessary in processing this FoI request, to consult with NPS SW Ltd who may be contacted at exeterventurehouse@nps.co.uk, although such should NOT be necessary, as the requisite information should be held by yourselves.  Could you please provide the information and documents, as applicable to your organisation: 1	Copies of the contracts between NPS and DCC, including any amendments, whilst bearing in mind that NPS is wholly owned by NCC. 2	For the above contracts, copies of the performance ( customer satisfaction, health and safety as applied to NPS and contractors, ) and financial audits for the period 31 January 2012 to 31 January 2015. ( These dates are flexible according to the dates of the audits. ) 3	For the joint project, demonstration that for the creation of the joint venture, and subsequent contracts with NPS, that the statutory principles of Best Value have been applied. 4	Minutes of meetings at which decisions were made to enter into the joint venture, along with copies of the prior correspondence that preceded and facilitated the joint venture.

column3: Highways Capital Development and Waste Management
column7: I wish to make a Freedom of Information request for the attached information - Spreadsheet attached to original email.

After reading in the Guardian* to-day about a Freedom of Information request about the recently refurbished Manchester City Library, which revealed that 240,000 books had been disposed of, I would like to make the same request to Exeter City Library.  I have felt concerned about this since the library re-opened and the bland new book stock was revealed - more like going into a bookshop (although less easy to find the section you are interested in.)  Recently I was talking to a friend who had been used to borrowing novels by a favourite author from the library, only to find that the library no longer possessed any novels by that author.  The same person saw a large vehicle outside the door of the library, loading books intended for recycling.  She felt very alarmed.  It used to be possible to buy books that were no longer needed by the library.  Since it re-opened there have been no books for sale.* You may be interested to read the article by John Harris in the Saturday Guardian of 21st February ('In a country obsessed with the now, memory is political').

1. I would like to know how much the council currently spends on Taxis for people over the age of 16 per day and per person?2. I would like to know what departments within the council use Taxis as a service for the public the most and their contact details.The reason for this request is that we run a wheels to work scheme which helps get people over the age of 16 around via the use of a 50cc or 125cc scooter. We provide full training and safety equipment and include servicing and maintenance. I would like to learn how much of money we could potentially save the council by providing a cheaper alternative for suitable people. We already know and are actively working towards setting this service up in other councils to help save them money. We would love to do this for you too.My home address is 20 Brick Kiln Road, Stevenage, Hertfordshire, SG1 2NH

Please also break this down month on month up to 31 January 2015. If possible, please also state how many applications were made by housing associations. 5.) I would like to make a request under the Freedom of Information Act as to how many complaints relating to noise from Whitecleave Quarry DCC has received from residents of Buckfastleigh over the past 24 months up to the present date (25.03.2015) either by way of email, telephone, post or in person.  Please give the numbers for each separate month/year.Also I would like to know how many complaints have been transferred/forwarded to you from TDC during the same period from complaints that they have received relating to noise from Whitecleave Quarry and again how many per month for each year.If any complaints have been transferred/forwarded to you from Buckfastleigh TC in the past 24 months then again, when and how many.I understand that all complaints are recorded individually and therefore specific numbers should be available for each year and month.

Details of school catchment areas (i.e. predefined areas within which residents receive some priority in the admissions criteria) which are being used in the current 2015/16 admission round in your local authority. We request this data in the form of a table of street names and addresses associated with each school, or a file containing the catchment map shapes in any GIS vector file format (see below for details).By GIS vector file format we mean a file which contains the coordinates describing the shape of the catchment area and can be used in GIS software. Examples of these formats would include (but are not limited to): KML, GML, MapInfo TAB, GeoJSON, ESRI Shapefile, Spatialite. We are happy to receive map files in any recognised vector format. We appreciate that not all schools use catchment areas, and that you may not have information for academies, voluntary aided or foundation schools. I would prefer to receive this information by return email.Some parts of this request may be easier to answer than others, and should this prove to be the case I would ask that you release available data as soon as possible rather than hold up the entire request. If parts of the request are difficult to answer then could I ask that under your Section 16 duty under the Act to provide advice and assistance that you contact me so we can negotiate how to make the request answerable within the cost limit.If you need any clarification then please contact me at the email listed above or provide a telephone number and I can call you.

I am seeking information about the local welfare assistance provision scheme(s) that the council has available for local people to apply to when they are struggling financially and in hardship.Could you send me details of:1) The local council welfare assistance provision scheme(s) that people can apply to when they are in hardship. Could you include details of:- Eligibility criteria- The information people must provide when applying for assistance- The methods by which awards are made from the schemes (ie whether people receive cash, or if they are provided directly with pre-paid cards, or the white goods and furniture they require, etc).- If there are limits to the number of times that people can apply to the scheme(s)- If people must be formally referred to apply to local welfare provision (for example, by GPs, Jobcentre plus, the probation service, etc)- The three most common reasons that people apply for local welfare assistance (for example, a lack of furniture because people were recently homeless, a need for food support following job loss, emergency support for vulnerable adults, etc)- Whether or not everyone who meets eligibility criteria gets assistance. If not, how does the providing authority prioritise applicants?- Links to information on how people can apply2) Details of all cash grant and/or cash loan and emergency cash provision schemes if such separate schemes still exist. Please include:- the name of the scheme(s)- eligibility details- the information people must provide when applying- details of limits to grant or loan amounts- whether or not there is a limit to the number of times people can apply- the range of cash grants or loan amounts awarded- Whether everyone who meets eligibility criteria gets assistance. If not, how does the providing authority prioritise applicants?- Links to information on how people can apply3) Details about how often the schemes and their criteria are reviewed4) Could you also let me know whether people whose benefits have been stopped or sanctioned through jobcentre processes are eligible for help from the council's local welfare provision schemes, or if they are excluded.5) I am also seeking comment on the recent government consultation on how local welfare provision should be funded in 2015 to 2016. https://www.gov.uk/government/consultations/local-welfare-provision-in-2015-to-2016Could you let me know whether changes to central funding provision as a result of that consultation are likely to change the ways in which local welfare provision will be provided in your area? Is the amount of funding available to local welfare provision likely to be compromised? 6) Are there any awards, grants or provision that are specific to people living in certain areas or wards?7) Does the council/providing councils have any plans to scale back local welfare provision?

Please could I request details under the Act of the cost of social care services. More specifically, I would like to know: 1. In terms of sheltered accommodation for the elderly (those aged 65 and above), how much money did your authority spend on area warden services, and area warden support services in:a) 2010b) 2014 By area warden services, I refer to sheltered accommodation scheme managers who live onsite or offsite, and provide assistance to residents. 2. Please provide the number of wardens/sheltered accommodation scheme managers as defined in Q1 as at December 1 in: a) 2010b) 2014 3. In terms of sheltered accommodation for the elderly (those aged 65 and above), how much money did your authority spend on community alarms, and community alarms support services in:a) 2010b) 2014 By community alarms, I refer to alarms provided to residents for the purposes of 24 hour emergency service assistance. Such alarms are sometimes provided by local authorities to anyone who feels at risk in their own home because of age, disability, isolation, illness or vulnerability. 4. If the services described in questions 1, 2 and 3 of this request are outsourced to a private company including but not restricted to housing associations, please say so. If this is the case, please provide any details of money paid to those companies for the purposes of the provision of the services described in questions 1, 2 and 3 of this request.  Please justify any deletions or refusals with specific reference to the Act, and a description of why any exemptions would be applied.

column3: Highways Capital Development and Waste Management
column6: Highways Maintenance budgets, activity and road condition
column7: I am undertaking a masters degree and my dissertation will focus on LHA road maintenance spend/budgets, road condition performance, the relationship between these two sets of variables and the impact of financial management strategies. My aim is to fine a series of trend for benchmarking.As part of the data collection exercise I am requesting under the FOI Act base financial, activity, road condition and road length information for the period 2007/08 - 2017/18. This will form the main data set for my statistical analysis and will be supplemented by a questionnaire on financial management strategies which will be sent out in the next 4-6 weeks.I have given a general instruction on the header of the spreadsheet and structured it so you can input the data consistently with other LHA's.The request is for:1.	To provide the actual outturn positions (2007/08 - 2012/13), the estimated outturn forecast ( for the current year) and the budgets reflecting your medium term finance plan (2015/16-2017/18) for both capital and revenue highways maintenance budgets. Categorised as per the structure in the spreadsheet noting that the "Other" category is the balance between the total highways maintenance budgets and the sub-total roads maintenance category specified. Only complete the cells highlighted light blue. Please provide all £ figures to the nearest one decimal place.2.	To provide the estimate % (to the nearest whole number) preventative spend for the period 2007/08 - 2017/18 in relation to the sub - total Capital and Revenue (Roads Maintenance) budgets/spend.3.	To provide the number of safety defects repaired, actual, forecast and estimated for the period 2007/08 - 2017/18 - I will be linking this with the revenue spend relating to the defects repairs (carriageways) recorded in 1 above4.	To provide the length in km of carriageway treated actual, forecast and estimated for the period 2007/08 - 2017/18 - differentiating between surface treatments and reconstruction and linked to the capital spend in 1 above.5.	To provide the length of carriageway in km for each type of road classification - noting that if there has been no material change over the period of 1% or less please provide a single set of numbers.6.	To provide the road condition survey performance % (to the nearest whole number) actual, forecast and estimated for the period 2007/08 - 2017/18  - differentiating between RED and AMBER status.I will be providing a summary of my finding to all LHA's if they will be of use.

column6: Prevention of cancer - Macmillan Cancer Support
column7: Macmillan Cancer Support understand the importance of a healthy lifestyle not just on primary prevention of cancer but also on secondary prevention, improved cancer outcomes, reduced consequences of treatment and improved quality of life.The literature suggests that 95% of people living with cancer do not meet at least one of the recommendations for smoking, consumption of alcohol, physical activity, healthy eating and maintenance of a healthy weight. With an estimated 2.5million people living with cancer in the UK, this means 2,375,000 people could benefit from support. We are keen to understand the support that people living with or beyond cancer can access in changing their lifestyle behaviours in your locality.Please can we request, under the freedom of information act, answers to the following questions:-1.	What services are available to support your populations to change their lifestyle behaviours (including smoking cessation, healthy eating, maintaining a healthy weight, physical activity and drinking responsibly)?2.	Are these services accessible by people living with or beyond cancer?3.	Do these services follow the appropriate NICE guidance?4.	How are these services delivered i.e. face to face (individual or group); digitally (text, email) etc?5.	Are there any inclusion or exclusion criteria?6.	How long does the service last i.e. how long is an individual supported to change their lifestyle behaviour?We have created a series of tables (below) which hopefully will help collate this information and would appreciate it if you would populate these.Please response to RISQAT FABUNMI-ALADE at RFabunmi-Alade@macmillan.org.ukSmoking cessation (add rows as appropriate)Service Name	Brief description	NICE guidance followed(e.g. PH1; PH6; PH10; PH46; PH48; PH49)	Delivery method (e.g. Individual, face to face, group, mail, phone, digital - text; email etc)	Accessible by people living with or beyond cancer	Inclusion / exclusion criteria	Length of the support (e.g. 12 week programme of support) 	 	 	 	 	 	 Healthy Weight (add rows as appropriate)Service Name	Brief description	NICE guidance followed(e.g. (e.g. PH6; PH49;PH53; CG43)	Delivery method (e.g. Individual, face to face, group, mail, phone, digital - text; email)	Accessible by people living with or beyond cancer	Inclusion / exclusion criteria	Length of the support (e.g. 12 week programme of support)Healthy Eating (add rows as appropriate)Service Name	Brief description	NICE guidance followed(e.g. PH6; PH49;PH53; CG43)	Delivery method (e.g. Individual, face to face, group, mail, phone, digital - text; email)	Accessible by people living with or beyond cancer	Inclusion / exclusion criteria	Length of the support (e.g. 12 week programme of support) 	 	 	 	 	 	 Alcohol  support (add rows as appropriate)Service Name	Brief description	NICE guidance followedPhysical Activity support (add rows as appropriate)Service Name	Brief description	NICE guidance followed(e.g. PH6; PH49; PH2; PH13; PH16; PH44; PH54)	Delivery method (e.g. Individual, face to face, group, mail, phone, digital - text; email etc)	Accessible by people living with or beyond cancer	Inclusion / exclusion criteria	Length of the support (e.g. 12 week programme of support) 	 	 	 General Behaviour Change Service Name	Brief description	NICE guidance followed(e.g. PH6; PH49)	Delivery method (e.g. Individual, face to face, group, mail, phone, digital - text; email etc)

column6: Phase I of the Troubled Families Programme
column7: I am writing to request information about the selection and sanctions processes for Phase I of the Troubled Families Programme in your local authority under the Freedom of Information Act 2000.Please answer the following questions:In the period from the beginning of the first phase of the Troubled Families Programme to the most recent data available, and for those families selected for inclusion in the programme:1.a) What local discretionary criteria did you use in addition to the three primary criteria for inclusion in the Programme? b) For each primary and each discretionary criterion, please provide the number of families which you recorded as meeting that selection criterion.2.a) If a family met all three main criteria for inclusion in the programme, did you record whether it also met additional criteria? b) If a family met at least one discretionary criterion for inclusion, did you record whether it also met additional discretionary criteria?c) If domestic violence/abuse was a criterion for inclusion in the programme, did you record information on the types of domestic violence/abuse experienced by families who you recorded as fulfilling this criterion? If so, please list the subcategories used.3.What kinds of sanctions is it possible to apply to families under, or in relation to non-engagement with, the Troubled Families Programme? Please list all categories of sanction.4.How many sanctions have been applied to families under, or in relation to non-engagement with, the Troubled Families programme in your local authority for the entire period for which data is available? Please provide the numbers of sanctions within each category of sanction if available.5.a) How many times, if any, was a family with domestic violence identified as an inclusion criterion sanctioned under the Troubled Families programme? b) Which categories of sanction were applied in these cases?

Can I please ask three questions:1. How many complaints have you received from members of the public about dog fouling? Could you please tell me how your council tackles dog fouling in your area? (e.g. patrols)

column6: Education services for deaf/hearing impaired children
column7: This is a request for information under the Freedom of Information Act.  Please confirm that you have received this request. The National Deaf Children's Society (NDCS) aims to work in partnership with both central and local government to tackle the key issues that affect deaf children and their families, to ensure they get the help they need to achieve their potential. We are interested in decisions relating to spending on deaf children and young people's education. This is part of a nationwide request, using a standardised format to ensure consistency. In some cases the information requested may relate to services which the authority commission from private companies or other providers and monitor the contracts.  In such circumstances, as the authority remains publicly accountable for the service, we would still expect it to accept responsibility for collating the information, rather than referring us on to separate bodies.Please answer ALL the questions. If the information cannot be provided in whole or in part, please justify all omissions by reference to the specific exemptions of the Act.I look forward to your response promptly but no later than 20 working days, as outlined by law. We would be grateful if the response could be emailed to campaigns@ndcs.org.uk.  Kind regardsJo CampionDeputy Director, Policy and CampaignsNational Deaf Children's SocietyGround Floor South, Castle House37- 45 Paul StreetLondon, EC2A 4LScampaigns@ndcs.org.ukEducation1.	Please state the name, job title and contact details of the person completing this form 2.	Do you plan on reducing the overall budget allocated for the specialist education support service for deaf/hearing impaired children in 2015/16?Yes/No/Don't know If yes or don't know, please give details3. Do you plan on reducing the overall number of specialist education staff working with deaf/hearing impaired children in 2015/16?Yes/No4. Please complete the table below giving details of the budgeted spend for specialist education services for deaf/hearing impaired children in 2014/15 and 2015/16.We have already included the information your authority provided last year and have given a column for you to state if budgeted spend is expected to vary from actual spend. Please use figures for budgeted spend (NOT actual spend) for 2015/16 figures.  	2014/15 budgeted spend	Is your actual spend for 2014/15 likely to vary significantly from this figure? If yes, please explain why	2015/16 budgeted spend	If there is a planned reduction since 2014/15, please explain whyNet budget (£) (i.e. budget allocation)	£349,989			Gross budget(£) (i.e. budget allocation plus any additional income generated or expected to be generated)				5.	Do the figures above include any budgeted spend on children without a hearing impairment?   (eg. visually impaired children, other SEN etc)i.	Yes/Noii.	If yes, please provide details (e.g. visually impaired children, other SEN etc) 6.	Please complete the table below giving details of budgeted staffing levels in the specialist education service for deaf/hearing impaired children in 2014/15 and 2015/16.  If any of the posts include a combination of management and service delivery roles or if staff work flexibly across roles, please ensure the approximate time spent on each is accurately divided between rows a), b) and/or c) and expressed as a full time equivalent (fte)We have already included the information your authority provided last year and have given a column for you to update if this changed during the year.	2014/15 number of fte posts	How many of these posts were vacant/ frozen in 2014/15?

Dear Sir/ Madam, I am writing to request the following information, relating to adult social care, under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. I would appreciate your confirming receipt of this request. Please find the relevant questions listed below. I would be grateful if you could send me your responses at your earliest convenience, and within the statutory 20 working day period.  If anything is unclear, please do let me know and I will try to clarify. Kind regards,  Stephen Lane ---Request contents----1. Have you assessed the impact of the Care Act on the total spend by local authority on adult residential care?a. What is the estimated incremental cost to the authority?b. What percentage increase does this represent?c. How many individuals who are currently ineligible for LA support (i.e. self-funders) will become eligible for this support after the care act is implemented? 2. Are there Joint Commissioning arrangements in place in your area, for commissioning of health and social care in adult residential care placements?a. In particular this request relates to commissioning undertaken by the local authority for residential and/ or nursing care, on behalf of CCGs, NHS Trusts or Joint Commissioning Boardsb. How many such arrangements are in place, and with which bodies?

Please could you answer the following questions with regards to the  closure of the Independent Living Fund.1) Will you be ring fencing the ILF money passed to you to :- a) Individual ILF Users. b) Adult Social Care. c) Not ring fence at all.2) Have you received the details of how much money you are being  allocated and if so how much is that.3) When will you be starting reassessments of ILF users and when do  you anticipate completing those assessments.4) What arrangements are you putting in place for those ILF users  you have not reassessed by 30th June to continue funding their  current ILF care packages until an assessment has been carried  out. Bearing in mind that many of these ILF users will not currently  have Direct Payments set up with the Local Authority.5) Do you have contingency plans in case a change in Government at  the forthcoming election alters the ILF funding situation?.

I am writing under the terms of the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) to request information regarding your authority's and your associated Health & Wellbeing Board's work to address some specific needs of people with impairments/disabilities in your local population, and to ensure that they are not disadvantaged in that respect compared to people who do not have impairments/disabilities. Specifically, research in the last few decades has shown that while people with impairments/disabilities have needs for social and sexual relationships - just like anyone else - they very often experience profound barriers to having those needs met. Many of these barriers are within the control - and remit - of the local authority and strategic partners to influence. These barriers have a major negative influence on the health and wellbeing of people with impairments. Since they are considerably disadvantaged in this way, this is likely to be an important health inequality in your local population. It is therefore very important that the authority and the Health & Wellbeing Board assess the extent and nature of the problem, and agree plans to address those needs and thereby to reduce the inequalities. I would, therefore, be grateful to receive information about the authority and its associated Health and Wellbeing Board's assessment of the problem; the local needs and barriers; and plans to tackle any associated inequalities. Specifically: 1.	Kindly identify any estimates used by the authority and/or its associated HWBs of the numbers of people in your local population who have impairments/disabilities and the types of such impairments. Kindly let me have copies of the relevant reports. It would also be very helpful if you could identify any section in your Joint Strategic Needs Assessment where these are detailed. 2.	Please identify any assessments of the health and wellbeing needs of people with impairments/disabilities in your local population, and the barriers they face in having their needs met. Please note that I do not refer to individual client needs, but rather those of groups (or "populations") of people with impairments - for example, people in your local population who are blind, or those with very limited movement. I would be very grateful if any sections focusing on their social and sexual needs relating to health and wellbeing could be identified. If a relevant epidemiological needs assessment has been carried out, that would be especially useful. 3.	Please state whether the authority, and its associated HWBs, have already agreed or scheduled any plans to address the health and wellbeing needs of people with impairments/disabilities specifically related to their social and sexual relationship needs, and if so, kindly let me have copies. In order to assist you with this request, my query has been outlined as specifically as possible. If however this request is too wide or too unclear, I would be grateful if you could contact me by email as I understand that under the act, you are required to advise and assist requesters. I also understand that, under the act, I should be entitled to a response within 20 working days. I would be grateful if you could confirm receipt of this request, and I look forward to hearing from you in the near future. You may specifically want to include Public Health and Adult Community Services departments in identifying the relevant documents.

column7: On the 6th March 2015 at Bristol High Court an Experimental Traffic Oder was reversed, meaning the traffic will be returned to flowing up the Fore St/High Street in Totnes.How much has this court case cost?How much did the experimental traffic system cost to implement?How much will it cost to change back?

Please could you provide me with the following information:1. Number of people who made unfair/constructive dismissal claims against the authority in the last 5 years.2. A summary of each claim (including the reasons for claim, number of years service the employee had and the salary scale of the employee at the time of dismissal) and the outcome including any financial settlement agreed.Please note I am not asking for any personal information or details requested could not be used to identify an individual.Please can you confirm acknowledgement of this request and I look forward to your response in the next 20 working days.If this is the second time you have received my request then please accept my apology and delete this one!

We have been looking at some frameworks/contracts on TED.  Please find attached a spreadsheet containing five of these frameworks.   Please may we ask if you could supply the start and end dates and values (if available) of these frameworks/contracts?  We appreciate that we have corresponded with you before regarding these contracts and, at that time, they had yet to be awarded.  However, we are very keen to ascertain whether they have now been awarded, as we may have clients who would be interested in bidding for them when they next come up for renewal.May I stress that we do not need the successful and unsuccessful suppliers - just the dates. Therefore the information I am seeking shouldn't take too long i.e. under the cost ceiling.  In addition, as we are only asking for the Start and End dates, we do not believe that this constitutes a formal FOI request.I have attached an excel spreadsheet for you to enter the dates (and values if you can). I hope this helps you with the time constraints.

I am about to start my CIPD dissertation on fraudulent reference in the local authorities in the South West region. My research will focus on the omission of information on work references submitted by the employees and/or their referees as part of their application to conceal information1. How many employees did your org appoint between 1 Jan 2014 - 31 Dec 2014?2. How many of them are still being employed by your org?3. Do you ask all referees to state their relationship with the applicants on the reference form?4. If the answer to question 3 is yes, how many referees did not state their relationship in their references, of those who are still working with your org (question 2)?5. Please provide a breakdown of these employees by department, division and pay grade.6. Have you followed up why the information was missing? If so, what was the explanation?7. If the answer to question 6 is negative, would you be investigating this matter further?8. What actions are you going to take if you find that the information was deliberately omitted?9. Do you have a section where an employee can explain extenuating circumstances (dismissal, sickness, etc) on the application form?10. Is it possible to interview the employees identified under question 4 as part of the research?11. If the answer to question 10 is negative, who should I speak to, to appeal against the decision. Please supply the name, the job title and email of this person.

This is a request under the Freedom of Information for data held by the authority relating to children deemed to be at risk of radicalisation. Please let me know, for each calendar year 2013, 2014 and 2015 to date:1. column7: Please can you provide information on how Care Home Costs have increased in Devon over the last few years.Ideally it shows:-How residential Costs have changed and how Nursing Costs have changedThe average increase and if possible the spread, i.e. the maximum and minimumFor as many years as possibleFor all Devon and if possible  East Devon and West Devon.

On its website, Devon County Council states that "A leaflet setting out the key minerals issues facing Devon was published in Autumn 2010" and that "Over ten thousand paper copies of the leaflet were printed and circulated, and the leaflet was also available online" .  This is the leaflet:  http://www.devon.gov.uk/mineralsleaflet.pdfIn its Summary and Analysis of Survey Responses,  Devon County Council states that "Single copies of the leaflet were also sent or provided to: individuals already registered on the Mineral Core Strategy consultation database (including residents, operators, landowners)".I live in a minerals conservation zone next to a major quarry and Devon County Council never informed me that I could be notified of mineral consultations until after I responded to the 2012 consultation. I cannot see anything in the minerals section of the council's website that tells people they can sign up to a minerals consultation database. But there is a notice of an Online Forum "To encourage open and informal discussion between stakeholders on mineral planning issues in Devon" - the link takes visitors to a notice that the page does not exist.I would like Devon County Council to tell me how many residents in EX15 and EX16 postcodes were on the mineral consultation database and notified of the Big Minerals Debate in October 2010.

Of those home educated children currently in your area, for how many have the parents declined to provide any information at all in the last 12 months.

column6: Possession Order Application for Leighmoor Cross
column7: In late January2015 Devon County Council (as landowner) sought a Court order for possession of the land at Leighmoor Cross which is the subject of a long running unauthorized encampment.It is my understanding that rather than granting any order the Court adjourned proceedings until  Monday 18 May 2015 at 2.00 pm, to decide if there is a triable claim, make a final (possession) order or give directions for trial.  I also understand Roland Pyle of DCC, as a contact for the enforcement process, would likely be able to identify the team at DCC dealing with.The information now requested is:1.	What is the Court and case number of this matter?2.	What was the basis of claim DCC tendered to the Court to support the application for possession and what powers were relied upon?3.	Was there any counterargument offered by the defendant?4.	What reasons did the Court give for not granting an imminent order for possession (as is the usual course)?

We would also like to formally request all papers relating to a) the January complaint and b) the triage and subsequent strategy meeting in April. I would be grateful if this request could be acknowledged without delay.

1. Please tell me your standard charges (assuming that the client is paying full price, having over £23,250 capital) for the following domiciliary services to those aged over 65: a. Personal care (e.g. getting up, washing, getting dressed etc) - hourly rate. b. Domestic help (e.g. shopping, laundry etc.) - hourly rate(s). c. Home care services (e.g. cleaning curtains, turning mattresses, repairs and gardening) - hourly rate(s) d. Meals (at home or at a day care centre - please state both prices if they are different) - flat rate per meal. e. Transport (round trip to day care centre and back). f. Careline/Telecare (or similar telephone-based alarm service) - per week. Please include/tell us of any installation costs. If you do not charge in the way I have suggested above, please can you describe the charge in the way it is usually described to those eligible, from your authority, for domiciliary care.2. Does your authority operate a weekly cap on charges per individual? If so, please confirm the cap(s) in place for the financial year for 2014-2015.3. If someone requires transport to get to a day centre, would your authority normally consider this as part of that person's assessed needs, such that it becomes part of the package for consideration within the means test?4. Based on the FACs eligibility criteria (as set out in the Fair Access to Care Services, Department of Health Guidance, issued under section 7(1) of the Local Authority Social Services Act 1970), please confirm which of the following applies: Subject to appropriate means testing, our authority supports: a. Critical needs only; b. All critical and substantial needs; c. All critical, substantial and moderate needs; d. All critical and substantial needs, and some moderate needs. e. None of the above, we provide a different level of support. If the answer to this question is (d) or (e) then please provide a brief summary of the level of support provided by your authority. 5. After someone has applied for support and received an assessment, are they told in writing what needs banding they are in?6. If someone applies for support, but is found to have needs that don't meet your minimum eligibility criteria, is there a minimum period before they can reapply for another assessment (Please state the period if yes)?

See attached word document for full FOI request.We kindly request the information in queries 1-4 below for: - 	The calendar years 2012, 2013 and 2014 (Jan-Dec). If the whole year is not yet available for 2014, please provide the data from the last available 4 quarters. Please indicate for which quarters you have provided data.- 	Ages 16-24, with a breakdown by age in the following categories: o	16-17 year olds o	Any other 18-24 year olds (eg care leavers)We are seeking to understand:-	Query 1: Homelessness presentations, assessments and eligibilityo	How many people aged 16-24 are presenting as homelesso	How many people aged 16-24 are being assessed o	How many people aged 16-24 are being housed through children and youth services-	Query 2: Prevention and Reliefo	Any available homelessness prevention figures through children and youth services-	Query 3: Needs presented:o	Children and youth services needs categories-	Query 4:  Where they are housed-	Query 5: Why they are vulnerable/homelesso	Children and youth: factors recorded at the end of the assessment -	Query 6: Your Data systems:o	Could you please confirm the software and database systems used to maintain and query your homelessness data with children and youth servicesFull queries and suggested data categories:Where any one set of data is not recorded or recorded in a way that is not accessible for the purposes of the FOI - e.g. Query 1a) is often saved in paper files - please inform us of this, and proceed to the next question. For any one query, if you record any of this data but not using the variables and/or formats requested, please provide us with this data as you possess it, where possible.We have attached a template for responses: this is for your convenience only. column7: My query related to the Old Town Hill, LustleighPlease can you send me:1) A copy of your current road maintenance policy relating to that road. Please send me the full policy, but this should include details of the intended frequency of road safety inspections, how these inspections should be conducted and the maximum time between identification of a defect and repairs being carried out.2) A copy of the road repair history for that road over the past year. Again, please send me the full road repair history, but this should include:- dates of all safety inspections between 19/12/2014 and 25/02/2015-details of how safety inspections were undertaken (walked or driven, speed of the inspection vehicle etc)- details of all carriageway defects identified, with description, date and time- details of how the authority handled these defects, what repairs were undertaken and the time between the identification of each defect and a repair being carried out.

I would like to submit a Freedom of Information Request relating to specific ICT contract(s) for Server Hardware Maintenance, Server Virtualisation License and Maintenance and Storage Area Network Maintenance/Support which may include:-          Server Hardware Maintenance- contract relating to the support and maintenance of the's organisations servers.-          Virtualisation Licensing (VMware, Solaris, Unix, Linux, Windows Server)--          Virtualisation Maintenance/Support  (VMware, Solaris, Unix, Linux, Windows Server)-          Storage Area Network Maintenance/Support  (EMC, NetApp etc)  For each of the types of server ICT contracts above can you please send me the following data types:1.     Contract Title:2.     Contract Type: Please input one the type of contract from above e.g. Hardware Maintenance, Virtualisation Licensing, Virtualisation Maintenance/Support, Storage Area Network Maintenance3.     Existing/Current Supplier:4.     Hardware Brand:  Please state the hardware or software brand related to the contract with supplier e.g. Hardware Maintenance could be Dell, IBM etc5.     Operating System / Software(Platform): (Windows, Linux, Unix, VMWare etc.) the brand name relating to the contract.6.     Annual Average Spend: (For the whole duration of the contract, if the total value sent is per annum please state this in the response)7.     Contract Duration: (Please can you also include notes if the contract includes any contract extension periods.)8.     Contract Expiry Date:9.     Contract Review Date: (An approximate date of when the organisation is planning to review this particular contract.)10.  Brief Contract Description: I require a brief description of the service provided under this contract.11.  Internal Contact: (The person from within the organisation that is responsible for reviewing and renewing this particular contract. Please include there full name, job title, direct contact number and direct email address.)If there is more than one supplier for these contract can you please split the contract individually for each supplier. So the information above which I am requesting is for each supplier.If this service is part of a managed contract please can you send me the contract information for this managed service including Hardware Brand, Number of Users, Operating System, and contact details of the internal contact responsible for this contract.

I am requesting the information below about Discretionary Housing Payments at your council.Questions:1. What was the council's total DHP budget (spent and unspent) for the2014-2015 financial year?2. How many individual DHP awards were made by the council in the2014-2015 allocations year?3. What percentage of the council's total DHP funding for 2014-2015 was paid out in awards?4. Local reasons why DHPs were allocateda) Please send a list of all DHP awards made in the 2014-2015 year.Where possible, this list should include the:i) reason for each award (for example, the award was made to cover bedroom tax, or to meet rent costs in excess of the benefit cap).ii) duration of each award (for example, one month, six months, one year)iii) size of the award - how much money was awarded in each case5. Averages/median payouts and length of payouta) What was the most common length of a DHP award in the 2014-2015 year? (For example, one month, six months, a year.)b) What was the most common reason for the longest awards in 2014-2015?c) What was the most common/median amount for a DHP award in 2014-2015?6) How long on average does it take the council to process a DHP application?7. Other questionsa) Is DLA/PIP counted as income in calculations to DHP entitlement? If Yes, which DLA/PIP components are included?b) How can people apply for a DHP from the council? Please send any application forms and links to form pages, and any online application instructions.c) Do people have to complete an application form to apply? Please note if there are any other means by which people can apply (for example, can they just send an email detailing their requirements).d) Please include contact email address(s) and telephone numbers for people wanting to make DHP applications and to find out more information.

At how many locations was sound monitoring undertaken when the crusher and associated loading machinery was being used in Whitecleave Quarry and upon what dates? Those who spoke to you on the telephone were told sound monitoring was being undertaken. Monitoring was certainly not done at all the sites where levels were taken when the hydraulic hammer was in use.

This should include funerals carried out by the council or on behalf of any third party.If this information is now provided on your website, please send the hyperlink.Please include:1.       the deceased's full names2.       the date they died3.       the approximate value of their estate4.       their date and place of birth or age at death5.       whether or not they were married, divorced, single, or widowed6.       the maiden surnames of married females or widows7.       their  address at death8.       the date when a referral was made of this estate to any other 3rd party or body to research or administer and the name of the 3rd party concerned.9.       If a referral to a 3rd party or body  has not yet been made could you advise of the case details as above too.10.  If a case referral to a 3rd party or body is still  undecided or awaiting referral, please also advise of details of the case as above.  I prefer to receive replies by email only if this is possible and am grateful for your help.

column6: Business Protection from Misleading Marketing Regulations
column7: We are writing to make an open request for all the information to which we are entitled under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. In order to assist you with our request, we are outlining the query as specifically as possible. If however this request is too broad or unclear, we would be grateful if you could contact us. We understand that under the act, you are required to advise and assist requesters.Question: How many times have the Business Protection from Misleading Marketing Regulations 2008 (BPRs) utilised the list of approved/rejected health claims established under the Nutrition and Health Claims (England) Regulations 2007 to enforce breaches of the BPRs on food business operators making business to business communications? Please provide the number of recorded enforcement actions (i.e. official warning, improvement notice, fine, court action or other recorded action) you have issued since the BPRs came into force. EXAMPLE SITUATION'Business A' complains that the health claims 'Business B' is making about its ingredients / products to 'Business C' are misleading. 'Business B' is investigated by a TSO for the claims it is making to 'Business C' and uses the list of claims on the nutrition and health claims register (http://ec.europa.eu/nuhclaims/) to demonstrate the claims being made are misleading under the BPR (SI 2008/1276). Businesses B and C are making business-2-business communications only and such claims are not accessible during these discussions to the consumer. We understand under the act, we are entitled to a response within 20 working days. We would be grateful if you could confirm in writing that you have received this request. We look forward to hearing from you in the near future.

Under the Freedom of Information Act, please tell me: 1a) What public health services has your council put out to tender since April 1 2013.1b) What was the value any contracts let, and who were they awarded to? 1c) What was the total annual spend on those services prior to the contract being let?2a) What public health services does your council plan to tender during 2015-16?2b) And what is the estimated value of any contracts to be let this year?2c) What is the current total annual spend on those services?Please include details of any contracts currently being tendered, for which the contracts have not yet been awarded.

Under the Freedom of Information Act I seek the following information: I understand that your authority oversees the following zoos: Dartmoor Zoological Park, Paignton Zoo, Exmoor Zoo. This means that you must hold the stock list for this establishment as set out in the Zoo Licensing Act of 1981.  For a description of how a stock list works see page 21 of the Defra Secretary of State's Standards of Modern Zoo Practice and page 53 of this Defra guidance document. 1. Could you provide me with a copy of the stock list for each zoo in your area for the last three years: 2014, 2013, 2012.2. Please could you also provide me with a copy of any inspection or other reports relating to the same establishment for the years 2015, 2014, 2013, 2012.3. If the FOI cost limit has not been exceeded, please provide details of any incidents or concerns reported to the council for each zoo in the last three years. This could include, for example, incidents of escaped animals.If this request will exceed the cost limit in its current form please notify me as soon as possible, rather than after 20 working days.I would prefer to receive this information electronically, preferably as a data set, eg. in Excel, NOT as a PDF.If some parts of this request are easier to answer than others, I would ask that you release the available data as soon as possible.If you need any clarification then please do not hesitate to contact me. Under Section 16 it is your duty to provide advice and assistance and so I would expect you to contact me if you find this request unmanageable in any way.I would be grateful if you could confirm in writing that you have received this request, and I look forward to hearing from you within the 20-working day statutory time period.

column6: Transport schemes funded by Heart of the South West Local Enterprise Partnership
column7: I would like to request information on the status of funding approval and on the appraisal of local transport schemes that are funded (or partly funded) by the Heart of the South West Local Enterprise Partnership.For the purposes of this request, I would define a 'transport scheme' as a project that involves the provision of public or private transport infrastructure or services, including freight and passenger transport, or including the remodelling of streets or pavements for walking/cycling purposes and the provision of vehicles and facilities for vehicles of any kind.I would like your response to include schemes that have a significant transport component even if they are not primarily for transport (e.g. one that was for a development site and an external link road should be included even if most of the funding was for the development).For each transport scheme I would like to be provided with the following information:Basic details1. Name of the project2. Type of scheme (road/rail/cycle etc, or where mixed a description of the main scheme purpose, with the type(s) of transport included named) 3. Location, including Latitude and Longitude or grid reference 4. The sponsoring/bidding organisation, to which the funding will goFunding status5. Current status towards funding approval within the LEP's approval process, including 'under construction' or 'completed' where appropriate 6. An indication (yes/no) of whether it appeared in the 2014 Strategic Economic Plan prepared by the LEP 7. An indication (yes/no) of whether it was first proposed through the Local Transport Body process that preceded the SEP process in 2014 8. Date of the latest funding decision or status changeCosts9. Total capital cost estimate at the time it was first included in the SEP or the LEP plans 10. Final or current capital cost 11. Total LEP funding contribution 12. Total contribution from Local Growth Fund funding 13. Contributions from other bodies, e.g. the Department for TransportValue for money14. Estimate of value for money (Benefit-Cost Ratio, BCR) at the time it was first included in the SEP or the LEP plans 15. Latest estimate of value for money (BCR) 16. Expected date for full LEP or DfT funding approval 17. Expected date for start of construction 18. Expected date for completion
