column3: Highways Capital Development and Waste Management
column7: I wish to complain about Devon County Council and their contractors WJ (www.wj.uk) who were doing roadworks outside my house in Fairmile at 11pm on Monday 25 July 2016. Fairmile is a rural residential area, with very low levels of background noise at night.This evening at 10:55pm I was woken from sleep by the sound of heavy machinery and when I got dressed and went to investigate I found a WJ road surfacing lorry removing the recently painted dashed white lines in the centre of the road.There was no reason for this to be undertaken during night hours, as this road is not so heavily used that it could not be done during daylight hours (with appropriate traffic management).I was told by the contractors that had to reposition the white lines which had been painted in the wrong position. My assumption is that this was being done at this time of night simply for the convenience of the contractors who had to fit in  this unplanned work. This is not, IMO, a reason to disturb the sleep of local residents.I also refer you to the Department of Transport Traffic Advisory Leaflet 8/14 of November 2014 and BS 5228-1:2009 which point out the need for a formal assessment of the acceptable noise levels for residential areas and which needs to "to have no significant increase over existing background levels". (Since this is a rural residential area, background noise at night is very low level, so any noisy machinery would be a significant increase. In this case it was sufficient to wake me.) I request that you supply me with a copy of this assessment so that I can see what consideration you made for assuring that noise was acceptable..I look forward to your explanation.

column7: I am requesting the following information under the Freedom of Information Act. Please read the definitions towards the end of this request before responding.1. The number of "referrals" (specifically as defined below) made for children to the council's children's social services department during 2013/14 and 2014/15, broken down by the ethnicity of the child (if possible please group ethnicities as: White; Black; Asian/Asian British; Mixed/Other; Missing/Unknown)2. The number of "referrals" made for children to the council's children's social services department during 2013/14 and 2014/15 that were accepted but where the case was closed with "no further action" (specifically as defined further below), broken down by the ethnicity of the child (grouped as requested in question 1)3. The number of "referrals" made for children to the council's children's social services department during 2013/14 and 2014/15 that were accepted and led to "further action" (specifically as defined further below - section 17/47 investigations), broken down by the ethnicity of the child (grouped as requested in question 1)Definitions:A "referral" is the initial request for services for a child made to local authority children's social care. This request asks for data on individual referrals rather than individual children - so repeat referrals of the same child should be counted separately."No further action" means that no further action was taken after the assessment of the referral."Further action" is where an assessment is followed up by a section 17 or section 47 investigation.If data for 2013/14 and 2014/15 cannot be sourced within the section 12 cost limit, please provide data for 2014/15 only.Please note that the stipulated ethnic categories are designed to ensure that the number of children in each category is above DPA thresholds.Please send the information by email, preferably in an Excel spreadsheet file.

column6: Rivel's Green Development - Alterations to new road junction
column7: I have viewed the Mid Devon Council approved planning permission website - http://docs.middevon.gov.uk/pap/index.asp?caseref=15/00934/MARM in relationship to the approved planning permission given to Devonshire Homes for the development of Rivel's Green, Cullompton. In the plans it shows that they requested permission to alter the roads of Culm Lea and River Drive to gain access into their Rivel's Green development. Some of the site plans show the intended alterations but none show the actual detailed plan of them. I request under the Freedom of Information Act a detailed copy of the approved plans that shows the dimensions of all the alterations to be made to the new junction joining the three roads together. The plans should also include the dimensions of the narrowing of Culm Lea and River Drive and the new build outs in those roads.Mid Devon Council states that your Roads Department for the Mid Devon area has the plans.

column7: Section 53B of the Wildlife and Countryside Act (1981) requires Devon County Council to publish, on its website, a compliant Register of applications to modify its definitive map of public rights of way. This is required to include all applications made under Section 53 of the Act that were not determined by 31st December 2005, additionally to all applications made after that date. Statutory Instrument 2461 (2005) defines, by Regulations, the information that the Council is obliged to publish on its web-based Register and the manner in which interrogation by the public must be enabled. I have attached a copy of Statutory Instrument 2461 (2005) for ease of reference. Despite my best efforts, I have been unable to locate the Councils statutory Section 53B Register on its website. Accordingly, please can the Council provide me with the following information: 1). Please can you kindly inform me how I locate and access the Councils statutory web-based Register of applications to modify the definitive map of public rights of way, required to be kept and maintained by Section 53B of the Wildlife and Countryside Act (1981)? 2). If Devon County Council is failing to maintain a web-based Section 53B Register available for public inspection and interrogation, please can it provide me with the following information in electronic or paper format: All and every piece of information that Statutory Instrument 2461 (2005) requires the Devon County Council to publish on its website, in relation to applications made to modify its definitive map of public rights of way?

column7: DCC had contractors refurbish the road surface of Townstal Road, Dartmouth, the main road that merges seamlessly into College Way, perhaps four years ago. The new surface started to disintegrate immediately. Repairs were made. The repairs have disintegrated.As a council tax payer I feel DCC must always receive value for money form its contractors. Road surfaces are designed to last far longer than the rubbish that has ben used here.What steps has DCC taken, its DCC taking or will DCC commit to take in order to receive full and proper compensation from the contractor whose work has left this mess, and when will the mess be put right?

column7: Defining a "road bridge" as a structure with a span of 1.5m or more providing public highway passage for motor vehicles over an obstacle such as a watercourse, railway, road or valley, please provide the following information for all road bridges for which you own as highway authority, including those which are jointly owned with another authority, but for which you are the lead authority:1.       How many road bridges are you responsible for maintaining?2.       For each of the last three financial years (2015/16, 2014/15 and 2013/14) how many Principal Inspections have taken place3.       For each of the last three financial years (2015/16, 2014/15 and 2013/14) how many General Inspections have taken place?4.       For each of the last three financial years (2015/16, 2014/15 and 2013/14) how many Structural reviews and/or BD21 assessments have been conducted?5.       How many sub-standard (in terms of capacity) and/or weight restricted bridges do you have?6.       Of these, how many do you intend to return to full load carrying capacity in the next 5 years?7.       How many bridges would you return to full load carrying capacity if you had no resource restrictions?8.       How many of your bridges require post tensioned special inspections (PSTIs)? How many of those have had PSTIs within the last 18 years?9.       What is the current Depreciation (i.e. difference between your GRC and DRC as declared for your WGA return for 2015/16)? 10.   Have you calculated your back log (or workbank) for bridges? What is the calculated value of your backlog of road bridges, or your best estimate if a calculated value is not available? 11.   What is the annual cost of maintaining your bridge stock at its current level (standstill budget)? 12.   Given that the DfT settlement for Highways Maintenance has an indicative allocation for bridges, what proportion of that settlement does your authority allocate to the structural maintenance of bridges?13.   In your opinion, what is the biggest challenge for local highway authority bridge engineers over the next 10 years?I request this information electronically in tabular form (ideally a spreadsheet) NOT as a PDF. column7: With regards to Mid Devon District Council approved planning application 13/00859/MOUT Cummings Nursery, Stoneyford, Cullompton EX15 1NJ I request from the Devon County Council the swept path analysis (all documents relating to them) for both a car and a large refuse lorry for the the new junction joining Culm Lea, River Drive and Rivel's Green together. I would like in particular the swept path analysis for the new build out sections in Culm Lea & River Drive which have been subject to a realignment.I also request a copy of the actual analysis findings which led to the below comments sent to me in an email on 7/9/16 (flexibility/ error, a degree of clearance needs to be introduced) by Mr Ian Sorenson Planning, Transport and Environment Service Highways Development Management Officer (Mid Devon District) concerning his below comments to me in an email -'....Also for your information I have queried the swept path analysis of a refuse vehicle and a car passing at the junction and advised a realignment to accommodate. I would not wish to see the full build out go as it will reduce speeds but a reduction that would accommodate both our safety requirements and deliver a more suitable drive through the junction for residents I can be accommodated. The alignment and analysis will be discussed at our meeting on the 19th. I should point out that their analysis works but does not leave much in the way of flexibility/ error, a degree of clearance needs to be introduced...'

It would be in my best interests to find out more information in regards to the structure of the planning department, and if possible, including an organogram detailing the different roles that the council employs. It would also be useful to find out more about how many members of staff the council employs in the department, including temporary members of staff supplied by recruitment agencies.Alongside this, any information regarding the Head of Service, and relevant Team Managers within this division (Development Management, Planning Policy, Building Control etc), including the best way to contact them, would be greatly appreciated to ensure that I can develop a greater understanding of your authority's planning department.Summary of Information Requested:-          Full structure and details of each job role within the planning department.-          Full structure and details of each job role within the Building Control department.-          Name and contact details for every person within a management position within the planning department.-          Name and contact details for every person within a management position within the Building Control department.-          Details of how many temporary workers are currently engaged in each department/service.

It may be easiest simply to list the number of children classified under this code, by way of response to my request.

1.       Standard Firewall (Network) - Firewall service protects your corporate Network from unauthorised access and other Internet security threats 2.       Intrusion Detection - network intrusion detections systems (IDS) and network intrusion prevention systems (IPS) services that detect Web application attacks and include anomaly-awareness in addition to handling older threats that haven't disappeared.  3.       Web Applications Firewall - A Web application firewall (WAF) is a firewall that monitors, filters or blocks the HTTP traffic to and from a Web application.  4.       Threat Monitoring - organizations and security analysts to identify and protect against security threats.5.       Anti-virus Software Application - Anti-virus software is a program or set of programs that are designed to prevent, search for, detect, and remove software viruses, and other malicious software like worms, trojans, adware, and more. 6.       Encryption Facilities - s a host based software solution designed to encrypt sensitive data before transferring it to tape for archival purposes or business partner exchange. For each of the different types of cyber security services can you please provide me with: 1.       Who is the existing supplier for this contract?2.       What does the organisation spend for each of contract?3.       What is the description of the services provided for each contract?4.       What is the expiry date of each contract?5.       What is the start date of each contract?6.       What is the contract duration of contract?7.       What is the hardware brand? If available.8.       What is the software brand? If available?9.       The responsible contract officer? Full name, job title, contact number and direct email address.

Again, please send me the full road repair history, but this should include:- dates of all safety inspections between 23/07/15 and 23/07/16 covering a period 6 months either side of the accident on 23/01/16, details of how safety inspections were undertaken (walked or driven, speed of inspection vehicle etc)- details of all carriageway defects identified, with description, date and time- details of how the authority handled these defects, what repairs were undertaken and the time between the identification of each defect and a repair being carried out.

I require the below information relating to solar power investment and infrastructure to be provided by your organisation. I require the following questions to be answered: 1.      Does your organisation own any solar panels?a.      Yesb.      No 2.      Does your organisation have any partnerships with third parties to co-own solar panels? If yes, please specify who the partnership is with and the details of the deal?a.      Yes - the partnership is with company X and the deal includes XYZ (i.e. free daytime electricity for tenants)b.      No 3.      If yes to question two, did the third party organisation initiate contact with you for the above deal?a.      Yesb.      No 4.      If yes to questions one or two, how much energy (in kWh) are you generating? 5.      How much has your organisation invested in solar technology to date (to the nearest £10,000)?  6.      Are you planning on purchasing solar technology within the next:a.      0 - 6 months            i.      Yes            ii.      Nob.      6 - 12 months            i.      Yes            ii.      Noc.       1 - 3 years            i.      Yes            ii.      Nod.      3 - 5 years            i.      Yes            ii.      Noe.      5 years +            i.      Yes            ii.      No 7.      How much are you expecting to spend on solar in the next:a.      0 - 6 months                   i.      £ X.00 (to the nearest £10,000)b.      6 - 12 months                 i.      £ X.00 (to the nearest £10,000)c.       1 - 3 years                 i.      £ X.00 (to the nearest £10,000)d.      3 - 5 years                 i.      £ X.00 (to the nearest £10,000)e.      5 years +                 i.      £ X.00 (to the nearest £10,000) 8.      Is solar technology incorporated within your organisation's current environmental strategy? If so, please provide details of strategy).a.      Yes - my organisation plans to achieve XYZ, within the following timeframe Xb.      No 9.      Please identify the main barriers to solar adoption within your organisation:a.      Lack of internal stakeholder buy-inb.      Lack of capital to front investmentc.       Lack of external stakeholder buy-ind.      Lack of knowledge of the benefits of solare.      Lack of knowledge on how to deploy solarf.       Lack of incentive (due to reduced government incentive)g.      Other (please specify)

In 2014, the government made changes to the Special Educational Needs & Disability (SEND) framework through the Children & Families Act. Subsequently, the Department for Education (DfE) has provided a financial grant to help local authorities implement these reforms.Details of these grants can be found here - https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/send-implementation-grant-allocations-by-local-authority/send-implementation-local-allocation and here - https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/send-reform-funding-for-local-authorities-2016-to-2017I would be grateful if you could provide me with a breakdown of council spending that has been funded using this SEND reform implementation grant. Please provide this information in spreadsheet form, using the same columns & criteria that you would normally use to submit monthly or quarterly spending online as part of the council's transparency data process.

column6: East Worlington Parish Council & Cllr Richard Edgell
column7: This is a request for information held by Devon County Council, its Councillors and any other person associated with the Council's function, for example, attendees at Council meetings such as but not limited to, representatives of Police, District, Parish Council and PublicThe information required is all of that relating to and concerning the construction, maintenance and repair of the public highways within the parish of East and West Worlington together with any information relating directly or indirectly to highway matters. The information might include but is not limited to, complaints or comments from any source about the highway, all documents received by or created by the Council or Councillors or Officers or employees or contractors, or attendees at meetings, minutes of meetings or other records which contain reference to highway or related matters, information exchanged between Councillors or any other person, surveys, reports, notices and any other material.In addition to and in a separate bundle from the above information please supply all information relating highway matters listed above which relates to or is connected with Councillor Richard Edgell.  This should include but is not limited to all of the information of the types listed above.  This means all information which Councillor Edgell could have seen, heard, exposed to, or otherwise been made aware of, and all documents in which Councillor is mentioned or his role is referred to.The period covered by the request is the financial years 2011 to 2015 inclusive and the current year to date.

I would like to request information your council has on indicators of street cleanliness for your local authority's streets (for example, NI195, BV199a and other indicators would all be acceptable/welcome) for 2014/15.Specifically, I would like details of the measurement method you use for assessing street cleanliness (such as NI195, BV199a, or a brief description of the measure used) and the scores for all components of the measure for the local authority as a whole.  Please note, we do not need the scores for each of the streets.  Rather, we want an aggregate statistic for the whole council area.  For example, a common statistic would be 'the proportion of streets which are the responsibility of the council that meet a satisfactory level of street cleanliness'.  I would then like an explanation of the standard and methodology of measurement used.  Please feel free to make that description relative to the NI195 measurement methodology, since I understand this well.If it is possible to provide the same assessment for 2009/10, I would welcome that.  However, I would ask that you prioritise the 2014/15 data.

Please supply the following information concerning bus lane cameras pointed at traffic:The locations (latitude and longitude and street address with postcode) of all bus lane cameras, whose images and recordings are used to issue fines/penalty notices to drivers who wrongly use the lanes. I do not require any information about cameras used simply for security or general CCTV monitoring.For each individual camera please state: 1.	The date it became operational (DD/MM/YYYY).2.	The number of penalty charge notices issued to date since it was first switched on. 3.	The number of penalty charge notices issued during the financial year 2015-16.4.	The gross income from any fines/penalties issued to drivers caught on the camera since it was activated. Please include expected income from fines/penalties still awaiting payment. 5.	The gross income from any fines/penalties issued to drivers caught on the camera in the 2015-16 financial year. 6.	The amount a driver must pay to settle a penalty charge.

Please could you supply us with an up to date information about all bridges within administrative boundariesa) A list of every bridge in the borough (including foot bridges & viaducts) where a road passes over or under a railway (including tramlines), another road, or over a water course, making clear which, and sorting by type/usage.b) Bridge locations as defined by associated ELR code, bridge numbers and Mileage.c) Bridge descriptiond) Any weight limit which appliese) An explanation of the general principle for the determining of responsibility for maintaining a road bridge over or under a railway or water course, such as that the railway or water authority is responsible where the road goes under and the highway authority where it goes over.f) The owner of the structure, or where that is shared, the parties involved. Where only one or some is known, give those, and a brief explanation.g) The party or parties responsible for maintaing the bridge in a safe state and a brief note on any division in responsibilityI would appreciate sufficient information to determine the type and usage of the bridge. For example, whether it is an under- or overbridge, and what, if any, non-rail traffic uses the bridge. Any other data availed will be appreciated.Please provide this electronically, preferably in in the form of a spreadsheet.

I have a request relating to the number of parking tickets issued in Crediton and in particular to the area around Kiddicott and Deep cut - covering the postcode EX17 3LA. These are the two roads that run next to and behind Sunflowers Day Nursery (82 High St, Crediton EX17 3LA).Therefore please provide me with the following information:1. How many fines have been issued around Kiddicott and New Cut (i.e. those fines that have the location listed on the ticket as Kiddicott Crediton or New Cut Crediton) over the last five years? (from the period November 2011-2016)2. How many have been successfully appealed?3. Of the tickets issued and the appeals pursued (both electronically online and in writing) how many instances have there been where the Civil Enforcement Officer has noted on the system, against the ticket, that the car was picking up children, or the person came back to the car, after the ticket had already been issued, carrying or with a child?4. How many of the appeals have been based on the claim that the car in question was parked in the area around Kiddicott or New Cut due to the fact that children were being collected from the nursery?5. How many of these were successful in the appeal?6. Please provide a breakdown by hour slots detailing the number tickets have been issued over the last five years in those slots.7. What guidance is provided to the Civil Enforcement Officers as to what time slots and hours they should target around that area?8. Appeals aside, what is the total revenue generated from these fines and what happens to the fines collected? What purpose are they used for? Please provide a full breakdown of how the money is allocated.

1.	Please provide BASIC pay bill costs in £000s for the financial year 2015/16 for staff employed on NJC Green Book conditions ONLY. Please exclude any school support staff based in schools from these pay bill costs.2.	Please provide GROSS TOTAL pay bill costs in £000s for the financial year 2015/16 for staff employed on NJC Green Book conditions ONLY. Please exclude any school support staff based in schools from these pay bill costs.Our Definitions to help you respondNJC Green Book - are staff employed on National Joint Council for Local Government Services terms and conditions. Please respond to this FOI ONLY if you follow the NJC cost of living pay award for your staff. We are not seeking this information from councils who have opted out of NJC bargaining.School support staff should be: 1.	excluded from your response if they are based in schools e.g. school cooks and cleaners and teaching assistants2.	included in your response if they are based in the council e.g. crossing patrol and passenger assistants.Basic Pay: Includes: pay before deductions for PAYE, National Insurance, pension schemes and voluntary deductions. All basic pay relating to the pay period. London and other area or fringe allowances. Excludes: all pay that relates to a different pay period, travel and subsistence expenses, and any overtime, shift premium and bonus or incentive pay.Gross Total Pay: Includes: pay before deductions for PAYE, National Insurance, pension schemes and voluntary deductions. All basic pay relating to the pay period. London and other area or fringe allowances. Any overtime, shift premium, bonus or incentive pay and any other pay relating to the pay period. Excludes: any payments for travel or subsistence expenses and all pay that relates to a different pay period.

column6: Number of teachers accused of sexual abuse in the last two full academic years
column7: Under the Freedom of Information Act I request the following information on the numbers of teachers accused of sexual abuse in the last two full academic years.1) a) How many school workers have been accused of the sexual abuse of a pupil in each of the last five academic years.For a full definition of sexual abuse please see NSPCC guidelines: http://www.nspcc.org.uk/help-and-advice/worried-about-a-child/online-advice/sexual-abuse/sexual-abuse-a_wda87108.html2) This information should be broken down by case and should include:a) The academic year the alleged incident took place (e.g. 2011-12, 2012-13 etc).b) The type of school the incident took in (e.g. Primary, Secondary, SEN, FE Colleges and Independent etc)c) The job title of the accused staff member to be limited to 'teacher' or 'non-teacher'd) Whether the council or school reported the alleged incident to the police (answers should be 'yes' or 'no').e) Whether the worker was suspended as a result of the incident (answers should be 'yes' or 'no').f) Whether the worker was disciplined as a result of the incident (answers should be 'yes' or 'no').e) Whether the worker was dismissed as a result of the incident (answers should be 'yes' or 'no').g) Whether the authority placed the worker on a list whereby he or she is barred from working with children under your supervision  (answers should be 'yes' or 'no'). h) Whether the authority has placed the worker on a list whereby there are concerns about the person but he or she has not be barred (answers should be 'yes' or 'no').2) Please tabulate you response in the following format, which was used by Essex County Council to answer a similar request.PLEASE NOTE THERE IS A TABLE - See attached email for more information

I am writing in regard to your "Short Breaks" programme. For the following four categories can you tell me for FY 10/11, FY 11/12, FY 12/13, FY 13/14 and for the next financial year (i) how much you funded the programme and (ii) how many places were funded in each of the following four categories:(a) day-time care in the homes of disabled children or elsewhere,(b) overnight care in the homes of disabled children or elsewhere,(c) educational or leisure activities for disabled children outside their homes, and(d) services available to assist carers in the evenings, at weekends and during the school holidays.

column6: Impact on Local Authorities by flooding
column7: I am writing to ask for information held by your council on the recent flooding.It forms part of a study looking at the human impact and fiscal impact on local authorities of the recent flooding.This should be treated as a Freedom of Information request.QUESTIONS1.	How many households had to evacuate their homes due to the flooding due to (a) problems of access due to floodwater outside the house and (b) because floodwater had come into the house?2.	How many households where floodwater came into the house are still empty?3.	Have you taken action under Section 13A of the Local Government Finance Act 1992 to exempt households that are empty due to flooding and requiring repairs from paying council tax? If so:o	(a) What percentage discount are you giving on council tax?o	(b) How many households are receiving this discount?o	(c) Have you applied to the Department for Communities and Local Government for funding to meet the cost of such discounts?4.	What is your estimate of the total cost to the council of dealing with the flooding, i.e. emergency response, repairs, council tax discounts, etc.?5.	With regard to Bellwin funding:o	(a) How much have you already applied for?o	(b) How much do you expect to apply for in total?o	(c) Did you receive the payment within 15 working days of your application to the fund?o	(d) How much have you received in total from the fund?6.	What is your normal council tax discount for "Class A" dwellings under the Council Tax (Exempt Dwellings) Order 1992, i.e. where a property is vacant and "requires or is undergoing major repair work to make it habitable"?7.	What is your normal council tax discount for "Class C" dwellings under the Council Tax (Exempt Dwellings) Order 1992, i.e. where a property is "unoccupied and substantially unfurnished"?

Of those assessments detailed in Question 3, what percentage of those assessments was commissioned to be carried out by external providers? 5.	How many parenting assessments were completed by the authority between 1st April 2013 and 31st March 2014?6.	Of those assessments detailed in Question 5, what percentage of those assessments were commissioned to be carried out by external providers?

column6: Specialist classroom and gym equiptment of obese and overweight children over the last 5 years
column7: I am writing to you to obtain information under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. I wish to know how much your council has spent on specialist classroom and gym equipment in schools for obese and overweight children over the last five years (April 2009 to the present day). For example, extra large classroom chairs. If possible, please list the equipment bought and the individual cost of each piece. Please note, I am not interested in any personal details of the children for whom this equipment was purchased. I am only interested in what equipment was purchased and the cost.

Please could I request the following information, regarding meals served at your main staff canteen or cafe on council premises, from your council.Information requested:1) The name (including standard side order, for example fish and chips and mushy peas) of the up to five primary main meals, up to three primary vegetarian meal options, and up to three desert dishes served by the primary staff cafe or canteen at your council's main premises (ie. the place at which most council staff work) on a given day. Please supply the above information for the time period March 31 2014-April 4 2014 inclusive;2) The price per serving in pounds sterling charged to staff of the up to five primary main meals, up to three primary vegetarian meal options, and up to three desert dishes served by the primary staff cafe or canteen at your council's main premises (ie. the place at which most council staff work) on a given day. Please supply the above information for the time period March 31 2014-April 4 2014 inclusive;3) The calorie count (kcal) per serving of the up to five primary main meals, up to three primary vegetarian meal options, and up to three desert dishes served by the primary staff cafe or canteen at your council's main premises (ie. the place at which most council staff work) on a given day. Please supply the above information for the time period March 31 2014-April 4 2014 inclusive; and4) The full name and category (ie. borough, city or district) of the council.Format of information:To aid in the request and to ease the burden on the council, I have attached an Excel spreadsheet ('FOI - Meal calorie count.xls' (127KB)) with detailed column headers (A1:AI1), and input cells (A2:AI2) into which the information can be entered.The tabs at the bottom of the spreadsheet detail each day, allowing for easy input. Cells A2 and B2 request the council's name and category; cell A2 should replicate from the March 31 2014 tab across all tabs but cell B2 does not.If your council serves fewer than the number of options of meal to staff in each category, please leave the requisite cells blank.Please return the Excel spreadsheet in electronic format.

column6: Publishing of responses from consultees on the planning
column7: You will note that TDC are able to publish responses from the statutory consultees on their planning page.  Please tell me when DCC's 'policy' to not publish these responses was established and by whom.  Please provide a reference to this 'policy'.If it was committee please notify me of the date the committee sat.If it was an officer please notify me of their job designation.If this is simple ineptitude or disinterest please notify me of what processes DCC have to improve performance to match that of a District Council in Devon.Please give me the date that this 'policy' was reviewed after publication of NPPF in order to incorporate the requirements of NPPF.  If it has not been reviewed after NPPF please give me the date on which it will be reviewed in order to comply with NPPF.

column6: Return of things that are not to do with DCC
column7: I have used Fix My Street to make a report of a matter that may or may not be DCC's concern. I have received the following (redacted) response: BEGINS Dear Mr Trent Thank you for your email regarding Steps breaking up, trip hazard. I have checked on our land charges and the [redacted area] are not within the Devon County Council Highways remit. They may be the responsibility of Dartmouth Town Council who you may contact on: clerk@dartmouthtowncouncil.org Thank you for taking the time to contact Devon County Council ENDS My question relates to such responses: Question 1: "How many reports of items which prove not to be DCC's responsibility are simply returned to the reporting party without action, and how many are researched and passed to the correct public (or private) body for rectification?" Question 2: "Is this type of response (quoted above) the correct response within the policies and procedures of DCC, or does DCC expect staff to pass matters on to the relevant body." These two questions, though linked, should be regarded as separate FoIA requests. They are each capable of independent answers, neither answer depending upon the answer to the other question I have redacted the area because it is not my intention to call attention to the work of any particular staff member.

column6: Proposed new cycle route to link Ilfracombe to Braunton
column7: Under the Freedom of Information Act, we would like information on the following points please: - 	How much is the proposed cycle route going to cost to purchase from current owners, from Braunton to Willingcott? What exactly is the proposed route, and how far is it in miles?- 	How much will it cost to clear and tarmac the proposed route? - 	How much will the maintenance cost per mile?- 	Which budget does the purchase and then the on-going costs come from?- 	Which services will have to be cut or reduced to pay these costs?- 	How have the proposed benefits to tourism been quantified to warrant the costs to the taxpayer?- 	How much money is it going to contribute to tourism?- 	How are you going to quantify the number of visitors it is going to bring to  the area over and above the numbers already?- 	Who decided that consultation for this project would be after the actual securing of the land for the proposed route?  Why has there been no consultation with the residents neighbouring the proposed route who will be directly affected?- 	What is the proposed plan for the policing and the security of the route?- 	What is the cost of maintaining the Coast to Coast paths per mile and overall how is it currently used?- 	What is the cost of maintaining the South West Coastal Path per mile? On a different note, we are concerned by the fact that landowners have informed us that when the Project Manager, Mr. Graham Cornish, has approached them, he has mentioned that they have the powers to Compulsory Purchase should landowners not agree to sell. Feeling concerned about this pressured method of approach we phoned Mr. Cornish to clarify this point, and he did confirm that he did use this point in his negotiating. Presuming that the above information we have requested will have formed the basis of the project research, we presume that the information is readily available and look forward to your early reply.

column6: Facts and Figures about the Residential Care and Supported Living service provided by DCC
column7: Dear Sir / Madam I m trying to get some high level facts and figures about the Residential Care and Supported Living service provided by Devon County Council. I m hoping you might be able to help. I m trying to get answers to the following questions: Residential Care - Learning Difficulties 1. How much does Devon County Council spend on the provision of residential care for people with learning difficulties annually? 2. How has the total spend on this care provision changed over the past 3 years? 3. What percentage of the service is provided in-house as opposed to being outsourced to the independent sector? 4. Please list all independent providers of this service detailing company name, number of service users, number of hours of care, total spend for the last financial year etc. 5. What are your criteria for selecting preferred independent providers? 6. What is the average daily (or weekly) fee paid to independent providers caring for high-acuity (challenging behaviour) service users with learning difficulties? 7. How many service users funded by Devon County Council received residential care in the last 2 financial years? How many of these service users received residential care in-county versus out-of-county? 8. Are there framework agreements / other contractual arrangements covering this provision? If so, please provide the following: specified rate (hourly/weekly), term, next tender due, number of tiers of preferred providers? 9. Looking forward, how many young people with learning difficulties are there in special schools that will require adult placements in the next 3 years (i.e. 2014/15 2015/16 and 2016/17)? How many of them have conditions on the autistic spectrum? Supported living - Learning Difficulties 10. How much does Devon County Council spend on the provision of supported living for people with learning difficulties annually? 11. How has the total spend on this care provision changed over the past 3 years? 12. What percentage of the service is provided in-house as opposed to being outsourced to the independent sector? 13. Please list all independent providers of this service detailing: company name, number of service users, number of hours of care, hourly rate, total spend for the last financial year etc 14. What are your criteria for selecting preferred independent providers? 15. What is the hourly rate (or range) paid to independent providers? 16. How many service users funded by Devon County Council received supported living in the last 2 financial years? How many of these service users received supported living care in-county versus out-of-county? 17. Are there framework agreements / other contractual arrangements covering this provision? If so, please provide the following: specified rate (hourly/weekly), term, next tender due, number of tiers of preferred providers I hope you can assist me with my research. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me. Kind regards

column6: Planning Applications made to the Council
column7: Hello, under the freedom of information act, may I request the following - The total number of planning applications made to the council in each of the two years before the reform of planning in the National Planning Policy Framework, introduced in April 2012, ie. the year to April 2012 and the year to April 2011.And - the total number of permissions granted for both those years. Further - the total number of planning applications made to the council in each of the two years AFTER the reform of planning in the National Planning Policy Framework, ie. the year to April 2013 and the year to April 2014.And - the total number of permissions granted for both those years.

column6: The proposed closure of residential care homes in Devon
column7: 1. The impact assessment that has been done on the health and welfare of the residents at the twenty residential homes DCC is proposing to close.2. the NHS are quoted as being involved in the impact assessment. I would like to see their analysis on the impact of this proposal.3. A list of the homes in the vicinity of Charlton Lodege, where my father could potentially be moved to that would provide care at less than £450 a week.4. What quality assessments has DCC done on the homes it has selected. If not available I must assume this has only been based on cost.5. column6: Primary place rise impact on playgrounds
column7: How do you predict the number of primary school pupils will change in your area between from 2012 to 2016*?*I am suggesting these dates - but to keep the time/costs down, if you have information included in a published plan for similar dates that will be fine.How many places do you need to provide to meet the population change?How many primary schools will be expanding in your area?How many new primary schools will be opening in your area?How many primary schools in your area will lose playground/playing field space because of the need to expand - ie there will be building on the current playground?How many will primary schools will need to expand pupil numbers but not lose playground/playing field space?How many will primary schools will need to expand pupil numbers and increase playground/playing field space?

On behalf of Policy Exchange, I wish to make a request for information under the Freedom of Information Act.Building Bulletin 99: Briefing Framework for Primary School Projects requires that (page 39) :In any primary school, the total area for halls and studios should include: -          A main hall of at least 120m_ for infants or 140m_ for juniors, sufficient for PE and dance (ideally with a sprung floor and some wall mounted PE apparatus), assemblies  of the whole  school at one time, public performances, parents' evenings and community events;-          An activity studio of at least 45m_ in schools with more than 300 pupil places, for music, drama and 'circle time' if required;-          An additional small hall of at least 80m_ in schools with more than 600 pupil places, for PE without apparatus. Please could you provide information relating to:a) How many maintained primary schools (excluding academies and free schools) comply with this requirement of BB99, andb) What percentage of the total number of maintained primary schools (excluding academies and free schools) this represents.Further to Section 16 of the Act (duty to provide advice and assistance), if you have any queries relating to these requests or need clarification on any issue, I would be grateful if you could contact me.To make answering this request easier, please find attached a template setting out the data required. I would be grateful if you could insert your data into the cells marked yellow and return to 10storeysgate@gmail.com.

column3: Highways Capital Development and Waste Management
column7: Q1     What speed was the fastest driver caught speeding at in your council area so far in 2014, 2013 and 2012 - and what road (and postcode) was this person caught speeding on?Q2        How many speeders did the speed camera that caught the most speeders last year (2013) catch (i.e. how many tickets were issued as a result)?Q3        How much did the speed camera that produced the most income in speeding tickets make in total last year (2013)?Q3        Can you provide the location and/or road name of this speed camera?Q4       How many speeding tickets were issued in your area in the past three years, split by year (2014-to-date, 2013 and 2012).Q5        How much was paid to your council as a result of these speeding tickets?Q6        How many speed cameras are there in your council area - and how many of these are switched on and off?Q7       How many speed cameras has your council installed over the past five years (2010 to 2014-to-date)? Please provide a figure for each year.Q8       How many speed cameras have your council removed/decommissioned for each year over the past five years (2010 to 2014-to-date)? Please provide a figure for each year.Q9      Did you made any alterations to speed limits in your council area last year (2013)? Yes/NoQ10      If yes, how many times did this happen last year and in which locations?Q11        Do you believe that your council has made progress in reducing speeding over the past 12 years? Yes/NoQ12       Does your council plan to take further action to clamp down on speeding over the next 12 months, and if so can you provide details?

column6: Service contracts let by the county
column7: Please send me the evaluation criteria for the last 5 service contracts let by the county Specifically I am interested in: The weighting between price and other aspects such as quality etc. Typically this will have been in the instructions to tenderers at the final stage of bidding (ITT). Often it will have been given as a ratio e.g. 60% price : 40% quality For these same procurements please also send the formula for calculating the price scores for these bids. Again this is likely to be found on the instructions to tenderers. E.g. Lowest price gets 100% of available score. Second lowest price gets 80% of available score. Note: I am not requesting the actual prices bid from the tenderers, it is the instructions and method used in the evaluation I am requesting If you will find it easier to send the full document (e.g. the full instructions to tenderers) that is fine as long as the above information is included in the document Thank you Nigel Thacker Email for contact: nigelthacker@btinternet.com

column6: Information regarding Foetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders
column7: I am sending this request under the Freedom of Information Act to ask for the following information:1.For each of the past five financial years (2013, 2012, 2011, 2010, 2009) and this year-to date (11th April 2014) please state how many children amongst your looked after population have got a diagnosis of Foetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (FASD) (e.g Foetal Alcohol Syndrome (FAS), Alcohol Related Neurological Disorder (ARND), or Foetal Alcohol Affects (FAE)).2. For each of the past five financial years (2013, 2012, 2011, 2010, 2009) and this year-to date (11th April 2014) please state the number of children to whom you are currently offering additional educational support who have a got a diagnosis of Foetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (FASD)?3. For each of the past five financial years (2013, 2012, 2011, 2010, 2009) and this year-to date (11th April 2014) how much in total is your council spending to provide additional educational support to those children with a diagnosis of Foetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (FASD)?Please send me this information by e-mail to emily.mann01@bbc.co.uk you have any queries about this request please contact me on 0161 335 6459If you are encountering practical difficulties complying with this request, please contact me so that we can discuss the matter and if necessary I can modify the request.

column6: The first 10 cases of children that were taken into care by the authority in 2014
column7: In relation to the first ten cases of children that were taken into care (either interim or full) by your authority in the 2014 calendar year please provide me with the following information in connection with each of the three cases.1.	The sex of the child?2.	The age of the child?3.	If any of the following factors are recorded in the papers you hold on the case as having been a factor in the council's decision to take the child into care: (a) malnourishment of the child, (b) obesity of the child, (c) drug taking by the child, (d) excessive alcohol consumption by the child, (e) inappropriate or dangerous sexual behaviour by the child, (f) proximity to a dangerous dog.NOTE: Please note that if you feel providing an answer to Q.1 and Q.2 with Q3 would breach S.40 then I would request that you ONLY answer Q.3. If you decide to take that option I would ask you to justify your decision as I reserve my right to appeal against it.

This request is therefore made in the interest of transparency.

FOI regarding care procedures FAO Director of Children's ServicesThis is to ask for the procedures that are in place 1. to ensure that COURT ORDERS for CONTACT with children in care are being complied with;2. to allow parents to enforce orders for contact when they are not being adhered to;3. to ensure that embassies and consulates are being informed when non-UK children are taken into care;4. to arrange for Consular visits of non-UK children in care.Finally, this is to alert you to the UK Delegation of parents who went to Brussels in support of our petition to Abolish Adoptions without Parental Consent on 19 March 2014.Among a number of links reporting on the event, you may find this one the most informative: http://victims-unite.net/2014/04/12/brussels-video-clips-on-tv-portuguese-bbc-look-north-and-now-slovak-tv/

I am writing to you from ITV's Tonight programme to request information under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. We would like to request information about some of the services offered by the council relating to both environmental services and pest control.In order to assist you with this request, I am outlining my query as specifically as possible. What was your total departmental spending on environmental health and services from 1st April 2008 to 31st March 2009? By 'environmental health and services' we are interested in total departmental spending for any and all departments concerned with areas such street cleaning, refuse collection, and the general upkeep of the local area.What was your total departmental spending on environmental health and services from 1st April 2013 to 31st March 2014? By 'environmental health and services' we are interested in total departmental spending for any and all departments concerned with areas such street cleaning, refuse collection, and the general upkeep of the local area.Can you give us a breakdown of spending on the following areas between 1st April 2008 to 31st March 2009?-Street cleaning-Refuse collection-Pest control Can you give us a breakdown of spending on the following areas between 1st April 2013 to 31st March 2014?-Street cleaning-Refuse collection-Pest control How many full time employees did you have working in the following areas between 1st April 2008 to 31st March 2009?How many full time employees did you have working in the following areas between 1st April 2013 to 31st March 2014?-Street cleaning-Refuse collection-Pest control  Did you offer an in house pest control service to the public between 1st April 2008 to 31st March 2009?Did you offer an in house pest control service to the public between 1st April 2013 to 31st March 2014?If you currently offer an in house pest control service, do you have any plans to cease doing so within the next 12 months?If you no longer offer an in house pest control service, do you pay an external company for pest control services? Do you charge the public for pest control services?1.	How much do you charge for pest control services? Please provide details.2.	Have these charges increased since 2008? If so, please provide cost details.

The names and addresses of the organisation or companies who own the premises referred to in (1).If you could provide the details in an excel format, in the fashion of this request please -https://www.whatdotheyknow.com/request/all_commercial_premises_4#incoming-315504

Under the Freedom of Information Act 2000, I request Devon to provide me with the following information.-         How many pupils in reception, year 1 and year 2 does Devon currently provide free school meals to?-         How many pupils in reception, year 1 and year 2 will Devon provide free school meals to in September 2014?-         What was the average cost of a primary school meal in Devon in a) 2012 b) 2013?-         Is the universal infant free school meals capital in the financial year 2014-15 that Devon has been allocated sufficient to fund the project there (please answer with a Yes or No)? -         If no, please provide the estimated shortfall of funding.I would prefer to receive this information electronically.If my request is denied in whole or in part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the Act. I will also expect you to release all non-exempt material. I reserve the right to appeal your decision to withhold any information or to charge excessive fees.

This is a Freedom of Information request. I would like to know the following information:1.	For each of the last five years, please provide details of all compensation claims paid out to council staff members. Please include: The department/area the individual worked in (to as much detail as possible without breaching Data Protection), how much was paid out, why it was paid (ie, what happened to mean they needed compensation), how many successful claims were made.2.	For each of the last five years, how many unsuccessful compensation claims were made by council staff members?

Please could I request the following information under the Freedom of Information Act. In respect of financial year 2013-14: 1. How much did your local authority spend in total in relation to goods and services procured from companies and third parties?2. Do you record the national origin of companies or third parties who have been awarded contracts under your procurement arrangements?3. Do you have a policy to prioritise procurement from UK based companies?4. In financial year 2013-14 how much did your local authority spend with UK based companies or third parties defined as where the majority of the organisation's work was undertaken by UK based workers in the United Kingdom?5. In financial year 2013-14 how much did your local authority spend with UK based companies or third parties defined as where the company is head quartered in the United Kingdom?

I would like to request the following information on whistleblowing cases.1.  Please state the number of reported whistleblowing cases involving staff and officers of the authority for 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 to date.2. Please break down the number of cases in each calendar year.3. In each case, please state whether wrong doing was found against the staff or officer and what actions were taken, including but not limited to: dismissed for gross misconduct, fraud, theft, a final written warning, a verbal warning, referred to the Standards and Ethics Board etc.4. Please state the number of reported whistleblowing cases involving elected members for 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 to date.5. Please break down the number of cases in each year.6. In each case, please state whether wrong doing was found against the elected member and what actions were taken, including but not limited to: dismissed for gross misconduct, fraud, theft, a final written warning, a verbal warning, referred to the Standards and Ethics Board etc.7. In 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 how many elected members have been investigated for allegations of fraud, corruption, misappropriation of funds, acceptance of bribes or gifts contrary to the Bribery Act 2010 or theft?Please break this data down by calendar year.8. In each case, what were the outcomes of any such investigations?9. In 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 how many local authority staff and officers have been investigated for allegations of fraud, corruption, misappropriation of funds, acceptance of bribes or gifts contrary to the Bribery Act 2010 or theft?Please break this data down by calendar year.10. In each case, what were the outcomes of any such investigations?11.  Please supply a copy of both your Whistleblowing Policy and your Anti Bribery Policy.

I am writing in relation to the council tax support scheme operated by your local authority in 2014/15.Question 1How many people will this year pay either more council tax or council tax for the first time as a result of the localisation and reductions to the previous council tax benefit scheme that operated until April 2013?Question 2How many people receiving council tax support which amounts to less than 100% of their liability are:a)   Carers?b)   In receipt of disability benefits?c)   In receipt of a war widow/ war widower pension?d)   In receipt of a war disablement pension (pre-April 2005 disablement)?e)   In receipt of payments from the Armed Forces Compensation Scheme (post-April 2005 disablement)?

column3: Highways Capital Development and Waste Management
column7: We would like to request the following information: Policies and procedures1) What policies, procedures and regulations does the local authority have in place to manage, monitor or regulate the following: a) Street furniture, such as advertising boards or caf furnitureb) Parking on pavements     c) Wheelie bins that cause a pavement obstructiond) Shared spaces / surfaces                                                                                                                                    Parking2) Has the local authority taken over the enforcement of minor parking offences from the police and if so which department has responsibility for this?Shared spaces3) In the last 5 years how many shared space / surface schemes have been developed in the local authority area and where are they situated?4) How many shared space / surface proposed schemes have been turned down on grounds of safety?Equality monitoring and consulting blind and partially sighted people5) During the planning process for changes to the built and street environment how does the local authority meet its Equality Act 2010 duty to monitor the effect on disabled people? How are blind and partially sighted people consulted during the planning process?6) When the local authority plans disruption such as pavement closures and other temporary obstructions such as scaffolding, how does the local authority meet its duty under the Equality Act 2010 to monitor the affect on disabled people? How do you consult with blind and partially sighted people about such disruption?  Pavement repairs and accidents7) How much has the local authority spent on pavement repairs over the last five years?2013/142012/132011/122010/112009/108) How much has the local authority spent on litigation awards to people who have been injured from pavements in need of repair over the last five years?2013/142012/132011/122010/112009/109) Over the last five years, how many blind and partially sighted people have received compensation as a result of injuring themselves on a broken pavement?Pedestrian Crossings10) What percentage of the pedestrian crossings maintained by the local authority, have:a) Tactile rotating cones?b) Audible beeps?c) Both?Bin collection11) Does the local authority have any sort of scheme in place to help residents who are registered visually impaired to take out rubbish and take out/return recycling containers?Providing alternative formats12) Over the last five years, how many council planning applications were given to residents in the following formats? Also please state the actual number of planning applications made each year.          	Braille          	Audio          	Word Documents/ Clear print	Total no of planning applications2013/14				2012/13				2011/12				2010/11				2009/10				--

column6: Action taken against Council tenants for rent arrears
column7: PLEASE NOTE: These questions refer to actions taken against council tenants for rent arrears only. I realise re: questions 3 and 4 that the tenants evicted will not necessarily be those issued NSPs re: questions 1 and 2. 1)How many notices seeking possession for rent arrears did you issue between April 1 2013 and April 1 2014? 2)How many notices seeking possession for rent arrears did you issue between April 1 2012 and April 1 2013? 3)How many people were evicted for rent arrears between April 1 2013 and April 1 2014? 4) How many people were evicted for rent arrears between April 1 2012 and April 1 2013? 5) If the number of NSPs or evictions has increased, can you give reasons as to why?

column6: Various Framworks/Contract - Start and End Dates
column7: I hope you don't mind me contacting you.  I have been looking at various frameworks/ contracts/ agreements on Tenders Electronic Daily and I was wondering if you could tell me the start and end dates (and values if possible) of the below frameworks/contracts:--        CP972-13 Tithebarn Link Road Phase 1.              (438239-2013; United Kingdom-Exeter: Construction work)-         CP924-13 Provision of Devon Independent Living Integrated Service.                (433221-2013; United Kingdom-Exeter: Medical equipments, pharmaceuticals and personal care products)-         Collection and Transportation of waste paper & glass bottles.                (406417-2013; United Kingdom-Exeter: Refuse transport services)We need this information as we are supporting a client on some frameworks/ contracts/ agreements but to understand them we need to complete our records. I hope this is all the information you need but please feel free to contact myself on the below lines.

I would like to submit the following query under the Freedom of Information Act 2000.Please can you tell me -1/ Has your authority undertaken any sorting and sifting of paper/documents/files, in the form of a project or otherwise?  If so, can you send me a copy of the project plan?2/ Do you have any information that you could share with me on how you would or have tackled such a project? And at what cost? i.e for length of time, staffing, other resources e.g. on-site shredder/ confidential sacks/ bins.3/ Does your authority use or developed a retention schedule? If so, please can you send me a copy?4/ How you decide what paper to keep, scan and destroy? And if you document what is kept, scanned or destroyed, please can you tell me how? 5/ Has your authority developed and deployed a scanning strategy? If so, please can you share your strategy documents with me?6/ Does your authority have an in-house paper storage facility, or does it use a third party contractor i.e. outsourced storage contract?7/ If you have an in-house solution, please can you send me any documentation on how this was developed, managed/ staffed and at what running costs?Please do not hesitate to contact me should any part of my request require clarification, or require me to narrow my request.Many thanks for your time and assistance. I look forward to hearing from you.

column7: I am inquiring about the Teckal exemption in relation to NPS South West:In order to satisfy the first condition of the Teckal exemption, the controlling contracting authority or authorities must possess "a power of decisive influence over both strategic objectives and significant decisions of the other legal entity".From the contents of document CX/11/24 (Task group report on the contract with NPS South West Ltd.) it appears that this requirement did not seem to be clearly defined, or understood, in March 2011.  In fact, the report says that DCC has "chosen to relinquish control" so if this has not been addressed, Teckal cannot apply.Please provide details of Devon CC's contractual agreements with NPS South West that satisfy this condition, including the dates of such agreements and the minutes of the meetings when the contracts were agreed.

Please advise me how many times the DCC has used the Teckal Exemption from 2009 onwards.Please provide me with details of dates, contracts, contract values etc.Please also provide me with the various meeting minutes for when the decisions were made to use the Teckal Exemption.

Hello I would like to have details on if Mr Ward has been viewing any secretly recorded CCTV hidden within the loft area of number 5 churscombe green? As lead to believe this household has been secretly recording my home with this hidden but clearly visible cctv with the blessings of the council anti social officer seen entering this ladies home to go view her videos? I have daughters 14 years old and 6 months and very concerned that it is tried to be secret CCTV not openly seen?Also I would like copies of any photos the anti social officer has taken of churscombe green over the last 10 years?And also have a complete copy of south hams council policy in dealing with what is current law on home owners having cctv for private homes and the councils policy on informing neighbours who have CCTV in use?

It relates to exclusions and SEN statements and assessments from schools under LEA control.  I have asked for the figures from the last academic year, but if there are no figures yet for 2012/2013, then I would appreciate the latest available figures and if you could please state from which year the figures relate.How many requests were there for SEN statements assessments during 2012/2013 (or latest figures available)? How many of these requests were from parents?Were any requests for SEN statement assessments turned down?  If yes, how many?If yes, how many parental requests for SEN statement assessments were turned down?How many pupils were permanently excluded during the academic year ending in July 2013? Did any of these pupils have a statement of educational needs - if yes, how many?Were any of these pupils on School Action or School Action plus or Early School Action, Early School Action Plus?  If yes, how many?How many of these pupils subsequently went into a Pupil Referral Unit?Did any excluded pupils with any level of SEN including School Action categories subsequently receive LEA funding to attend a special school or independent school? If yes, how many?Did any case involving an excluded pupil with SEN go to tribunal to obtain funding for independent education? If yes, how many?What is the percentage of pupils in Pupil Referral Units within the LEA achieving 5 GCSE passes (A*-G) what is the percentage achieving 5 GCSE passes (A*-C) in the last year for which results figures are available? Please state for which year the figures relate.

column3: Highways Capital Development and Waste Management
column7: For the purposes of this request "documents" includes but is not limited to letters, memoranda internal or otherwise, notes, notes of meetings, minutes,  e-mails, e-mail attachments and images, photographs, video film in any format. Please include all documents relating to details of policy, procedures, decision-making, reports, minutes of meetings.Please note that the request covers each of the last two years ended 31st March 2014.  Please Note: The abbreviation "PCN" has been used to refer to "Penalty Charge Notices" issued under decriminalised parking legislation.  If you have not implemented the Traffic Management Act 2004 or In Scotland The Road Traffic Act 1991 and are issuing Fixed Penalty Charge Notices for parking contraventions please give your answers by reference to the number of Fixed Penalty Charge Notices.Could you please supply me with the following information and documents:-The number of PCNs issuedThe number of PCNs cancelled at the first informal appeal.The number of PCNs cancelled after the formal appeal.The number of PCNs cancelled after a hearing before a parking adjudicator or in the case of Fixed Penalties a magistrates court PCNs cancelled after the appeals went to the parking adjudicator but before a hearing.For each stage:The number of PCNs cancelled where the PCN was issued to a person with a residents' permit.The number of PCNs cancelled where the PCN was issued to a person with a disabled badge.The number of PCNs cancelled where the PCN was issued to a person who is an employee.The number of PCNs cancelled where the PCN was issued to a council contractor with a residents' permit.The number  of PCNs cancelled where the PCN was issued to a person not in the above category.(a) Does the council allow and consider letters of support from the managers of employees who have received a parking fine(b) Does the council have any current serving employees under active investigation for submitting a false parking fine appeal ? (c) Does the council allow the managers of its car parking department or parking enforcement department and/or the department or team which investigates the misuse of disabled  to submit letters of support on behalf of council employees who have received a parking fine.

column6: Proposed highways works to Halfway House Junction
column7: The minutes of the meeting of Woodbury Parish Council on 14th January 2013 show that Devon County Council signed a Section 278 Highways Agreement with Aggregate Industries UK Ltd to enable work to take place at the junction of the B3180 and A3052 (beside the Halfway House Inn) in East Devon.The minutes say the following:BLACKHILL/VENN OTTERY QUARRIES LIAISON COMMITTEE - Proposed Highway works to Halfway House Junction -  Email from John Penny (SW Aggregate Industries UK Ltd) advising that the contractor appointed to undertake the proposed highways works to the Halfway House junction has been unable to commence the works as previously planned.  This is due to unresolved pre-construction, CDM co-ordinator and service media issues which must be resolved prior to commencement of the works.  Aggregates is disappointed that a further delay has occurred and is making every effort to have matters resolved to ensure that they can take place to the highest operational and safety criteria at the earliest opportunity, commencing within the next few weeks.  The necessary S278 highways agreement has been signed and completed with Devon CC, this being the legal document to allow the works to take place to the agreed design.  He will update shortly following the next Quarries Liaison meetingI would like to know what work Aggregate Industries and Devon County Council agreed should take place and how much money the company agreed to pay.

column7: http://www.devon.gov.uk/finance-structure-chart.pdf Please let me know the the annual  costs pertaining to the link above and please include secretarial costs.Clarification  Received:- It will suffice for my FOIA request  for the operating costs of those legal personnel  in the pie chart. ----- Original Message ----- From: access to information - mailbox To: Sheila Oliver Sent: Thursday, May 08, 2014 11:41 AMSubject: FOI IR1159864 - Clarification UnclearDear Ms Oliver,I am sorry, but we are still unclear exactly what information you are requesting.  You refer to 'operating costs of those legal personnel in the pie chart'.  We would respectfully point out that there are no 'legal' personnel on this pie chart, it purely pertains to Finance.  In addition, please can you confirm what you mean by 'operating' costs?Are you seeking salary information for the Finance roles specified in the pie chart?We would be grateful for your clarification please, and are unable to proceed until we are clear as to what you are seeking. Many thanksYours sincerelyJenny Goodall Dear Ms Goodall Yes, I am seeking salary bands for the finance pie chart personnel Kind regards Sheila

column6: Suicides and data from recent audits
column7: As you will be aware, before the introduction of the Health and Social Care Act 2012, the government recommended that all Primary Care Trusts (PCTs) conduct annual audits of suicide trends in their district. I am writing to you to request the data from these audits and data from any audits that have been conducted subsequently in your local authority. Specifically, I would like to know the number of adult suicides in your local authority and the number of these suicides where a terminal illness has been recorded.I am requesting this data to conduct research that follows on from a 2011 study, based on data obtained from a Freedom of Information request to 147 PCTs in 2011, which indicated that approximately 2% (although this was a conservative estimate) of suicides in England are committed by somebody with a terminal illness.[1] Whilst I understand there are concerns with the reliability of this data, I am requesting this information in order to ensure that we have an up-to-date picture of the issue.

My name is Jason Frommholz and I work for the halow project. The halow project is dedicated to creating opportunities and supporting young people aged 16-35 with a learning disability so that they are able to live independent, meaningful, fulfilled lives and become more involved in their local community. We are currently reviewing the services that we offer, and our project director has asked myself and a colleague to look locally and nationally at organisations/schemes that have provided opportunities for young people with learning difficulties to gain employment and maintain employment. If you are able to answer the questions below it would be very helpful indeed. Alternatively could these questions be forwarded onto the correct department, I would really appreciate it, so I can follow up. -          The number of people with learning disabilities supported into i) paid work ii) unpaid work (including volunteering) in 2013.-          The age ranges of these people.-          The number of people with learning disabilities you have been able to help gain a vocation successfully (i.e. met the individuals requests; e.g. just wanting volunteer work/just wanting short term paid employment/just wanting short term work experience etc) in 2013.-          The number of people with learning disabilities you has not been able to help and possible reasons why.-          Your thoughts on the main barriers to paid employment for people with learning disabilities. I understand that these are quite specific questions which you may not have data on; if possible could I have an emailed response either way saying if you are able or not able to help. This would also be very helpful.
