column6: Proposed route for cycle path NCN2
column7: With regard to the route options of the proposed NCN2 cycle path connection between Littlehempston and Totnes that is being considered by Devon County Council at present, to complete the link between Totnes and Newton Abbot and with the sharing of the part publically funded South Devon Railway footbridge in mind, please could you advise Who the land owners are on this route by name, company, charity or organisation? What communication you have had with them about the provision of consent for this route to be used as part of the NCN2 route going north out of Totnes? What their objections are, if any, to the use of this route as a cycle path and walkway? What measures you have taken to date to alleviate their concerns? What evidence you have to demonstrate that you have tried to alleviate their concerns? Furthermore I would like a copy of the details and correspondence between DCC and the land owners in relation to all of the above, and if unavailable, an explanation as to why that is? Additionally please could you elaborate what the rationale and justification would be in applying a Compulsory Purchase Order on any landowner blocking the creation of this proposed route for the NCN2 cycle path from Littlehempston to Totnes. Can Devon County Council confirm that they gave the South Devon Railway 37.000 in April 1993 towards the construction cost of the footbridge spanning the river Dart at Totnes and to DCC s knowledge was any employee of DCC also a member of the South Devon Railway at that time?

Freedom of information request pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act 2000 Dear Sir/Madam, I would like to request copies of the following documents which are in the possession (whether physically or digitally) of Devon County Council pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act 2000: All correspondence (whether letters or emails) or other materials (such as minutes of meetings or records of conversations, consultation documents, studies etc) which refer in any way to: 1) The decision to propose greater cuts in the Library Consultation to smaller and less well-used libraries than large libraries. 2) The decision to put Braunton Library in the "smaller and less well-used libraries" category. 3) The criteria used to categorise libraries (including how the catchment population and usage of libraries should calculated and/or defined) Just so that there is no doubt as to where I am coming from, I am a local resident of Braunton and am campaigning to save Braunton Library. In particular I am extremely concerned that not only is it unfair to pick on smaller libraries in principle, but the reality is that Braunton library serves over 13,000 people, just a few hundred less than some medium to large libraries, and is a much loved, lively and important part of our community with 1 in 5 people actively using it. My own background is that I am Senior Director of Global Campaigns for Save the Children and also Chair of the Trustees of Surfers Against Sewage. I have three children who go to school in Braunton and as a family we are extremely active users of the library. I understand that choices need to be made about how to manage budgets across Devon but I really do want the Council to understand that in the case of Braunton that a mistake has been made when proposing cuts which might ultimately close the Braunton library off the back of already significant cuts to opening hours which have already been made. As for the FOI request, my preference would be to receive documents by email to save on cost (and trees) and I would also like to be told of any potential cost before anything for which I might be charged is incurred. Please feel free to contact me if you need clarification. I look forward to hearing from you further. Very best wishes, Ben Hewitt Tel: 07887 635 801 Email: benhewitt_uk@yahoo.com

Customer emailed CRT asking the following...' I know there are Village Agents in Somerset. Are there any in Devon? If so which villages are covered?Emailed customer asking to clarify what a 'Village Agent' is? Response is as follows...Village Agents are local people who work in rural areas to assist and inform isolated individuals. They bridge the gap between these individuals and the organisations that are able to offer help and support. They are particularly concerned with rural transport options, health and wellbeing issues and access to government and local authority support. They go out to the people rather than expecting the people to get to Exeter (or similar) for advice, information and support. I know that there are Village Agents in at least 15 areas of the country, including Somerset, BANES, North Somerset and Wiltshire.As a county with a large rural community I thought that Devon might have Village Agents too.(See attached emails for more detail)

column7: Please find below a series of questions I am seeking a response too, requesting the data under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act.I would be grateful if you could supply as full a response as possible to each question and would be happy to accept any reports/cabinet papers/briefing notes etc... as supporting material.  We are trying to collate as much information as possible by Friday 30th May and so please could you respond asap.I am trying to gain an understanding of how Local Authorities deliver their statutory duty for Educational Visits and the following questions will help with this:1) What does your Local Authority's Educational Visits support comprise of?2) Please can you specify who you support - is it maintained schools, LA young person services/academies, all establishments?3) Do you sell/trade your Educational Visits services and if you do, who too, academies/independent/out of LA establishments/settings etc?4) How do you staff this service i.e. what is the number of FTE staff and what does the staff structure chart look like (not names but numbers of managers, line reports etc)?5) Which service area/department does Educational Visits sit within?6) How is the LA's Educational Visits service funded?7) Please can you supply information about the approximate turnover/costs to your LA?8) Please can you provide the name, telephone number and e-mail address of the colleague who managers/oversees the Educational Visits programme of work at your Local Authority?9) Please can you supply any examples of good practice relating to your Educational Visits work?

In accordance with the Freedom of Information Act, please provide me with the following information:- 	Is Domestic Violence a local criteria for inclusion of families in the Troubled Families Programme?- 	Has any assessment been made of the incidence of domestic violence within families involved with the Troubled Families Programme?- 	What percentage of families in the Troubled Families do you estimate have incidence of domestic violence?- 	What estimates have been made of incidence of wider violence within families involved with the Troubled Families Programme?- 	Is there a named, dedicated worker for each family involved with the Troubled Families Programme?- 	How many families within the Troubled Families Programme does each dedicated, named key worker have?- 	Does the local authority use a contract-based approach between the key worker and the family?- 	Does the council monitor the number of families re-entering the Troubled Families Programme?- 	How many of the "turned around families" who exited the Troubled Families Programme currently match the criteria of eligibility for the Troubled Families Programme? And if there are any, have they re-entered the programme?- 	To whom does the council report the number of families re-entering the Troubled Families Programme to?- 	Are members made aware of statistics on re-entry to the Troubled Families Programme?- 	Please provide any data or reports regarding re-entry to the Troubled Families Programme?- 	What savings, across all services, do you anticipate resulting from a family successfully exiting the Troubled Families Programme? In which budget would savings accrue? How will such savings be accounted for?Please send me any information electronically. If some parts of this request are easier to answer than other, please release available data as soon as possible rather than delay the entire request.

column7: Devon County Council, In your Devon Domestic and Sexual Abuse and Violence strategy it states that 2000 women in Devon are living with the consequences of FGM (Female Genital Mutilation). 1. What statistics does DCC have in regards to the number of girls and women who are currently at risk of FGM? 2. How many referrals have been sent to MASH (Multi Agency Safegarding Hub) in the last year regarding FGM? (May 2013 - April 2014) 3. Of those referrals how many were initiated by teachers? I look forward to your swift response Alexis Wright Founding Director Njenni Enterprise

This request concerns responses to requests to accommodate in secure accommodation children detained by the police under section38 Police and Criminal Evidence Act 1984 and who should be placed by the local authority in whose area the police station is located (or the local authority where the child ordinarily resides or is already looked after by them)in accordance with section 21(2)(b) Children Act 1989. You will be aware that section 21(2)(a) addresses the emergency placement of children detained by the police for their own protection and thus both categories of children are considered by Parliament as falling within the same category. It will inform research which follows on from a similar exercise undertaken last year when the quality of information provided by secure units stood out and was excellent.For the last 12 month period for which you have information available, breaking it down according to age and gender:1. How many beds does your secure unit have broken down by gender?How many are designated as suitable for receiving children detained under section 38? What is the cost of a bed per night?2. What are your procedures for referral of section 38 cases? In particular, at what level within the Local Authority proposing to make the placement do you require approval?3. How many requests concerning detained children have you received and from which Local Authorities? Can you break this down, even approximately, into LAs less than 100 miles from you; LAs between100 -200 miles distant; LAs in excess of 200 miles from you? If any initial  referrals (some police may 'shop around' before encouraging an out-of-hours service to make a formal request) were made directly by the police please advise of brief details including which Constabulary  (some police may 'shop around' before encouraging an out-of-hours service to make a formal request).4. In relation to the days on which those requests were made did you have a vacancy? Please express this as a simple percentage of Yes's and No's.5. In relation to those requests where you had a vacancy what numbers and percentage of children were transferred to your unit?6. How many transfers were actually made by which Local Authority?7. Liaising with the Youth Offending Service of the Local Authority making the placement if necessary, of those placed with you under section 38PACE/21(2)(b) Children Act, what were the outcomes at first court appearance, that is was a child granted bail; remanded to local authority accommodation; or remanded to youth detention accommodation?

I am writing under the Freedom of Information Act to request information on planning obligations ("s106 agreements") involving supermarkets (see definition below).Please note I am interested in the following supermarket chains: Tesco, Asda, Sainsburys, Morrisons, Waitrose, Co-Op, Iceland, M&S, Aldi and Lidl (including other forms of their names). I am requesting applications for developments for any of these supermarkets, including those made by the supermarkets themselves and those made by other companies where the development will be one of the supermarkets.More specifically1. Since May 1, 2009a) Please provide a copy of all s106 agreements related to planning applications for the construction or redevelopment of supermarkets, in their original form, and then a copy of any applications to modify the s106 agreements, and any subsequent s106 agreements. For each s106 agreement please state the name of the applicant and supermarket chain involved, the location, and the most recent planning reference number for the site it refers to. For applications to modify, please state if the modifications were approved.Please also state the legislation which any application to modify is made under. For example, but not limited to:- Applications to modify agreements using the Growth and Infrastructure Act (clause 7) - Affordable Housing Modification - which came into effect on 26 April 2013 (when the clause was introduced to s106 of the 1990 Town and Country Planning Act). - Applications to modify agreements in which a person bound by the planning obligation can seek to have the obligation modified or discharged after five years. - Instances in which provisions made in section 106 agreements have been appealed under an amendment (28th Feb 2013) to the The Town and Country Planning (Modification and Discharge of Planning Obligations) Regulations 1992. - All other instances where applications have been submitted to modify original s106 agreements.

column7: THIS REQUEST IS FOR COUNTY, BOROUGH & UNITARY COUNCILS AND DOES NOT RELATE TO PUBLIC HEALTH FUNERALS PER SE. IF THE CASE WAS PASSED TO A 3RD PARTY FOR A PUBLIC HEALTH ACT FUNERAL TO BE CARRIED OUT, THEN PLEASE PROVIDE DETAILS OF THE CASE AS PER THE QUESTIONS BELOW. THANKS!I would like to know details of anyone who has been under the care of the County Council Guardianship/Deputyship Team* who has died with no known next of kin from 1/6/2013 to the day of your reply. *The Guardianship Team is known by different names at different County Councils, for example: Client Affairs, Protection Team, Adult Care Team, Deputyship Team, Appointeeship Team or other similar name.Please include:1.	 the deceased's full name(s)2.	the date they died3.	the approximate value of their estate(s)4.	their dates of birth or age at death whether or not they were married, divorced, single, or widowed 5.	the maiden surnames of married females or widows 6.	their  address at death7.	the date when a referral was made of this estate to the Treasury Solicitor or Duchy of Lancaster or Cornwall or any other 3rd party to research or administer and the name of the 3rd party concerned8.	if a referral to the Treasury Solicitor or Duchy has not yet been made and you think it will be made soon could you advise me of this too.9.	if a case is still  undecided or awaiting referral, please also advise of details.

I want to make a Freedom of Information request, could you please send me the following information with regards to the organisation's Mobile Phones:1.       Existing Supplier(s) - If there is more than one supplier please split the contract up including the contract value, number of users, duration, contract dates and internal contact details.2.       Annual Average Spend- Can you please provide me with the average annual spend over the 3 years. If this is a new contract can you please provide the estimated annual spend.3.       Number of Users- Number of connections for each network provider.4.       Duration of the contract- please state if the contract also include contract extensions for each provider.5.       Call off Contract Start Date- please provide me with information on when the framework commenced and include the month and year and day if possible for each network provider.6.       Call off Contract Expiry Date- please provide me with information on when the framework expires and include the month and year and day if possible for each network provider.7.       Contract/Framework Agreement Review Date- please provide me with the month and year and day if possible of when the organisation plans to review it mobile phone contracts for each network provider.8.       The person within the organisation responsible for this particular contract. Can you send me the full contact details Contact Name, Job Title, Contact Number and direct email address for each network provider.If the has more than one supplier can you please split the contract into to so they show information for both supplier including, total contract value, users, duration, and the other dates.If the supply of mobile phones if provided by an external organisation please state the name of the organisation, the number of users (Connections of your organisation only) and the name of the network provider.Please can you provide me with the latest information- If the organisation's is currently out to tender please can you also state the approx. date of award along with the information above.If this contract was awarded within the past three months can you please provide me with a shortlist of suppliers that bid on the contract?

Disadvantaged Two Year Old Early Education1. Whether the local authority had definitely secured sufficient places for every disadvantaged two year old who became eligible for free nursery education in September 2013 in 'outstanding' or 'good' (Ofsted inspected) settings (please answer with 'Yes' or 'No')If the answer to Question 2 is 'No':a)      how many places the local authority were expected to secure by the Department for Education;b)      How many disadvantaged two year olds are in places which are not in settings rated 'outstanding' or 'good' by Ofsted in the local authority3. (please answer 'Yes' or 'No')If the answer to Question 3 is 'No':a) how many places the local authority are expected to secure by the Department for Education by September 2014;b) how many places the local authority has secured now, and;c) when the local authority expects the target number of places to be met.

column6: Homecare outsourced service providers for adult service users
column7: I am enquiring only about your use of externally procured/ commissioned homecare service providers. Regarding service user types, I am enquiring about all types: learning disability, elderly, mental health, physical disability, dementia, etc. Regarding service user age, I am enquiring about all service users aged 18 or above. I am NOT enquiring about residential social care, residential nursing care, or health care in the community.1. What is the hourly rate you currently pay service providers to provide homecare services:   a) average hourly rate for all service providers?    b) lowest hourly rate for the service provider paid the least per hour?   c) highest hourly rate for the service provider paid the most per hour?2a. How many service users were provided homecare services during 2013/14?2b. How many homecare packages of care were provided during 2013/14?3. What was the total volume of homecare hours provided during 2013/14?4. What was the total expenditure on homecare (excluding via direct payments) provided during:   (i) 2011/12?   (ii) 2012/13?   iii) 2013/14?5. What was the total Direct Payments expenditure (on homecare, day care, other care, etc ... ie all types of uses) in:   (i) 2011/12?   (ii) 2012/13?   iii) 2013/14?6. Sometimes a service user is in hospital, or is in an interim care bed in a residential home, awaiting to go back home. But it is not possible to find a homecare service provider who has capacity, or who agrees to provide the service. As a result the service user is stuck, and cannot go home, because they are awaiting homecare. Other people are living at home but need homecare services, but no service provider has agreed to provide the care; so again the service user is awaiting homecare.   a. At this moment right now, how many service users do you have awaiting homecare?7. How many homecare service providers do you use currently (i.e. that your Authority has a live contract with them to provide homecare services)?8. List the names of the homecare service providers that provide:   a) an initial intensive reablement service    b) an ongoing reablement service (i.e. after the service user has received a period of intensive reablement)   c) a service where your Authority sets outcomes (instead of Time & Task) that the service provider then has to achieve9. List the top ten service providers that you spend the most money on each year. 10. State the name, job title and email address for the officer who manages the homecare contracts for your Authority?

column7: Under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), I request a copy of the quarterly public records from the latest quarter for the following information, if possible in Excel format:1. Names and vintage years of all infrastructure funds or partnerships in the Devon County Council pension schemes portfolio.2. Percentage portion of the pension fund targeted to be allocated to infrastructure, and the percentage portion of the fund currently invested in infrastructure.3. Most updated information available on amount committed to the partnerships and amount drawn by the partnerships.4. Distributions made to the Devon County Council pension scheme to date by each individual partnership.5. Target Internal rates of return (IRRs) for each partnership.  Please include data for Net and Gross IRRs if available.6. Internal rates of return (IRRs) for each individual partnership since inception and up to the most recent date available. Please include data for Net and Gross IRRs if available.7. Net Asset Value of each partnership, and estimated remaining value of each partnership, as permitted under the Partnership.8. The amount of "total management fees and costs paid" for each individual partnership on an annualized, year-end basis.9. Date as of which all the above data was calculated.10. Names and service type provided of service providers (ex. Placement Agents, etc.) assisting the Devon County Council pension scheme with each individual partnership.11. Names of all infrastructure funds or partnerships partially and fully sold by the Devon County Council pension scheme, including date of sale.12. Names of advisors mandated by the pension scheme to advise on allocations to infrastructure.  13. Please provide the name and contact details of the individual responsible for the pension funds allocation to infrastructureIf there are any fees for searching for, reviewing, or copying the records, please inform me before you task the request. If you deny all or any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

Dear FOI Officer,I am sending this request under the Freedom of Information Act to ask for the following information:1.	For each of the financial years 2011/12, 2012/13, 2013/14, please provide the following information for all Adult Social Care: a) The fees you have paid per hour for home care b) The total number of hours of home care provided, and the number of people receiving it  c) The average number of hours of home care provided per person per week receiving such care d) The total sum spent on providing home care2. column7: I am making this freedom of information request in order to obtain information on the fee rates paid to independent sector nursing and residential homes for the care of individuals for whom the council accept financial responsibility. I have already requested this information directly from your commissioning department, but as I've not received a response, I am now making a request through FOI. The information is required for publication in a report for LaingBuisson's monthly newsletter Community Care Market News' (CCMn). Please find attached the annual survey form relating to usual costs paid by local authorities for nursing and residential care. We do not necessarily need this to be completed, an existing document outlining any change in rates since 2013/14 financial year and the fees for elderly and dementia nursing and residential care for the current 2014/15 financial year would suffice (but please see the attached for full details).The deadline given to the commissioning department to return the survey was this week (2-6 June 2014.) I would really appreciate your help in this matter as we urgently need this information for our annual report and subsequent analysis. The requested information can be emailed either to myself or to data@laingbuisson.co.uk, or faxed to 020 7833 9129. If you have any comments or queries about supplying the requested information, please do not hesitate to contact myself or one of my colleague's on 020 7923 5395

column3: Highways Capital Development and Waste Management
column7: The appalling state of this lane has been reported to your department on a regular basis over the past years. It has now reached crisis point! I have been advised by the Customer Relations and Information Governance team atDevon County Council that adjacent roads which run alongside this hamlet are not A or B roads. Therefore, WHY have these lanes been repaired and resurfaced and this lane has been totally ignored. This lane provides access to 21 properties and businesses. It is not subject to few and slow moving traffic. Delivery vans and lorries are frequent including the South Hams Refuse Trucks which are heavy and large.The road surface along a large part of the lane is now totally absent. This has left large size loose gravel and stones the size of train track ballast spread across the lane and deep groves. This is not only a danger to car/ van / lorry drivers but other users of the lane including horse riders and pedestrians.I respectfully ask that DCC Highways carry out a further in-depth assessment of this lane and carry out overdue maintenance / permanent repair urgently. I was informed that this lane would be inspected on a regular basis.I also respectfully request a copy of visit reports and maintenance outcome over the past 18 months.

column6: Employeed disciplined for brecahes of the Data Protection Act 1998
column7: Dear Sir or Madam  I am writing under the Freedom of Information Act 2000 to request details of breaches of the Data Protection Act in your local authority; specifically I am asking for: 1.	The number of council personnel that have been convicted for breaches of the Data Protection Act.2.	The number of council personnel that have had their employment terminated for breaches of the Data Protection Act.3.	The number of council personnel that have been disciplined internally but have not been prosecuted for breaches of the Data Protection Act.4.	The number council personnel that have resigned during disciplinary procedures. 5.	The number of instances where a breach has not led to any disciplinary action. In each case, I request that you provide a list of the offences committed by the individual in question, for example "Accessed personal information for personal interest" or "Inappropriately shared patient information with a third party". I request that the time period covered is 1st April 2011-1st April 2014.  I further request that the information be displayed in the below format: Outline of what was lost/reported missing/accessed	Data contained 	Action taken criminal/ discipline	Additional responses to rectify lossCouncil USB stick left/lost in internet cafe. Suspended from work without pay for two weeks.	Database rebuilt and password access further restricted. My preferred format to receive this information is electronically, but if that is not possible I will accept hard copies.I understand under the Freedom of Information Act that I am entitled to a response within twenty working days. I would be grateful if you could confirm this request in writing as soon as possible.

The information that I require relates to a specific external/3rd party hosting contract which may include: 1. Software as a Service (SaaS) is a software distribution model in which applications are hosted by a vendor or service provider and made available to customers over a network, typically the Internet.2. E-commerce hosting is a business that furnishes merchants with solutions for selling their merchandise online. The merchant is typically billed monthly for using space on the hosting company's server. Software is also leased for online order processing. E-commerce hosting businesses usually manage all the technical facets of commercial website development and maintenance for their clients. E-commerce hosting can also include electronic data interchange (EDI).3. Exchange Hosting is a service in the telecommunications industry whereby a provider makes a Microsoft e-mail box and space available on a server so its clients can host their data on the server. The provider manages the hosted data of its clients on the server.4. Web Hosting is the activity or business of providing storage space and access for websites.5. VOIP Hosting is a methodology and group of technologies for the delivery of voice communications and multimedia sessions over Internet Protocol (IP) networks, such as the Internet. Other terms commonly associated with VoIP are IP telephony, Internet telephony, voice over broadband (VoBB), broadband telephony, IP communications, and broadband phone service.6. Contact Centre: A hosted contact centre offers all the utilities associated with running a customer service outfit with a pay-as-you-go plan. This means that managers don't need to buy prohibitively expensive hardware, instead they can add software as needed and get deeper in their involvement as they grow.7. Unified communications is the integration of real-time communication services such as instant messaging, presence information, telephony, video conferencing, data sharing, call control and speech recognition with non-real-time communication services such as unified messaging.Please can you see the attached file and fill the information into the space provided (Contract1-8). If none of the contract above apply to the organisation please can you state the reasons why. If however the services i have request is hosted internally please can you state this within the response as well as providing me information on the annual average spend and the internal contact for that particular type of hosting.RegardsGraham Peach

An older document which has been in existence for over 25 yrs and a newer policy which came into existence several years ago. I am carrying out a piece of research to estimate the number of stairlifts sold in the UK each year.  To support this I would be grateful if you would respond to this freedom of information request by answering the following questions:1.	How many people were assessed by your Occupational Health team in 2013 to see if they required a stairlift?2.	What proportion of the people that were assessed in 2013, were found to require a stairlift?3.	Please could you break down the people that needed a stairlift into the following eight age categories? <16, 16 to 24, 25 to 34, 35 to 44, 45 to 54, 55 to 64, 65 to 74, 75 +4.	What proportion of the people that were assessed in 2013 and who were deemed to require a stairlift, had the stairlift installed using a Disabled Facilities Grants (or equivalent) and what proportion funded the installation privately?5.	What medical requirements have to be met for a person to be deemed to need a stairlift?  How is this assessed?6.	What are the main illnesses that people suffer from that mean they require a stairlift?7.	Which stairlift manufacturer(s) do you use to supply and install stairlifts?8.	When a stairlift was installed using council funding, what proportion of stairlifts were installed in council houses and what proportion were installed in private homes (in 2013)?9.	What was your total spend on stairlift units and installation in 2012 and 2013, and how much was your total spend on stairlift maintenance? Please name your stairlift provider (and installer if different)10.	How much was your total spend with your stairlift provider in 2012 and 2013 (including any other mobility aids they may have sold you)?11.	EITHER  What were your average stairlift maintenance and servicing costs per unit in 2013, who carried out this work and how often was a service carried out per unit? OR  If you have a servicing contract please detail the supplier, price, duration and briefly what is covered under this servicing agreement12.	What other (if any) activities do you ask your stairlift installer to perform when they are in a client's property?13.	What proportion of the stairlifts where you arrange for the installation are bought first-hand, bought second-hand or leased?14.	What proportion of the stairlifts where you arrange for the installation are straight, curved or outdoor?15.	What is the average price you pay for a stairlift (straight vs curved vs outdoor)?16.	What's the typical duration that a stairlift will be installed for in a single property?

column7: In the light of the introduction of the PE sports premium which came into effect during this academic year I would like the County to answer the following questions about PE in primary schools; for all feeder primary schools for Ivybridge Community College;1/ name of school2/ is PE curriculum at key stage  two taught by a generic primary qualified teacher ie PGCE or BEd qualified teacher? Or3/ Is PE curriculum taught by a PE primary teacher specialist (BEd or PGCE) or a level 2 qualified coach in the taught sport or physical activity?  Or neither, someone in the community who has expressed an interest in assisting the school through their own fitness or sports knowledge?4/ Do  stage two pupils undertake swimming during the curriculum?5/ Are school records kept of the swimming attainment of pupils at the end of key stage 2?6/ Is extra PE curriculum taught at key stage two  by a generic primary qualified teacher ie PGCE or BEd qualified teacher? Or8/ Is extra PE curriculum taught by a PE primary teacher specialist (BEd or PGCE) or a level 2 qualified coach in the taught sport or physical activity? Or neither, someone in the community who has expressed an interest in assisting the school through their own fitness or sports knowledge?9/ what added value has been attained through the use of the PE sports premium and how has this data being captured?  Please provide examples of where there  has been increased coach level 2 activity or PE taught by a Primary PE specialist.10/ What guidance has Devon County Council provided in relation to the use of PE sports premium in schools?11/  Has Ivybridge Community College provided the primary schools with an opportunity to 'buy-in specialist PE support'.

Please would you let me know in writing if you hold information of the following description:Information concerning the amount of money spent by the council on legal services in relation to supermarket planning applications in the past five financial years (2009/10 - 2013/14). Please could you supply me with the following information: -   The total amount of money spent in each of the past five financial years on legal services related to supermarkets. For example: "In 2011/12 the council spent £X on legal services in relation to planning proposals submitted by supermarkets." -  Where possible, please break down of each annual amount into the following categoriesThe application number and/or details of the planning application that money on legal services was spent. For example: "£X was spent on legal fees on planning application no. X which related to a proposed Tesco development on X Street."Whether any portion of the monies expended were used on legal services during the process of appeals made by the applicant. For example: "In 2009/10, £X was spent on legal fees in relation to Tesco's appeal to the planning inspectorate over the refusal of planning application no.X"Where the monies have been spent on legal fees in appeal processes please, where possible, stipulate whether the fees relate to those of the appellant (where the appellant has been awarded costs) or those of the council.  By "supermarkets" I mean Tesco, Sainsburys, Asda and Morrisons.  Please let me know as soon as possible if only statistics are available rather than the statistics and details. I would like a copy of the information and would prefer for it to be sent by email if possible.If any part of the information requested is covered by one or more of the absolute exemptions in the Act please treat this request as a request for that part of the information which is not covered by the absolute exemption.If you need further details in order to identify the information requested or a fee is payable please let me know as soon as possible.If you are of the view that there may be further information of the kind requested but it is held by another public authority please let me know as soon as possible. Please continue with this application as quickly as possible.I believe that the information requested is required in the public interest for the following reasons: 1. To uphold public confidence that the council has thorough policies on the type of information it is obliged to record.2. To provide assurance that the council keeps full details and records of all its financial transactions.

column6: Road works A379 Kenton - Narrowing of road and installation of Traffic Lights
column7: Under the Freedom of Information Act I would like a break down by postcode of the number ofpeople for each of the options under the survey carried out in 2013. I have read with interest yourcomments about discarding votes of those who did not live in Kenton, were those in South Towndirectly affected by these works given a higher priority? Also if only 71 residents from Kentonvoted why do the survey numbers add up to 92/93?Could you also please inform me as to what consideration has been made with regard to crossingthe road to access the Powderham Store or the bus stop for those residents living between the sets oflights? Is there any time delay factored in to the lights changing to allow residents to cross shoulddrivers actually refrain from jumping the lights and speeding? I have been sat in front of a greentraffic light waiting whilst a further five cars have come through from the other direction (this wasNOT joining traffic)!With the increased noise levels due to stationary vehicles waiting at the lights are there any plans tosoundproof the many homes affected?

I am requesting a full copy of the safeguarding file regarding my late mother in law. Her name was Pamela Ellicott, date of birth 14/09/29. She resided at Puddavine Court, Totnes between November 2009 and 24th December 2010. Someone called Tim Dudley was involved from the NHS we think. Mum was under a safeguarding alert, not for herself but because she was considered a risk to others. We have been granted an out of time extension to reclaim CHC funding but Puddavine Court have destroyed all her records so we need this file as it should contain most of the same information which we need. I have to file the CHC form by the end of July so I would be grateful for the information before then.
column8: Some information sent but part exempt

column7: Questions  1-5 relate to the free early education entitlement scheme for three- and four-year-olds. Please confirm: 1)      The initial base rate (per child per hour) of three- and four-year-old free entitlement funding given to local early years providers following the introduction of the Early Years Single Funding Formula in 2010, plus details of any supplements given at the time. 2)      The data on which this funding rate was based (e.g. did you carry out a cost survey/ use the Typical Cost Model etc?) 3)      The details of any steps taken to gain updated data on local provider costs since the introduction of the EYSFF, including (a) method of data collection; (b) date of data collection (month and year); and, if possible, (c) response rate. If you have collected updated data on provider costs on more than one occasion, please provide details for each occasion. If you have not collected any updated data on provider costs since the introduction of the EYSFF, please state this. 4)      The dates (month and year) of any changes to the hourly base rate of three- and four-year-old free entitlement funding given to local early years providers since the introduction of the Early Years Single Funding Formula in 2010, or any changes to funding supplements. 5)      The current base rate (per child per hour) of three- and four-year-old free entitlement funding given to local early years providers, plus details of any funding supplements. Questions  6-8 relate to the free early education entitlement scheme for two-year-olds. Please confirm: 6)      The current rate of funding (per child per hour) the local authority currently receives from the Department for Education to fund the free entitlement scheme for two-year-olds 7)      The current rate of funding (per child per hour) the local authority currently gives to providers to fund the provision of funded two-year-old places. 8)      If the rate given to providers is less than the rate received from the Department for Education, please confirm how the funding that is not currently passed onto providers is currently being allocated.

column6: People who have died with no next of kin
column7: THIS REQUEST IS FOR COUNTY, BOROUGH & UNITARY COUNCILS AND DOES NOT RELATE TO PUBLIC HEALTH FUNERALS PER SE. IF THE CASE WAS PASSED TO A 3RD PARTY FOR A PUBLIC HEALTH ACT FUNERAL TO BE CARRIED OUT, THEN PLEASE PROVIDE DETAILS OF THE CASE AS PER THE QUESTIONS BELOW. THANKS!I would like to know details of anyone who has been under the care of the Council Guardianship/Deputyship Team* who has died with no known next of kin from 1/1/2012 to the day of your reply. *The Guardianship Team is known by different names at different County Councils, for example: Client Affairs, Protection Team, Adult Care Team, Deputyship Team, Appointeeship Team or other similar name.Please include:1.	 the deceased's full name(s)2.	the date they died3.	the approximate value of their estate(s)4.	their dates of birth or age at death 5.	whether or not they were married, divorced, single, or widowed 6.	the maiden surnames of married females or widows 7.	their  address at death8.	was a referral was made to the Treasury Solicitor or Duchy of Lancaster or Cornwall or any other 3rd party and the name of the 3rd party concerned? If so, what was the date of this referral?9.	if a referral to the Treasury Solicitor or Duchy as per the above has not yet been made, do you think it will be made?10.	if a case is still  undecided upon as to possible referral as above, please also advise of details as per the questions above

Please give answers only for cases which were commenced or ongoing during 1st April 2013 - 31st March 2014 where you were a party to the proceedings.It may not be possible to answer all of these questions within the resource limit, in which case, they are given in order of priority and please could you answer them in that order.	Case 1	Case 2	Case 3	Case 4 (etc...)1. Who made the initial application to the Court of Protection? (e.g. The local authority, an NHS body, 'P', a family member of P, a friend of P, an IMCA, another kind of advocate, or some other person)				2. What section(s) of the Mental Capacity Act 2005 was used to make the application: s15 (seeking a declaration); s16 (seeking an order); s21A (review of a deprivation of liberty safeguards authorisation)?				3. Did the case involve a deprivation of liberty authorised a) under Schedule A1; b) by the Court of Protection (or both for the same case) or c) no deprivation of liberty was involved. 				4. Is the case ongoing? (yes/no) 				5. How long, in total, has the case lasted for to date? (to the nearest year/month)				6. Please estimate the overall cost to the local authority of this case (to date).  (If you are able to share with us more detail about the nature of those costs - e.g. expert reports, instructing counsel, staff time and travel, etc - then we would be very interested in this as it would provide useful data on the costs of Court of Protection litigation, but we recognise that this information would likely take us beyond the resource limits of the request)

I am requesting information under the Freedom of Information Act in relation to 'fact finding'_trips overseas made by council officers and/or councillors for the_period over the past 12 months (July 2013 until the present day) and paid for in part or_wholly from the council's funds.__Please advise:1)    How many such trips were made2)    Where to each trip_ was made3)    When each trip was made (period from and to)4)    The purpose of each_ trip5)    The numbers of council officers and/or councillors taking_ part in each trip6)    How much each trip cost the council__ - including breakdown i.e. how much was spent on what e.g. hotel, dinner7)    The tangible outcome of each trip

column3: Highways Capital Development and Waste Management
column7: Under the freedom of information act can you give me the costs of repairing(re-top dressing) the failed top dressing carried out last year.You do not need me to inform you of locations as you should be aware of works in hand and the reasons why.I have been informed that this was caused by the contractors and since it broke up within 6 months  they would repair it.Also, will the sunken manhole covers be raised and the center over banding ridge be flattened prior to new work.In some areas where last years top dressing has been stripped and left ruts, will this be cleared off first?If not Why? Last year saw a very short period of hot weather that caused  previous years top dressing to melt and turn into nice shiny tar with the grip of black ice in the wet, it has also caused the road to ripple in the corners where it was too soft for the lorries using it. Since this is an industry standard surface that fails as soon weather condition change, too hot, too wet, to cold etc,and cannot cope with large/heavey lorries, when will councils understand that buying paint from the .99p shop to paint the outside of your house every year (ref Simon) is poor eccomany compared to having a good job done that lasts 15 years. Regards from a tax payer who has never had these questions answered in a honest manner.

1)	How many vehicles does the council operate? Please provide figures for: a) The number of cars. b) The number of vans under 3.5 tonnes.c) The number of vehicles above 3.5 tonnes.2)	Are these vehicles leased or owned outright by the council?3)	How many employees do you reimburse for using their own vehicle for work purposes - so-called grey fleet drivers?4)	Do you pay a lump sum (an essential user allowance) to any of the employees who drive their own vehicle for work purposes?5)	If so: a)	How much is the lump sum? b)	How many employees qualify for it? c)	How often is it paid? d)	What are the conditions for receiving it, such as annual minimum mileage?6)	What pence per mile rate do you pay employees who drive their own vehicle in the course of their job? Please explain how these rates may differ according to annual mileages driven or whether the recipient is classed as an essential user?7)	Have you recently reviewed how you reimburse employees who drive their own vehicles for work? If so, what changes have you implemented?8)	Are you in the process of reviewing how you reimburse employees who drive their own vehicles for work? If so, what changes are you considering?9)	What was your total expenditure, including essential user allowances and mileage reimbursement, on grey fleet mileage during the last financial year (2013/14)?

column7: I would like to request the following information in relation to housing benefits, paid by the council to letting agencies. More specifically, I would like to know: For each calendar year since January 1, 2009 :1.) In total, for each of the past five calendar years, how much has the council paid to letting agencies in housing benefits? 2.a) How many complaints has the authority had from landlords about private letting agencies not passing on housing benefit payments from the council?b) Please provide a case-by-case breakdown, stating the value of housing benefits payments the landlords claim to be owed by letting agencies, the calendar year of the complaint and the trading name of the letting agency complained about I would like the information for in Excel format, presented as in the table below.  Name of agency complained about	Amount of housing benefit payments owed 	Calendar year of complaintJohn's Letting Agency	£12,450	2014A Letting Agency	£1,450	2014Property Agency Ltd	£8,700	2014 3.a) How many complaints has the authority received from tenants about private letting agencies not passing on housing benefit payments from the council to their landlords?b) In each case, please state the value of payments the tenants say their landlords are owed in housing benefits from the council, through private letting agencies, the calendar year of the complaint and the trading name of the letting agency complained about I would like the information for both parts of question 3 in the same format as question 2, but in a separate table.

column7: I am a Consultant Physician at Addenbrooke's Hospital, Cambridge with specialist expertise in severe childhood obesity. As part of my work I am increasingly being asked to assess children with severe obesity where other healthcare professionals have expressed concerns that "neglect" may be a contributory/major factor.In some cases, I have been able to demonstrate that the child's obesity can be explained by a genetic disorder that may/may not have been identified by previous tests. As such, I am in the process of seeking national funding to provide a more formal mechanism for the assessment of children with severe obesity in order to more clearly identify those with a medical problem.As part of this application for funding, it would be very helpful to know how many children there are in England in whom "obesity" has been cited as either the main or one of several reasons for instigating child protection investigations.I would be very grateful if you could provide the following information for your local authority for every year, from 2010 onwards:1. What is the number of cases where "obesity" has been cited in a child protection investigation?2. What is the number of cases where "obesity" has been cited in a child protection plan?3. How many of the cases where "obesity" has been cited, led to court proceedings?4. How many cases where "obesity" has been cited have led to a care order after court proceedings?
who informed DCC that I may have misused my Blue Badge. I have contacted My Devon in Tiverton who believe this may be malicious, so gave me your details. I look forward to your reply.

July 6th 2007 was thee deadline for tenders to be submitted for Mental Health Floating Support Services & Howell Road Exeter accommodation based support service. Please can you tell me:- the names of the bidders who was successful and was this for the full contract or part as the premises at Howell Road remained closed for a considerable time. Thank you.

Thank you for your response. You anticipated that this would be disappointing and indeed it was and it really does not address my concerns. I appreciate budget restrictions but I also consider that far too little thought has been given to improving operational efficiency, the potential economic benefits to the community which could eventually feed some benefit of increased revenue to Devon County Council in the form of business taxes. I will now address your response and have again copied this to Shebbear Parish Council and Devon customer relations.With regards to the need to use double deck buses, your response has led me to ask further questions:1.	Please could you indicate the normal and maximum number of ticket holders that are travelling on its route from Shebbear to Stibb Cross, Stibb Cross to Great Torrington. These are points where there is a theoretical possibility of transfer to other services - e.g. Holsworthy and Bideford etc.2.	The normal comparative running cost (per km) and average annual maintenance costs of the  recent Scania N230UD (used on some routes)  the 2004 Dennis Trident/Alexander ALX400 often seen on the 71/72 routes and the most economical 23 seat Optare Solo Slim Line which are used on rural routes in many other parts of the country.3.	All buses have a limited economical life which is much dependent upon how much they are usedThe next paragraph of your response does not answer the question as to why a bus service cannot be provided to carry full-time workers to work. This would help to reduce the need for expensive road upgrading, such as the £2m works just completed at Roundswell, in order to possibly reduce peak hour congestion. From first impressions of the completed scheme, it would appear that the new roundabout is simply allowing the traffic to travel much faster on the roundabout itself with the potential for more serious accidents. The cost of this scheme was somewhat more than the £1.35m 'recent years' cuts you indicated. I understand that further upgradings such as this are being proposed for the A39/ A361 to deal with safety and congestion. Road upgrading projects such as this do little to improve the environment.  It would appear that the provision of bus services is little more than a response to social needs rather than economic and environmental needs. With regards to cuts in local bus subsidies, firstly this appears to be in contradiction with Central Government Policy https://www.gov.uk/government/policies/improving-local-transport/supporting-pages/increasing-the-use-of-busesI also refer you to the successful South Yorkshire Passenger Transport Executive - 'Better Bus Areas' scheme which I believe should be considered by all transport authorities. Secondly, I understand that the £1.35m cut since 2012 is a 20% reduction in the Bus Service Operator Grants. I also understand that this reduction will increase operator costs by just 1.5-2%. Would it not be possible to eliminate these costs by greater operating efficiency and providing services that would have a potentially greater use?With regards to the comment that you will 'continue to seek any alternative funding opportunities for bus services'. I would like to know what productive initiatives in this direction have been recently instigated. I am also very concerned that it would appear that local operatorsUnless I am much mistaken, I would suggest that DevonBus are simply managing the bus services in rural areas in such a way that it will not be long before many more services, including the 71 will cease to operate.

I am a journalist working for the BBC Radio's 5live Investigates programme. I am looking at the impact of the reductions on trading standards or consumer protection budgets over the last 5 years. I am seeking information under the FoI rules. Could you please provide me with the following:                                1, For each year from financial year 2009/10 to the current financial year (2014/15) - please give me the number of full-time equivalent posts in the trading standards department (also known as consumer protection department in some councils).                                2, Since financial year 2009/10, are there any services which the trading standards (consumer protection) department no longer offers, e.g. offering advice on consumers statutory rights, advising businesses on legislation, investigating breaches of consumer protection, inspecting traders premises, prosecuting traders who commit serious offences, any other services which the department offered in 2009-10 but does not offer now.                                 3, For each financial year from 2009/10 to 2013/14: i, How many complaints have been received by the trading standards department (or consumer protection department). ii, How many complaints were investigated?iii, How many resulted in a prosecution?Iv, and how many resulted in advice being given to the party under investigation?                                4, For each year from 2009/10 to 2013/14 how many complaints have been received by trading standards (consumer protection departments) from members of the public about the way complaints were being investigated? How many of these related to the time it was taking to investigate a complaint?                                Do not hesitate to contact me if you want any further details. I can be reached on 0161 335 6451 or 07710 013287.

I am writing to make an open request for information under the Freedom of Information Act 2000, onbehalf of the BMA Public Health Medicine Committee. I would be very grateful if you could please provideme with the following information relating to your Local Authority. It may look complicated but this ismainly due to the exclusions which in fact simplify it. We believe you will be able to answer just by lookingat your account of public health grant and identifying those items which were previously paid for out ofother local authority funds. That is what we are interested in and if you have any problems answering ourspecific questions please contact us:1. Expressed (a) as an amount and (b) as a percentage of your total public health grant, how much of yourpublic health grant did you spend in 2013/14 in total as a combination of all the following:(i) transfers to your general cash limit;(ii) employment of staff who had previously been employed by the council and paid for from generalfunds;(iii) provision of services that had previously been paid for by the council from general funds;(iv) maintenance of equipment or premises that had previously been maintained from general funds;(v) any other way by which the grant is used to substitute for an expenditure of general fund.Please do not include in your total:(vi) overheads costed in your public health grant baseline and now undertaken by the council;(vii) staff transferred from old jobs elsewhere in the council to new jobs in public health;(viii) premises and equipment previously used for one purpose and now used for a new public healthpurpose;(ix) new public health outcomes secured by general councii services;(x) situations where public health grant pays only for an expansion of the existing service.2. For each service which you previously paid for out of general funds and which you now pay for out ofpublic health grant (please do not include services where public health grant has only paid for anexpansion):(i) what is the service?(ii) how much public health grant do you spend on it?(iii) under what statutory local government power did you previously pay for this service out of yourgeneral funds (a general description like "road safety powers" will suffice)?(iv) under what health service power do you now pay for it?(v) briefly how did you conclude that the latter was more appropriate than the former?(vi) are any charges made?3, Considering the items which we excluded from the above calculation in 1(vi) to 1(x), please roughlyestimate to the nearest EO,25m how much your Council's general fund benefited from such expenditure(a) recurrently (eg overheads absorbed without extra cost to the council) and (b) non-recurrently (egredundancy costs avoided by moving a member of staff to a new job in public health). In each caseplease give a brief one paragraph narrative of how these benefits accrued. We think that "to the nearestEO,25m" should allow you to conduct a quick rough calculation rather than a detailed one. If not, pleasegive us the best estimate you can without a detailed calculation and indicate roughly the degree ofaccuracy you think you have achieved,

I would like to make a request under the Freedom of Information Act.Here are some definitions I will use during my request:- "care centre for the elderly" - a day centre or residential care home for the elderly- "day centre" - a place where the elderly are looked after but do not stay overnight- "residential care home" - a place where the elderly are looked after and stay overnightPlease would you disclose:1. The number of local authority-run care centres for the elderly that were closed whilst under local authority control or left local authority control in the calendar years 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 to date.2 a) The number of local authority-run care day centres for the elderly that were still in operation at the end of the calendar years 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014. b) The number of local authority-run care residential care homes for the elderly that were still in operation at the end of the calendar years 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014. 3. For each elderly care centre (day centres and residential care homes) that either closed or left local authority control as per question 1, please state the name of the premises, whether it closed or was transferred to a private provider and the calendar year in which this occurred.

I am writing to make a request under the Freedom of Information Act for details of the number of children aged under 16 who are know or have been referred to the council amid concerns they are at risk of sexual exploitation, and what is described as "child prostitution".More specifically, I am requesting the following:1. a) For 2014 so far, the total number of children who were referred, or became known, to the council amid concerns that they are, or at some stage have been, at risk of sexual exploitation.1. b) The age of the youngest child thought to be at risk of sexual exploitation.1. c) Please provide an anonymised breakdown for each child, detailing the gender of each child, the age of each child, and a summary description (or at least a category) of the concerns around sexual exploitation, for example that they are know to be being exploited by a family member; that they are exploited in return for alcohol or drugs, etc. Please detail how many of them are thought to be involved in the sex trade (receiving money or other rewards in return for sexual acts) or what is described as "child prostitution". Please understand that I am aware a child cannot consent to prostitution and is in reality a victim of abuse or exploitation, however, please provide details of those who are thought to be involved in this activity.2. a) b) c) The same for the year 2013If there are any problems with this request, please do not hesitate to contact me. If my request is denied in whole or in part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the act.

column7: Since the introduction of the Academies Act in July 2010:a)	How much debt (£) has the council 'written off' when schools have converted to academies? -	Please provide a monetary breakdown per conversion, with the name of each school/new academy.b)	How many schools have already converted to academies in your constituency since July 2010? I write pursuant to the above Act and/or regulations to request information about Compulsory PurchaseOrders ("CPOs") made by the Authority under Planning and Housing powers respectively from 1 January2003 to date.By way of background , over the past few years we have published two reports into the use of CPOs. Thesecan be accessed on our website athttp://www.bonddick inson.com/sites/defaultlfiles/documentlCPO%20report%20single%20page.pdfhttp://www.bonddickinson.com/sites/defaultlfiles/docu mentlCPO%20report%20July%202012.pdf.As will be seen from those reports, in broad terms CPOs are very effective in so far as they enable anacquiring authority to acquire land, either pursuant to a confirmed order or by agreement against thebackground of a CPO. What we are now seeking to understand better is the next step in the compulsorypurchase process, i.e. the extent to which schemes underlying the need for compulsory purchase have inactuality been delivered following the use of CPOs. The references below and in the accompanying form to"Scheme" are to the proposed development or use underlying the need for compulsory purchase .I should therefore be obliged if you could provide the following information in respect of all CPOs made by theAuthority, or any now abolished authority for which the Authority is the successor authority , from 1 January2003 to date under Planning and Housing powers respectively :a) The title of each CPOb) The statutory power under which it was madec) The date it was maded) The date it was either:i) Confirmed without modification; orii) Confirmed with modification; oriii) Not confirmed; oriv) Withdrawn.e) The date(s) a confirmed CPO was implemented by General Vesting Declaration or Notice to Treat/Noticeof Entry and possession of land takenf) When the Scheme commencedg) When the Scheme completedh) If the Scheme was not commenced, the reasons why notAs regards the questions about the commencement and/or completion of the Scheme we appreciate it may bedifficult to give a precise date. An approximate date will suffice.

I write to request details of council arts under the Freedom of Information Act 2000.Under the section Heritage Assets in your annual statement of accounts, there is mention of arts and artefacts which are not usually referred to in the local list, or accounted for due to the cost of obtaining specific expert valuations.I would like to receive the following:A) An itemised breakdown of the art and artefacts owned by the council- with necessary details such as artist/maker.B) A list of art and artefacts acquired by the council since 2010 with an indication of whether it was a donation, or if purchased, please include the price paid.C) A list of art and artefacts the council has sold since 2010, with the sold price and an indication of the purchaser i.e. overseas/domestic private collector, museum, etc. Under A, whilst I appreciate the exact values may be unknown as the cost of expert advice may be considered an unnecessary expense in the current climate, could you please include the insurance value of the items. If an individual breakdown isn't possible, an estimate of the insurance value of the whole collection would be acceptable.Again, I am only interested in arts and artefacts, not buildings or other locations to be included in a local list. I look forward to hearing from you within 20 working days.With best wishes,

column7: In essence, I'm attempting to gather information on each Disposal Authorities Residual Waste arrangements throughout Great Britain & NI. The aim is to develop one single data set that can be utilised by Central Government, Local Authorities and others of interest. Thus far this data does not seem to be in one single location, although the information obviously exists.Therefore what I would like to determine if at all possible is:- 	Current residual waste arrangements for Devon. o	Total annual tonnageo	Details of where the residual waste is consigned to for disposal (names of facilities etc)o	Details of any transfer stations that are currently utilised throughout the County.o	Who the residual disposal Contract is with?o	When the contract entered into force?o	When it expires?o	The cost of the contract (£) - or if preferable the cost placed in the original Contract Advert or in the OJEU.- 	Future Plans for Residual Waste arrangements? o	Long term PFI or similar arrangements.I'm conscious that the majority of this information is unrestricted and in the public domain and if it's easier I can search the OJEU, Contracts Finder etc but I would need a reference number....

column6: Comms with Simon Lee re Parking Enforcement
column7: Thank you for your prompt response.  I can clarify that it is Mr Simon Lee who works for Teignbridge Parking Services, I believe he is/was a parking supervisor there.  I do not have a postal or email address for him.  Predominantly, I am interested in receiving copies of Freedom of Information requests (and the responses) made by Mr Lee.  However; if there is other correspondence between Mr Lee and yourselves, I would be interested in this correspondence as well.I am given to understand that any Freedom of Information request would not be subject to the Data Protection Act, however; I am happy for you to 'scrub out' Mr Lee's name with a black marker if that helps.I look forward to your prompt response.---Can you please send me all information regarding Simon Lee's request for information in relation to your parking enforcement officers.As a colleague of mine has informed me that he is very critical of your services. If you wish to cross out the name Simon Lee you may do so in order to preserve the data protection act. The period of time I am interested in is from may 2014 to today's date.I would be grateful if you could send me this information as soon as possible.Clarification Requested on 30th July 2014 as follows:-Dear Mr Heavy,Thank you for your request for information received on 29th July 2014 as follows:-"Can you please send me all information regarding Simon Lee's request for information in relation to your parking enforcement officers from May 2014 to 29th July 2014."Please note that this request is being handled under the Freedom of Information Act 2000.I am writing to ask you to clarify your request. This is because we are not certain that we have understood your request correctly and we need further details from you in order to identify and locate the information requested.  We would, therefore, appreciate your clarification as follows:-1.	Please can you confirm which 'Simon Lee' you are referring to, as we have more than one on our systems.  A postal address, organisation or e-mail address would be helpful.2.	Are you just interested in receiving copies of Freedom of Information requests made by Mr Lee, or are you seeking all correspondence between Mr  Lee and ourselves?Please bear in mind that it is likely that Section 40(2) and/or Section 41 of the Freedom of Information Act 2000 - 'Personal Information' and 'Information provided in Confidence' respectively, would apply to some, if not all, of the information you request, given that it relates to a third party.  In addition, please note that we would need to consult with Mr Lee prior to making any disclosure to yourself.We would be grateful if you could please provide the above clarification by Wednesday 13th August 2014.If you need assistance with this, please contact me on the below telephone number, or by email at accesstoinformation-mailbox@devon.gov.uk.  Thank youYours sincerelyJenny Goodall Information Governance OfficerCustomer Relations & Information Governance Team

The government announced at the end of 2013 that it would no longer fund a separate grant to councils to pay for Local Welfare Assistance schemes. The Local Welfare Assistance schemes I refer to are the programmes implemented by local authorities to replace the old Social Fund and Crisis Loans, which were abolished by the government a couple of years ago.With the knowledge that Local Welfare Assistance schemes will be maintained through councils' general fund from 2015:1.	Does your local authority plan to fund its local welfare assistance schemes in 2015/16 2.	How much will your local authority spend on your local welfare assistance schemes in 2015/163.	How much will your local authority spend on the local welfare assistance schemes in 2014/154.	How much did it spend on local welfare assistance schemes in 2014/155.	What is the Local Welfare Assistance scheme spent on in your LA - eg white goods programmes, extra DHP, grants to individuals, deposit schemes etc6.	Are any other funders that are meeting the cost of your local welfare assistance scheme in 2015/167.	When did you make this decision and could you please forward me a link to the council documents if they are publicly available8.	Have you written to the Secretary of State about the DCLG's decision to no longer fund local welfare assistance schemes - if you have, could you please disclose the letter

In each of the last four years, how much did your Local Authority spend on funding specifically for teenage pregnancy prevention?In each of the last four years, did your Local Authority employ a dedicated, full-time equivalent (FTE) teenage pregnancy co-ordinator?I understand that under the Act, I should be entitled to a response within 20 working days of your receipt of this email.Some parts of this request may be easier to answer than others. Should this prove to be the case, I would ask that you release available data as soon as possible - rather than hold up the entire request.I would prefer to receive this information electronically, in the attached Excel spreadsheet. If the decision is made to withhold some of this data using exemptions within the Act, please inform me of that fact and cite the exemptions used.If you need any clarification then please contact me at the number below or via email. Under your section 16 duty to provide advice and assistance I would expect you to contact me if you find this request unmanageable in any way.I would be grateful if you could confirm that you have received this request, and I look forward to hearing from you in the near future.

The information I request relates ONLY to adults between the ages of 18 and 65 who have a functional mental health diagnosis.  By functional mental health diagnosis I am referring to diagnoses such as Schizophrenia, Bi-Polar Affective Disorder, Personality Disorder, Depression and Anxiety based disorders, although this is not an exclusive list and only given as an example.  Please DO NOT include people affected by organic mental health problems such as Dementia, Acquired Brain Injury or Learning Disability in your results. 1.    How many working age adults between the ages of 18 and 65 with functional mental health diagnoses are currently placed in either Residential or Nursing Care Homes and who have been resident there for more than 26 weeks, regardless of geographic location, for which your Authority contributes financially, either partly or fully,  to their placement? 2.    What is the average weekly cost to your Authority of a working age adult between the ages of 18 and 65 with functional mental health diagnoses who have been placed in either Residential or Nursing Care Homes for each of the three financial years? 3.    How many working age adults between the ages of 18 and 65 with functional mental health diagnoses have moved out of either Residential or Nursing Care Homes in the past 52 weeks who had been living there for 26 weeks or more to environments that do not provide 24 hour care with the aid of Personal Budgets or other Personalisation finances? 4.    What is the combined cost each year for the past three years for all the placements of working age adults between the ages of 18 and 65 with functional mental health diagnoses who have been living in Residential or Nursing Care Homes for more than 26 weeks and for whom you have financially, partly or fully, contributed to their placement?

Please realise there are two ends to a telescope and it appears you have no wish to see anything from the residents point of view and protect the environment and amenity. I still await your full and formal reply to my mail of 9th.instant and additional queries below. Since your answers will have the potential to form part of a submission to the Local Government Ombudsman and a Judicial review concerning Whitecleaves quarry. I look to you to provide honest, straight forward replies to the queries below listed below.  1. What is the percentage area of Existing Woodland / vegetation that was outside of the RoMP and illegally stripped of trees and vegetation? Regarded as 'insignificant' by Stewart Redding . 2. Where is the top soil from the whole area being stored ( see attached photograph below indicating that unlike your claim, it is of relevance. I am now in possession of a sequence of photographs showing the topsoil that is according to you is LOST to crevices and is unrecoverable this and other photographs dispute your claim) (copied below) Please also refer to your monitoring report photographs dated 8 May 2012 indicating grown trees and vegetation in this area which cannot be sustained without a good topsoil organic availability. It was witnessed being 'bulldozed' over the edge of the work area.The information you provided is untrue and the pictures I hold and you supplied in your report are an indication of the economy of truth.When and who made the decision to make the claim that the topsoil was unrecoverable or was this claimed by the operator but unsubstantiated by DCC? 3. Please provide your investigation / results into the credential checks of the quarry operator.As the County monitoring officer surely you cannot claim it is not your responsibility or your authority to carry out these checks .I am asking this under the freedom of information act and that prior to allowing quarrying to commence that you had satisfied yourself of the directors/personnel's credentials to quarry and their certified geologist as is required under the H&S executive requirements . 4. By whom, when and where has the sound monitoring taken place about noise emanating from Whitecleaves quarry. I remind you of the Colin Bignall e-mail to your department and copied to Mike Deaton and Stewart Redding on 30 October 2008 and therefor request this information under the F.o.I Act. Again many many complaints have been made to your department or refered to T.D.C. over this period 2008 to date. I commend you to read this mail, it is damning evidence ! 5. Further to my above queries now that the decision has potentially been made about the very short term usage of Whitecleaves quarry can you now supply me with the information concerning the enforcement actions 'in toto' that was held in abeyance. FOIA section 30 no longer applies even if it might have done earlier.( This fact is open to legal debate ) and is of public interest .Particularly the unused cement hopper which is visually intrusive and I was assured would be removed in September 2013. A cement hopper cannot be seen as demolition equipment!!! Again this request is made under the F.o I. Act. I expect answers to my 5 reasonable requests including the accountable person who has allowed the abuse of this precious ecological site.I feel the previous answers you have supplied are untrue misleading and hold no one to account .Each person has their own speciality and I believe there has been manipulation of the truth to hide departmental inadequacies and shortcomings .
