column3: Highways Capital Development and Waste Management
column6: Parking Enforcement in Bantham during 2014 season
column7: Freedom of Information Act Request:-Parking enforcement in Bantham during the 2014 seasonTraffic to Bantham beach during the summer months is very heavy with up to a thousand cars a dayusing the large privately owned beach car park for which the owners make a charge.There is a temptation for visitors to avoid the car parking charge by parking in the village street. Ifthis is allowed to happen chaos ensues. The street is wide enough to allow cars to pass each otherbut not if there is a line of parked cars.To avoid this chaos happening there are double yellow lines one side of the street and on the other arestriction on parking between 9am and 6pm during the period from May to September inclusive.For the past several years enforcement of these parking restrictions has been very efficiently carriedout by Enforcement Officers of the South Hams District Council both during the week and atweekends. This year however it appears this duty has been taken over by the County Council whohave signally failed to enforce the restrictions properly or indeed at all.Against that background I request that within the next 14 days you provide me with aschedule detailing the visits made to Bantham by your enforcement officers between the I"May 2014 and the 30th September 2014.I am making a similar request to the South Hams District Council for last year.

column6: GM Ingredients used within DCC (esp. schools) and GMO Policy
column7: After watching an amazing documentary(www.gmofilm.com) on G.M.O's I am writing to request information on the cooking oil that is used within our county, especially within the Schools as the long term safety on G.M ingredients is in doubt(outside the science of the industry). My question is how much of the cooking oil supplied to all council departments is made from or contains G.M.O ingredients. Litres used/purchased and % split would be appreciated.Secondly, does Devon have a G.M.O policy?Please acknowledge receipt of this e-mail and let me know if this information will be made available within the 20 working day period.

Dear Sir or Madam,I apply under the terms of the Freedom of Information legislation for the following information about unaccompanied / separated children migrant children and the changes to civil legal aid that were made by The Legal Aid Sentencing And Punishment of Offenders Act (2012) and which came into effect in April 2013. For the purposes of this FOI request the definition of unaccompanied / separated migrant children includes: ALL migrant children - asylum and non-asylum claimants -who are under the age of 18 years, are outside their country of origin, and have been separated from both parents or from previous legal or customary caregivers. It also includes those children who have not been separated from other caregivers and have been accompanied by other family members.  The questions that follow will sometimes deal separately with those children seeking asylum and those with non-asylum immigration matters. 1.	How many unaccompanied / separated children (under 18 years of age)  have you provided Children Act (1989) Services to between the period of April 2013 and October 2014?  In this question unaccompanied / separated children includes those children that are asylum seekers as well as those that are non-asylum applicants.  2.	How many unaccompanied ASYLUM seeking children (UASC), under the age of 18, have you provided Children Act (1989) Services to between April 2013 and October 2014? 2.3.	How many unaccompanied / separated children, under the age of 18 who are NON-ASYLUM applicants, have you provided Children Act (1989) Services to between April 2013 and October 2014? If you can't provide information for any of the above questions for this time period, please specify for the time you can. In April 2013, cuts to legal aid meant that many unaccompanied and separated migrant children were no longer entitled to legal aid services (by this we mean advice, assistance and representation to address their immigration issues).  These cuts have largely impacted separated and migrant children who DO NOT have an asylum element to their claim. However, they have also impacted children who have  what is known as a mixed case. Children with a mixed case will have an international protection / asylum element to their claim as well as non-asylum / protection basis, such as Article 8 ECHR right to private and family life. In mixed cases, the only part of children's claim that can be progressed on legal aid is the asylum / protection part. 3.4.	How many 'NON-ASYLUM' unaccompanied and separated migrant children that you assist have NOT been entitled to access legal aid for legal advice /assistance and representation to address their immigration issues in the period between April 2013 to October 2014? For this question, as for others below, legal advice and assistance is taken to mean acts such as immigration advice, writing letters, negotiation, getting a barristers opinion, preparing a written case. Legal representation is taken to mean acts such as help preparing an immigration case before a tribunal hearing, as well as representation at a tribunal hearing. 4.5.	How many 'NON-ASYLUM' unaccompanied and separated migrant children that you assist have not been entitled to access legal aid for their immigration issues and have been left without representation and have had to represent themselves between April 2013 and October 2014? Refer to documents for other questions

column6: Supplementary questions relating to the road surface of Dorset Avenue
column7: 1) I understand that it is normal for carriageway safety inspections to undertaken on a driven basis, with a driver and inspector, at a speed enabling the inspector to observe road surface condition and other associated defects. Can you confirm that was the method of inspection for Dorset Avenue on 27 May 2014?2) Can you confirm what the actual "speed enabling the inspector to observe road surface condition and other associated defects"?3) I have recently walked Dorset Avenue and found some 200 or so potholes along the width and length of the highway. I could place the ball of my foot in each of these. I know that many of these do not constitute a "safety defect", but is it possible to accurately assess so many potholes when driving along the length of the road?4) 5 "safety defect" were raising following the inspection of 27 May 2014. Two of these relate to potholes, and the remaining 3 to white triangle markings on 2 separate speed ramps. Is there any particular reason why these were not dealt with on the same job, saving time and money?5) Could you inform me how many contacts you have received reporting potholes on Dorset Avenue for the full calender year 2013 and the year 2014 to date.?6) Could the answer to Q5 be broken down into:- reported by Neighbourhood Highways Officer- reported to Neighbourhood Highways Officer by local members- as a result of phone calls to DCC- as a result of letters to DCC- as a result of on-line reporting form on DCC website- as a result of other apps such as Mr Pothole, FixMyStreet, etc

Please understand, I am not requesting the full addresses of these homes, and only want to know the Ofsted URN for the home, the local authority they are based in, how many children you have placed in each, the private company that runs it. NB: The Ofsted URN is used by Ofsted to provide public information on each home (eg inspection reports), without identifying its address, and there is no reason why URNs cannot be provided. The following numbered questions make my request clear: 1. How many looked after children that you have parenting responsibility for are placed in council-owned children's homes (not secure units, foster homes, schools, or respite care)? 2. How many looked after children that you have responsibility for are placed in privately-run children's homes (not secure units, foster homes, schools, or respite care)? 3. Provide a list of privately-run children's homes (not secure units, foster homes, schools, or respite care) you currently place children in without giving full addresses of the homes, but instead showing only the Ofsted URN for the home, the local authority it is based in, how many children you have placed there, and the private company running it. I would like to request information under the Freedom of Information Act. The information that I require relates to a specific external/3rd party hosting contract which may include:  1. Software as a Service (SaaS) is a software distribution model in which applications are hosted by a vendor or service provider and made available to customers over a network, typically the Internet.2. E-commerce hosting is a business that furnishes merchants with solutions for selling their merchandise online. The merchant is typically billed monthly for using space on the hosting company's server. Software is also leased for online order processing. E-commerce hosting businesses usually manage all the technical facets of commercial website development and maintenance for their clients. E-commerce hosting can also include electronic data interchange (EDI).3. Exchange Hosting is a service in the telecommunications industry whereby a provider makes a Microsoft e-mail box and space available on a server so its clients can host their data on the server. The provider manages the hosted data of its clients on the server.4. Web Hosting is the activity or business of providing storage space and access for websites.5. VOIP Hosting is a methodology and group of technologies for the delivery of voice communications and multimedia sessions over Internet Protocol (IP) networks, such as the Internet. Other terms commonly associated with VoIP are IP telephony, Internet telephony, voice over broadband (VoBB), broadband telephony, IP communications, and broadband phone service.6. Contact Centre: A hosted contact centre offers all the utilities associated with running a customer service outfit with a pay-as-you-go plan. This means that managers don't need to buy prohibitively expensive hardware, instead they can add software as needed and get deeper in their involvement as they grow.7. Unified communications is the integration of real-time communication services such as instant messaging, presence information, telephony, video conferencing, data sharing, call control and speech recognition with non-real-time communication services such as unified messaging.Please can you see the attached file and fill the information into the space provided (Contract1-8). If none of the contract above apply to the organisation please can you state the reasons why. If however the services i have request is hosted internally please can you state this within the response as well as providing me information on the annual average spend and the internal contact for that particular type of hosting.

column6: Enforcement Officers acting  as Collection Agents for LA Council Tax
column7: This FoI is regarding the situation when an Enforcement Agent (EA) has been instructed to collect outstanding Council Tax from an individual.If that EA has been unable to take payment or take control of goods for whatever reason and then voluntarily returns the warrant to the council, what procedure, policy or contract does the council have in place regarding the EA's fees that will have been charged to that point?To clarify, does the council have any procedure, policy or contract in place to remunerate or compensate the EA for his fees for work carried out should the EA fail to take payment or take control of goods?Would this policy, procedure or contract be the same should the council request the return of the warrant from the EA?If, following the return of the warrant by the EA, the council apply for a Council Tax Attachment of Earnings Order (CTAEO), is there a policy, procedure or contract in place that sees the EA fees included in that CTAEO?If there is no policy, procedure or contract in place in either case as it is unnecessary due to legislation already dictating the position as to whether fees are included or not, please can you direct me to the legislation you follow?Please can you also supply a copy of your Enforcement Services Contract for Council Tax and NDR enforcement.

column6: 10 yr historical Incidents on B3193 towards Venn park garage from B3212 Longdown
column7: I would be grateful if you could give a me direct email address for whoever is dealing with this matter. I am attaching the results of my freedom of information request.  You will see another biker died here.   I would like to know how many of these incidents the Highways authority were aware of and what they did to stop the other accidents. Pre 2009 there were another 3.Thats 7 in 7 years and 8 if you include mine. Of course this is only accidents that are reported and as from 01.01.2008 damage only are reported. One biker has died in 2008 and I'm sure the bike key ring I was given at the scene was recent than this. The white lines shouldn't be there in the middle as it snot wide enough and there should be a slow sign either side with a road narrows sign and warning signs that reflect at night?  The only plastic sign there was smashed up and overgrown. My bike was written off, my helmet and clothes all destroyed and I was injured. I suppose I'm lucky I wasn't killed like the other biker. I am making a freedom of information request for all information relating to accidents, road works, signs in this area in the last 10 years B3193 towards Venn park garage from B3212 Longdown  Grid ref Sx8348788887

column6: Request for Heads of Service names and contact information.
column7: 1. First name, surname, job title, personal direct email address and personal direct telephone number (and extension if relevant) of all head's of service and above. 2. A copy of the organisation's organigram showing all staff with a role of Head of Service or above. I would prefer to receive this information electronically, preferably as a data set, eg. in Excel, NOT as a PDF. If the decision is made to withhold some of this data using exemptions in the Data Protection Act, please inform me of that fact and cite the exemptions used. If some parts of this request are easier to answer than others, I would ask that you release the available data as soon as possible. If you need any clarification then please do not hesitate to contact me by email to this email address. Under Section 16 it is your duty to provide advice and assistance and so I would expect you to contact me if you find this request unmanageable in any way.  I would be grateful if you could confirm by email that you have received this request, and I look forward to hearing from you within the 20-working day statutory time period.

column7: I have been passed the attached document by a neighbour who received it from your highways department and I was wondering if I could arrange to inspect the original document if you hold this.I would also be grateful if you could provide me with (either by email, or I am happy to view it in person) any other records you hold about Devon County Council's adoption of The Rock in Pilton, Barnstaple - in this regard I understand that The Rock was handed over from the then Urban District Council to Devon County Council in 1974 so any documents you hold as regards this would be gratefully received.I work in the Civic Centre in Barnstaple, so the same building as your Highways team in North Devon, so would be happy to view and return any original documentation here if I can obtain it from there.

1. The information requested:We ask the authority to provide the prices paid by the authority to independent and voluntary sector homecare providers for the provision of regulated social care services delivered to people aged 65 years or above in their own home, over a 'reference period' of Monday 8th to Sunday 14th September 2014, inclusive. Figures requested in items 'a' to 'c', below, should be expressed in pounds and pence per hour, as follows:a. The lowest rate per hour paid to any individual provider;b. The highest rate per hour paid to any individual provider;c. The average ("arithmetic mean") price per hour paid to all providers for all hours of homecare services purchased;d. The total hours of care purchased from all providers during the reference period.2. InterpretationThe following guidance will assist the authority in selecting the correct datasampleto complete this request. In cases of doubt, the authority shouldapply a 'common sense' interpretation to the request outlined in section 1,above.The data sample used to provide this information should include:Services delivered to adults aged 65 years and above;Services which are primarily designed to provide personal care andsupport, including prompting to undertake such activities.The authority should exclude the following items from the data sampleused:Services provided to adults under 65 years of age;Services provided primarily to support people with a learningdisability or a physical disability;Services which are charged by reference to a unit price, other than aprice per hour (or part thereof);Direct payments made to people in lieu of the provision of services bythe council;Services provided by any "in-house" homecare team, where theworkforce is employed by the authority itself;

column6: Request for information on Third Sector arrangements within Devon County Council
column7: Q1 Name of the lead member for links with the Third Sector?Q2 Name of the Senior Manager for links with the third sector?Q3 Is there a third sector liaison officer who does most of the day-to-day work with the third sector?Q4) What mechanisms are in place to liaise/build relationships with the third sector for example Partnership Liaison Group?Q5) Who monitors compliance with the Welsh Government's code of practice on third sector funding?Q6) Is there a central list recording all grants and contracts with the third sector?Q7) Please provide the following financial information about amounts paid to third sector organisations: Expenditure 2013/2014 and estimated expenditure or budget 2014/15 whichever is the most accurate and available and as follows:Name of the third sector organisation, amount paid, purpose of the funding, whether it is a grant or contract, service/department which the payment relates to, other known funding streams to that organisation, funding source for example specific grant, base budget, other grant funding please specify if available etc. If more than one department/service funds each organisation please could these be listed separately. Q8) How is the authority balancing maintaining a positive relationship with the third sector while also recognising the current financial difficulties local authorities are in?If your authority only holds this information partially I would be grateful if that information could be provided.

1. Please provide a figure for the number of noise complaints you have received for the following financial years: 2011-12, 2012-13, 2013-142. For each of these financial years, please provide a breakdown of the noise complaints you have received into the following categories:a) Loud music or partyb) Loud voicesc) Car alarm or house alarmd) Pet noisee) Baby cryingf) DIY noiseg) Nightclub or pubh) Roadworks or noise from construction sites outside of allowed hoursi) Slamming doorsj) OtherIf you do not hold the information broken down into these categories then please provide the information broken down by the categories your council uses.Where an individual has made several complaints about the same issue, please record these as separate complaints, if your recording system will allow you to do so.Please provide the information in an excel spreadsheet or another machine readable format.

column6: Request for Information on Social Work Employer Standards
column7: 1.	a) Do you publish an annual "health check" to assess the practice conditions and working environments of the social work workforce in accordance with the Standards for Social Work Employers in England (hereon referred to in this request as Employer Standards)?b) If yes, please attach a copy of your most recent "health check" report.2.	a) Do you use a workload management system which sets transparent benchmarks for safe workload levels in each service area in accordance with Employer Standards? When was it introduced? b) What is the benchmark for safe workload levels in your authority for each service area?c) How many times in the last 12 months to 21 November 2014 has a social worker's caseload exceeded the relevant benchmark?b) Please attach any relevant documentation that illustrates your workload management system e.g. an example of forms used by social workers to evaluate complexity or level of their caseload.3.	a) What percentage of social workers employed by your authority have received a minimum of an hour and a half of supervision in the last month as stipulated in the Employer Standards?b) Do social workers in your authority receive reflective (or 'clinical') supervision in addition to case (or 'managerial') supervision? What proportion of their supervision is reflective?  4.a) Do you publish information about average caseloads for social workers within your organisation?b) If yes, please provide the average caseload held by social workers within your organisation on 21 November 2014. Some parts of this request may be easier to answer than others, and should this prove to be the case I would ask that you release available data as soon as possible rather than hold up the entire request.I would prefer to receive this information electronically. If the decision is made to withhold some of this data using exemptions in Act, please inform me of that fact and cite the exemptions used.If you need any clarification then please contact me at the email listed. Under your section 16 duty to provide advice and assistance I would expect you to contact me if you find this request unmanageable in any way before the twentieth working day.

column6: Cost of Adult Care provision in own home
column7: Please see request document.

1. Please list the accommodation-based adult care centres that the council provided in April 2009. These should include day care centres, respite care centres, non-respite short term residential care centres, residential care centres and nursing care centres - any adult care centre/home provided by the council, in effect. 2. Please state which of the centres listed in response to question 1 are still provided by the council as of November 2014. For each centre that is no longer provided by the council, please state whether it was shut, or transferred to a different provider, and during which month and year this took place. In questions 1 and 2, "provided" by the council means that the council funds and owns the centre - this includes where ownership was/is via a separate company that is wholly or majority owned by the council. 3. For each of the centres listed in response to question 2 as having shut down or transferred since April 2009, please provide the business case (or similar document) for the closure, plus the report on the response to the public/user consultation exercise. Throughout this request, "accommodation-based" centres include centres where service users do not stay overnight (e.g. day care centres, as stated). They do not include "home care" services delivered by care workers at the service user's home. I would like the information sent electronically. Please let me know if you have any questions or require any clarifications. The council may not aggregate this request for section 12 cost limit purposes with my other recent FOI requests regarding domestic violence services, as this request covers entirely different subject matter.

column3: Highways Capital Development and Waste Management
column6: Ownership of footpath and culvert at Uplyme
column7: My wife and I are in the early stages of purchasing a property, Little Ridge, Venlake End, Uplyme, DT7 3SF. We have been made aware  of a flooding incident that occurred at 10.00 on 7 July 2012 when the banks of a culvert that runs alongside the eastern boundary of Little Ridge collapsed resulting in the flooding of some neighbouring properties. An insurance claim for damages is being made against the current owner, (now deceased so her executor),  and while this does not concern us directly now it brings into question the ownership and responsibility for maintenance of both the footpath on the eastern border of Little Ridge and the culvert itself, where there appears to be some dispute. Clearly we need this resolved before we go ahead with our potential purchase.Apparently Devon Council undertook remedial works to the banks and the path which presumably means you accept some responsibility for maintaining both the path and the culvert? Any information you can let us have about the ownership and responsibility for both the footpath and the culvert and also of this incident in particular would be most useful.

Under the Freedom of Information Act 2000, I request that you provide me with the following information: 1. The number of local authority-commissioned refuge places in your local authority area in each of the following financial years: 2009/10, 2010/11, 2011/12, 2012/13, 2013/14. 2. The total number of refuge accommodation places available at any one time (whether commissioned by the local authority or funded from elsewhere) in your local authority, in each of the following financial years: 2009/10, 2010/11, 2011/12, 2012/13, 2013/14.I would prefer to receive this information electronically. If my request is denied in whole or in part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the Act. I will also expect you to release all non-exempt material. I reserve the right to appeal your decision to withhold any information or to charge excessive fees.

column7: I want to make a Freedom of Information request, could you please send me the following information with regards to the organisation's Mobile Phones. You may have received the same request in the past and this information sent has now expired and I require an update as soon as possible for the following information:1.       Network Provider(s) - If there is more than one supplier please split the contract up including the contract value, number of users, duration, contract dates and internal contact details.2.       Annual Average Spend- Can you please provide me with the average annual spend over the 3 years. If this is a new contract can you please provide the estimated annual spend.3.       Number of Users- Number of connections for each network provider.4.       Duration of the contract- please state if the contract also include contract extensions for each provider.5.       Call off Contract Start Date- please provide me with information on when the framework commenced and include the month and year and day if possible for each network provider.6.       Call off Contract Expiry Date- please provide me with information on when the framework expires and include the month and year and day if possible for each network provider.7.       Contract/Framework Agreement Review Date- please provide me with the month and year and day if possible of when the organisation plans to review it mobile phone contracts for each network provider.8.       The person within the organisation responsible for this particular contract. Can you send me the full contact details Contact Name, Job Title, Contact Number and direct email address for each network provider.If the has more than one supplier can you please split the contract into to so they show information for both supplier including, total contract value, users, duration, and the other dates.If the supply of mobile phones if provided by an external organisation please state the name of the organisation, the number of users (Connections of your organisation only) and the name of the network provider.Please can you provide me with the latest information- If the organisation's is currently out to tender please can you also state the approx. date of award along with the information above.If this contract was awarded within the past three months can you please provide me with a shortlist of suppliers that bid on the contract?
Please could you send me the updated contact details for your Senior Management Team - Chief Executive/MD, Directors, Assistant Directors and Heads of Service.Name / Job Title / e-mail

column6: Requesting name of owner of neighbouring property
column7: My Wife and I recently purchased a bungalow (10 Murley Grange) in Bishopsteignton, TQ14 9TX. The cul-de-sac has 14 properties which are all privately owned except for the two story property next door (11 Murley  Grange) which we understand has been rented out by the Owner to the current Tenants for several years.  The house which has a cement rendered finish is in need of painting on the two sides and consequently presents a shoddy appearance when viewed from the two adjacent properties (No.10 and No.12). My Wife and I have been advised by others living in the cul-de-sac that the front face of No.11 was re-painted in 2013, but the sides and probably the rear for some unknown reason were not re-painted.  Although I have asked the current tenants if they can provide me with the name and address of the owner, so far they have not responded to my request. In addition to my Wife and I, several other property owners in Murley Grange have expressed a wish to see an improvement in the outside appearance of No.11 which would then bring the house up to the same standard as the other thirteen properties in Murley Grange.  To try and achieve an improved visual appearance to the property, I would like to speak and/or write to the owner of No.11 Murley Grange, and to do this I need the Governance Team's help in providing me with the Owner's name and current address. Together with other Murley Grange property owners we would be very grateful if you could provide me with this information. Thank You.

I'm currently doing some research with regards to fleet management and I was wondering if I could submit a freedom of information request detailing the organisation's vehicle, leasing and maintenance contracts. Im aware that not all organisations will have this particular contract but can you please send the following information with regards to these contracts: 1.       Contract Type: Maintenance, Leased, Hire2.       Who is the supplier of this contract? If there is more than one supplier please can you split all the information out below including annual spend, contract description and contract dates.3.       A small description of the contract.4.       The expiry date of each individual contract.5.       The contract review date.6.       Can you please send me contact details of the individual within the organisation responsible for this contract? Can you please send me two contact one from the fleet management (or equivalent) and the other procurement or purchasing preferably the category manager.7.       If the contract above was awarded within the last six months could you please provide me with the suppliers that where shortlisted?8.       I understand that the FOI Act is for recorded information but if you could be so help please include notes into what the organisation tends to do for future procurements. Extending contract, going to tender etc.

SBRR, RETAIL, RURAL relief etc.etc.         The date the account holder became liable for NON DOMESTIC RATES         Also please include all businesses THAT ARE NOT currentlyreceiving any form of local support / relief from your respective authority         The most current and up to date list you have (ideally from Sept2014 onwards) If you could please supply the information in spreadsheet format via emailto this address I would be very grateful. I have attached a typical FOIpublished file, this one is from Reading Council but does give you a goodidea of the type of data I am requesting? This one was provided FREE and ispublished on the Reading Council Website.

Could you please tell me how many theatres and arts centers are in your area.Could you please also email me their names.I'm looking for any space for live performance (not music) which is open to the public. For example, a school with a performing arts centre open to any member of the public would count, but a school stage which only opens to parents and relatives wouldn't. Similarly, a visual art gallery or historic house whose main activity is not performance would count only if they programmed live performances open to the public, even if infrequently.It can be of any size, even if it's part of another venue such as a pub.I am a theatre producer looking to make a list of all the performance spaces in the UK that theatre shows could potentially be toured to.

column6: FOI request: data on Ukip councillor attendance

The attendance record for each Ukip councillor (including their name and ward) for allmeetings, cabinets or committees that he or she was expected to participate in.2. Where an attendance record represents a known anomaly, for example due to long termsickness or bereavement, please do indicate this.I would prefer to receive this information electronically, preferably as a data set in Word orExcel.If the decision is made to withhold some of this data using exemptions in the Data ProtectionAct, please inform me of that fact and cite the exemptions used.If some parts of this request are easier to answer than others, I would ask that you release theavailable data as soon as possible.If you need any clarification then please do not hesitate to contact me. Under Section 16 it isyour duty to provide advice and assistance and so I would expect you to contact me if you findthis request unmanageable in any way.I would be grateful if you could confirm in writing that you have received this request, and Ilook forward to hearing from you within the 20workingday statutory time period.

column6: FOI request regarding children in care and Secure Orders
column7: Please could you provide me with the following information under the Freedom of Information Act: 1. The number of children in local authority care (including care leavers) aged over sixteen, who were entered into a placement in bed and breakfast or hostel accommodation in each financial year from 2008/9 to 2013/14 2. The number of children in local authority care (including care leavers) aged over sixteen who were living in a placement in bed and breakfast or hostel accommodation during the course of each financial year from 2008/9 to 2013/14 3. The number of children in local authority care (including care leavers) aged over sixteen who were living in a placement in bed and breakfast or hostel accommodation for more than 28 days during the course of each financial year from 2008/9 to 2013/14 Question 1 concerns the number of children who were entered into B&B or hostel accommodation, whilst question 2 concerns the total number of children who were living in such accommodation during all or part of each year (including those who had initially been entered into that accommodation in a previous year but were still in living in such accommodation in subsequent years). 4. A list of locations (sites, not just towns/cities) where the council has placed children under Secure Orders in since the start of 2011/12 (excluding locations with current Secure Order placements, if necessary under the terms of the Freedom of Information Act exemptions) Please email me the information.

Following the recent publication of our new 'how to' guide - How to make weight-loss services work for men, the Men's Health Forum is working on a project to assess both the scale and impact of male-tailored weight management services and the impact of the best practice advice on those services.As part of this we are keen to understand what's going on in local areas around the UK, particularly any new practice that can be evaluated or shared with other areas.To this end, please can you answer the following questions about gender and weight management programmes in your local authority area:1.	Do you currently have provision for commissioned or directly delivered tier 2 weight management services in place: o	For adultso	For childreno	For families2.	What were numbers of participants by sex for the commissioned or directly delivered tier 2 weight management services in 2013/14? (or most recent figures available)? o	Meno	Womeno	Adults (sex not known)o	Boyso	Girlso	Children (sex not known)3.	Do your commissioned or directly delivered tier 2 weight management services for adults include:a.	Integrated services (men & women)b.	Men-only servicesc.	Women-only servicesd.	Do they include a physical activity element to the programme?4.	Which providers do you work with to deliver each of your weight management programmes?Some parts of this request may be easier to answer than others, and should this prove to be the case I would ask that you release available data as soon as possible rather than hold up the entire request.I would prefer to receive this information electronically. If the decision is made to withhold some of this data using exemptions in Act, please inform me of that fact and cite the exemptions used.If you need any clarification then please contact me on 020 8922 7910 or via email at foi+obesity@menshealthforum.org.uk. Under your section 16 duty to provide advice and assistance I would expect you to contact me if you find this request unmanageable in any way.

column6: Men and Obesity FOI - extra question
column7: Further to our previous email, please could you also answer the following question (ideally as part of the same request):5.	What special activities, interventions or service design elements (if any) do you have to encourage men to take up weight-loss programmes?Apologies for not including this in the original email

column3: Highways Capital Development and Waste Management
column6: Parking situation on the roads through Cullompton
column7: I am e-mailing you after putting up with years of frustration regarding the parking situation on the roads through Cullompton. I own a local Dental Practice, and the main topic of conversation from my patients, is how difficult it is to get through Cullompton. because of vehicles parked both around the Hillcrest development on the approach from Willand, and in Fore Street. The latter causing major congestion in the town.As you are aware, last week you had a team placing double yellow lines at the first location I mentioned. They were unable to complete the job due to cars obstructing their way. I believe they also came back this week and were unable to complete the job for the same reason. Please would you be good enough to answer the following points.1. Why were the cars preventing the placement of the Double Yellows not towed away ? 2. Had the owners of the said cars been informed that works were due to take place?3. Has this added to the cost of placing the double yellow lines.4. Are the double yellows going to be extended to St Georges Well. as cars are now being parked on the bend of the road which is dangerous.5. What do you intend to do about the horrendous parking situation in Fore St, and why have double yellow lines not been placed along both sides of Fore St ?In summary there are a handful of people parking their cars in areas that are inconveniencing thousands of motorists in Cullompton. This leads to accidents , road rage and also blocks the emergency services access through the town. There is ample car parking spaces available in the town, and no need for people to block the highway in any way.I am requesting this information under the FOI act, a copy of which i intend to place in my waiting room for my patients information !

I am writing to request information under the Freedom of Information Act. In order to assist you with this request, I am outlining my query as specifically as possible. For the avoidance of doubt I do not seek to identify regions/specific geographical areas but merely seek to establish the national statistical picture in respect of the/these offences.I would like you to provide a response to the following questions: 1. How many school children in your area are currently known to have mental health issues? Please could you breakdown the results giving details  for primary age children and secondary pupils separately please.2. How many school children have committed or attempted suicide in the 12 months?My preferred format to receive this information is in email format to this address or Holly.Collins@city.ac.uk.Should you determine that my request is not clear enough, then please email and advise me on how it can be best rephrased and resubmitted. If my request is denied, I ask that you justify this with reference to specific exemptions of the Act. I reserve the right to appeal your decision to withhold any information or to charge excessive fees. I would be grateful if you could confirm in writing that you have received this request. I look forward to your response within 20 working days, as outlined by the statute.

I would like to request the following information under the Freedom of Information Act 2000.The information I am requesting is regarding funding for Alternative Provision, within Pupil Referral Units and for students with medical needs who require small group or individual education provision out of mainstream school.1.	If your local authority has a maintained Pupil Referral Unit (PRU) I would like to know the following information:-a)	What is the average cost of a yearly full time place?b)	What is the lowest and highest funding the local authority pays annually for a full time place?c)	Do you use the 'Place Plus' funding mechanism for funding PRUs?d)	If you use 'Place Plus' funding what are the monetary values of the three levels (bands) of top up funding used for funding PRUs?2.	If your local authority funds tuition on medical grounds and does not have a medical provision provided through Hospital Education:-a.	Do you fund tuition for students on an individual basis or as a Service?b.	What is the average cost of provision for individual students receiving tuition?

column6: Priority Schools Building Programme Chagford Primary School
column7: Under the Freedom of Information Act, I believe I am entitled to see at no charge a certain amount of information based upon the time it takes you to collate the information. Chagford qualified for the government s PSBP in 2011. This scheme I have read offers both new build and large scale refurbishment . Mr Chris Dyer and MR Simon Niles of Devon County Council and Mr Gerard Stone of the EFA amongst others visited our school on 4th November in order to announce Chagford School s acceptance on the PSBP at this meeting he stated that the chances of a refurbishment were vanishingly small . This came as a shock to many and as such I am writing to ask for greater clarification please. The school Specific Brief clearly states that the preferred location for the siting of the school is on its present site. It also states that the sports field should be reinstated on completion of the works along with the preservation of the school amphitheatre, gardens, trees and rocks. By providing the school with a new build, many of these items would be lost or certainly would never be reinstated to the size and condition they are at present. I note that any inconsistencies found between the Generic Design Brief and the School-Specific Brief, result in the School-Specific Brief will take precedence. Therefore the EFA should be considering a large scale refurbishment for Chagford Primary School, especially considering Devon County Council has already invested nearly 400,000 of government money. Would you please put pressure on the EFA to consider a refurbishment, I and many others believe this would be a far better investment than on a poor quality school which probably won t meet the high standards many are expecting and will result in continued and escalating maintenance costs given that the budget for the new build is only 1113/msq. A refurb of 70% of the new build total budget (70% of 2.6) would offer so much more and should be able to include the following: o Energy saving measures such as: the complete replacement of the mechanical and engineering services, this includes all low energy lighting, heating and plumbing. o Better use of natural light and ventilation with double glazing. o The classrooms that overlook the playground may require the following to minimise solar gain, such as solar shading techniques for example, external canopies and deep roof overhangs or shutters. o Internal and/or external cladding as appropriate would need to be undertaken. o Increased insulation of ceilings and floors may be required. o A ground source heat pump but we acknowledge that the present boiler is only 4 years old. o The present school hall of 115sqm this needs to be replaced as it needs to be 170sqm as set out in the Schools Building Bulletin 103. This would mean a new kitchen would also be required. o We understand that a firm Studio OK undertook a survey on behalf of the school in 2003 and drew up a possible plan for the school and its refurbishment with the hall sited near the present entrance. The old hall could be converted for use by the FSU. Please would you release for our information and to gain a better understanding of the construction options, a copy of the Studio OK s plan and associated data. I believe this was drawn up in 2003 and is held in your offices. Please help us and ensure the EFA at the very least involves the community in consultation on the future construction options available to our school. We must consider the environmental impact and the investment to date. With thanks.

I am making a request under the Freedom of Information Act to establish how many looked after children (that the council has/had full or shared responsibility for) have gone missing since January 1, 2010, and not been found/returned to care.  I understand the council may not hold information to say if they are currently still 'missing', however I would like to know if either you still record them as missing, or they were recorded at missing at the point the council's responsibility for them ceased (eg. due to age, death, etc.). Here are the questions:Since January 1, 2010:1. Please provide the total number of children/young people that the council has/had full or shared responsibility for who have gone missing and not been found/returned to care. I understand the council may not hold the information to say if they are currently still 'missing', however I would like to know if either you still record them as missing, or they were recorded as missing at the point the council's responsibility for them ceased (eg. due to age, death, etc.). 2. Please provide a breakdown for EACH of these children/young people stating:a) Their age (at the time they went missing)b) Their gender (at the time they went missing)c) The date they went missingd) If they are still recorded as missing/whereabouts unknown, or similare) If they were recorded as missing at the point the council's responsibility for them ceased due to a reason other than death (please state that reason, eg. age, and if: (please select one of the three options) - it is known that they are still missing - unknown if they are missing or no longer missing (ie, the council does not hold information) - known that they returned from being missing after the responsibility ceasedf) If they were recorded as missing at the point the council's responsibility for them ceased due to death.If there are any problems with this request, please do not hesitate to contact me. If my request is denied in whole or in part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the act.

Under the freedom of information act 2000 please provide me with the following information:a)      A complete list of all commercial properties within your regionb)      The Company name of the occupantsc)       The billing authority reference number for each propertyd)      The current rateable value of each propertye)      The current rates payable of each propertyf)       The start date of occupationg)      Please note where the occupant in receipt of-          Small Business Rates Relief-          Charitable Rates Relief-          Empty Property Relief-          Discretionary Rate Relief-          Other Reliefs

column7: Dear sir thank you for your recent email with regards to the road surface damage on Bittern Road Exeter. I would like to ask if a report on the roads condition has been submitted by you recently. As you are no doubt aware I have recently had two incidents which has resulted in major damage to my Mercedes car and I would like if you can supply me with that report the exact details of how bad the road surface is. Would you please be so kind as to include with that report if you can?  Please include the classification of the requirements or minimal requirements for a road damage to be addressed?I hope you have been made aware of a the first incident that took place which resulted in the snapping of suspension springs on the car followed by a return to work some days later on a Monday morning only to find that a the car tyre caught the lip of one of the deep ruts resulting in a punctured tire. This damage is not acceptable and I will be making a formal complaint to the appropriate people and if I needed involve a solicitor am quite prepared to do that as I have an insurance policy which will quite clearly take care of all the costs incurred by me. Please confirm receipt of this email and its contents and hopefully a date to when you can supply me with the information I requested.

column6: Are the public sector meeting or exceeding these security levels
column7: According to the Information Commissioners Office, 90% of data held at most organisations is classified as IL2, IL3 or 'official' (source: HMG) and therefore requires a certain level of security to keep it private and confidential.  The goal of my Freedom of Information Act request is to understand, within the context of current data privacy and data protection concerns, whether the public sector is meeting or exceeding these security levels, typically referred to as business Impact Levels (IL) IL1, IL2, and IL3 etc. I appreciate the time taken to respond to these questions and have tried to keep the survey as simple as possible. Thank you, in advance, for your response.  Q1: How much 'official' (IL2, IL3) data, as a percentage and total capacity of all data your organisation holds, do you store?  Percentage: ________% of all our dataTotal capacity: ________ terabytes of data Q2: How much of that 'official' data, as a percentage and total capacity is stored onsite (in one of your buildings) versus 3rd party offsite*(Colocation or any type of Cloud such as public, private & hybrid).Percentage onsite: ________% of all our dataTotal capacity onsite: ________ terabytes of dataPercentage offsite in the cloud: ________% of all our dataTotal capacity offsite in the cloud: ________ terabytes of data*If you have your onsite 'official' data that is backed up off-site, please just duplicate your onsite entry Q3: How much of this 'official' data is stored within following accredited security impact levels.  Please provide an approximate percentage for each level, and your answer should total 100% or thereabouts.Onsite Official (IL2): ________%Official (IL3): ________%Other level/type (I.e IL4 and above): ________%Don't know: ________%Offsite Official (IL2): ________%Official (IL3): ________%Other level/type (I.e IL4 and above): ________%Don't know: ________% Q4: How many times have you enlisted the help of a CESG Listed Advisor Scheme (CLAS) consultant in the past 24 months to review, check and audit the accredited security levels in place at your organisation?0, 1, 4, 8, Other Q5: How often have the accredited security levels in place at your organisation been audited over the past 24 months?0, 1, 4, 8, Other Q6:  Have any data breaches been recorded at your organisation over the past 24 months? Yes, No, Don't Know

column6: Information request - Adult social care records
column7: I'm trying to find records of what involvement social services had with my late father Peter Stapleford (might be down as Harold Peter, but he didn't use the Harold) of 48 Cofton Hill, Starcross, Devon EX6 8RB.I am not sure what records you are allowed to reveal. At a personal level I had power of attorney for him in his last year's and I would like to know if things were going on. In particular I would like to know if there were questions of misuse of his savings, or physical or mental abuse. I have suspicions on the former, and to a lesser extent on the later.Also I am caught up in his will bring contested by another family member. I am not the person contesting or defending the will, but would be more comfortable the more I know about what actually went on.I know of one incident when Ian Mason was involved, hence my contracting him first. He handled that matter very well, and I should have kept in contact, hindsight being great.That was around my father having access to his bank accounts and statements, I have been told that social services were contracted on other occasions, possibly by carers. If this is the case I don't necessary, need to know details, but would appreciate at some sort of overview. A carer, friend, family member raised an issue about, money, treatment, that sort of thing. I definitely don't want anything that would identify anyone who contacted you, and wouldn't expect you to provide that.These things can hang over a family for a long time. I understand that this may conflict with your confidentiality rules, but would really appreciate it if you can give me this information.
column8: Request lapsed: requested information not provided

column6: Freedom of Information Request - Payments made to former and current resident of local authority
column7: I am writing under the Freedom of Information Act to ask for the following information in relation to your authority or defunct authorities for which you have taken over responsibility: 1.	Since 1st April 2009 how many payments, if any, have been made to former, and current, residents of children's care homes who have alleged physical or sexual abuse at the hands of staff, or adult visitors, to settle any claims? Could you break this down by financial years if possible?2.	How much in total have these payments amounted to? 3.	How much have these claims amounted to on a financial year by financial year basis since 1st April 2009? 4.	What is the total number of alleged victims since 1st April 2009 who have had payments made to them? Could you again break this down by financial year if possible?5.	How many care homes do these claims relate to?6.	Can you provide the names of any care homes these claims relate to?  Please supply the information as soon as possible by e-mail to aeneas.rotsos@bbc.co.uk. As you will know, the law requires you to respond promptly to this request.  If you are able to supply some of this information more quickly than other items, please supply each item as soon as it is available. If you need any further information from me in order to deal with my request, please call me at once on 07751 368512 or 0161 335 6501

column6: Sexual abuse and exploitation of children within Atkinson House
column7: My Name is Paul Gatiss,  I currently work at Newton Aycliffe Secure Children's Home as a residential worker / Duty officer. At present I am working through my Level 5 in Leadership for Health and Social Care and Children and Young People's Services.  Part of the course involves a research unit of which I have decided to conduct my research around the sexual abuse and exploitation of children who reside within Atkinson House  Secure children's home. I appreciate, confidentiality is of the upmost importance when providing any information about your young people to a third party such as myself.  My intentions being , to hopefully obtain information about the young people who came into Atkinson House  from April 2014 - September 2014 and as part of this it would assist me greatly if you could share the following information: 1)  How many, male and/or female, children in total where admitted to your home within the above time period? (April 2014 - September 2014). 2) What order did they come to you on? 3)  Which county/area did the young people come from before being admitted to your home? 4) How many of these children, male and/or female, have evidence of being sexual abused or sexually exploited? 5)  If known where, geographically/county, did the abuse/exploitation take place? 6)  Who were the main perpetrators, male/s or Female/s, in the sexual abuse or sexual exploitation of the young people?

column6: FOI: Costs to Devon County Council for dealing with FOI requests
column7: I was wondering if you might have any data available for the costs to Devon County Council for dealing with FOI requests?Some councils keep records on how much money is spent answering Freedom of Information requests (going by the government guidance of £25 per hour spent searching for information) but many do not.Whether or not this information is readily available, I was wondering if you would like to make a more general comment about the way the Freedom of Information Act affects the Council.Do you often receive requests that might be considered frivilous or unnecessary, or containing commercial interests?

column7: 1. The total number of households that are/were part of a sanctuary scheme in your area in each of the following years: 2009/10, 2010/11, 2011/12, 2012/13, 2013/14. 2. The total number of sanctuary scheme properties affected by the spare room subsidy in your area in: 2012/13 and 2013/14. The term 'sanctuary scheme' is used to describe the individual packages, informed by a risk assessment, that enhance security for households at risk of domestic violence, and may include, amongst other measures: reinforced exterior doors, window alarms, intercom systems, sanctuary rooms, window grills and video entry systems.  I would prefer to receive this information electronically. If my request is denied in whole or in part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the Act. I will also expect you to release all non-exempt material. I reserve the right to appeal your decision to withhold any information or to charge excessive fees.

column6: Provision of training to provide intrauterine contraceptive devices - Bayer Health Care
column7: 1.       Please confirm or deny whether the local authority holds a contract(s) for the fitting of intrauterine devices and intrauterine systems (IUD/IUS) ina.       General practice                                                                     Yes/Nob.      Contraception and sexual health (CaSH) clinics          Yes/Noc.       other settings in your local area                                       Yes/Noa.       General practice, if confirmed, please supply details of the contract(s)i.         please provide details of the number of practices/clinics signed up to the contract and what proportion this is of the total number of practices/clinics within the local authority areaii.       please confirm or deny if the contract(s) specifies that healthcare professionals should meet national standards of training in order to fit IUD/IUSiii.      please confirm or deny if the contract includes a referral pathway for women wishing to have an IUS/IUD fitted, if it is not available in the practice/clinic where they first request or are prescribed this method of contraceptioniv.     please confirm or deny whether the contract includes the funding of the unit cost for the IUS/IUDv.       please confirm or deny whether the contract includes the funding of IUS for non-contraceptive purposesb.       Contraception and Sexual Health clinics, if confirmedi.         please confirm or deny if the contract(s) specifies that the service provides training for HCPs to fit IUS/IU Ds to national standardsc.       Other settings in your local areai.         please confirm or deny if the contract(s) have been subcontracted and if so give details2.       Please confirm or deny whether the local authority holds a list of practices and clinics which employ staff trained to fit IUD/IUS in the local authority areaa.       If confirmed, please supply details of the listb.      If confirmed, what proportion is this of the total number of practices/clinics in the local authority area3.       Please confirm or deny whether the local authority has formal arrangements in place to fund training for healthcare professionals to fit IUD/IUS for 2014/15a.       If confirmed, will these funding arrangements be continued for the financial year 2015/16?b.      If denied, what organisation is responsible for the commissioning of training for the fitting of IUD/IUS in your area?4.       Please confirm or deny whether the local authority monitors the number of healthcare professionals qualified to deliver training in the fitting and removal of IUD/IUS in the local areaa.       If confirmed, please supply details of the monitoring arrangements5.       Please supply details on the proportion of IUD/IUS fitting in your local area which is carried out in (a) general practice, (b) CaSH clinics and (c) other settings

We are working on behalf of Hazel Blears MP to collate Local Authority Social Value Policies and how Councils are intending to implement the requirements of the Public Services (Social Value) Act 2012.Our work also shows that it is possible to deliver Social Value at no additional costs to the public sector which on an annual spend of £100m could equate to an additional £20-40m (Note: Assumes average Social Value delivery by business being 10-20% if managed properly).At present we are unable find any specific reference to your Social Value Policy  on your website  and we would be very grateful  if you would as the relevant officer to send any information that you might have on following:1.       Social Value Policy (if available)2.       Social Value metrics and measures3.       Sustainable Procurement Policy/Strategy4.       Any other information which you think we would benefit which is relevant to Social Value describing your progress if you do not have a policy in place yet.If you need any support we would be very happy to meet/telecon to discuss our findings and provide you any support that you may need in developing your policies (at no cost) along with best practice examples from other Local Authorities.

Again, please send me the full road repair history, but this should include:- dates of all safety inspections between 13th July & 13th September- details of how safety inspections were undertaken (walked or driven, speed of inspection vehicle etc)- details of all carriageway defects identified, with description, date and time- details of how the authority handled these defects, what repairs were undertaken and the time between the identification of each defect and a repair being carried out.

column6: Request for information on third party funerals for a public health act funeral
column7: THIS REQUEST IS FOR COUNTY, BOROUGH & UNITARY COUNCILS AND DOES NOT RELATE TO PUBLIC HEALTH FUNERALS PER SE. IF THE CASE WAS PASSED TO A 3RD PARTY FOR A PUBLIC HEALTH ACT FUNERAL TO BE CARRIED OUT, THEN PLEASE PROVIDE DETAILS OF THE CASE AS PER THE QUESTIONS BELOW. THANKS!I would like to know details of anyone who has been under the care of the County Council Guardianship/Deputyship Team* who has died with no known next of kin from 1/6/2014 to the day of your reply. *The Guardianship Team is known by different names at different County Councils, for example: Client Affairs, Protection Team, Adult Care Team, Deputyship Team, Appointeeship Team or other similar name.Please include:1.	 the deceased's full name(s)2.	the date they died3.	the approximate value of their estate(s)4.	their dates of birth or age at death whether or not they were married, divorced, single, or widowed 5.	the maiden surnames of married females or widows 6.	their  address at death7.	the date when a referral was made of this estate to the Treasury Solicitor or Duchy of Lancaster or Cornwall or any other 3rd party to research or administer and the name of the 3rd party concerned8.	if a referral to the Treasury Solicitor or Duchy has not yet been made and you think it will be made soon could you advise me of this too.9.	if a case is still  undecided or awaiting referral, please also advise of details.

column6: Social care support for blind and partially sighted people
column7: We would be grateful if your authority could respond to the 11 following questions.Please respond via email where possible, and send all responses to tara.chattaway@rnib.org.uk or call 01179 341 707 for further clarification. We would appreciate if you could confirm receipt of this email, and look forward to hearing from you within 20 working days.The questions below relate to rehabilitation and social care provision for blind and partially sighted people within you local authority. On notes of terminology, by a structured programme of rehabilitation we mean a programme of preventative service which is provided by trained rehabilitation officers for visually impaired people. The programme must provide training and support in the home and mobility training to adults outside of the home. 1.	Does the Authority offer blind and partially sighted people a structured programme of rehabilitation, if yes who is the service delivered by if not the authority?  foioffice@devon.gov.uk2.	Does the Authority operate eligibility criteria for people to access rehabilitation services? If so please provide a copy of the criteria. 3.	How many rehabilitation officers and assistants of visual impairment are employed by the Authority (or the organisation delivering rehab services), and what is their full time equivalence?4.	Has the number rehabilitation officers and assistants outlined above changed in the last 5 years, if the answer is yes please state the original number and the reason as to why. 5.	Please set out who makes the initial assessment of a person with a visual impairment when 1.	A CVI referral is received 2.	Any other routes into care support.6.	What training to understand the needs of blind and partially sighted people do those carrying out the initial assessment receive 7.	Does the Authority plan to review or to make changes to the structured programme of rehabilitation, if the answer is yes, please provide information on the planned changes.8.	What was the total budget spent by the authority on rehabilitation services for blind and partially sighted in 1.	2009/20102.	20013/143.	Budget for 2015/169.	How many people with vision impairment as their main disability were assessed as having eligible care needs that met the Authority's eligibility threshold in 2013/14? 10.	Please confirm what items of equipment are routinely provided to blind and partially sighted for free and which are charged for? Please attach a list of both chargeable and non chargeable items. 11.	What is the average waiting time between;1.	receipt of certificate of visual impairment and initial assessment for rehabilitation services/care support?2.	initial assessment and assessment for rehabilitation 3.	assessment for rehabilitation and receiving support

We recently advertised the post of Manager for Hillside Secure Children's Home in our borough, and had a very limited pool of candidates apply. What we now want to do is look into the current rates of pay (and any supplements, allowances etc) of other Secure Children's Homes with a view to reviewing whether we need to increase the market supplement.  Would you therefore be able to help by letting me have the pay and supplements/allowances currently being paid to the Manager of Atkinson Secure Children's Home.Thank you in anticipation, and kind regardsVicky O'Connor Human Resources OfficerNeath Port Talbot County Borough Council01639 686 703

column3: Highways Capital Development and Waste Management
column6: Schools that request permission to install solar panels
column7: There are two main scenarios whereby a school may need to know the councils policy and obtain their permission to proceed. In order to ease the information gathering process, I have outlined these:1.	A school wishes to pay for the installation of its own solar panels. Before making such a huge financial commitment, the school would need to know the councils policy (as the owners of the building) in allowing the usage of their roof for the next 20 years. 2.	A school wishes to accept an offer from a third party to install the panels totally free of charge. The arrangement would be on the basis that the third party will be providing, installing, maintaining and insuring the panels for 20 years and in return will receive the feed in tariffs. The school benefit by reducing its carbon footprint, reducing its energy bills and providing an educational resource for its pupils. If a school wished a third party to proceed with an installation of this type, both the school and the third party would need to know whether the council (as the building owners) would allow the usage/lease of their roof for 20 years.Therefore, on the assumption that all regulated criteria such as structural suitability and planning regulations etc could be met satisfactorily by the school and/or third party, and that all reasonable requirements/conditions set by the council will be met, could you please let me know the following:Q1) What information do you have to guide schools on how the council would intend to support or object to scenarios A & B (Whether historic documents, ones yet to be issued to schools or ones discussed for circulation but never issued).Q2) What documentation do you have to show how you may have supported or objected to any schools that have already attempted to install panels in scenarios similar to A & B. For instance, if you have allowed a school to proceed with an installation, a copy of an agreement detailing the conditions required in order to allow the school (and/or third party) to utilise the roof for 20 years will be the information I am requesting. Alternatively, if you have refused a request, a copy of the reasons given for the refusal will be required.Q3) Records of any internal meetings/discussions etc whereby policy/opinions regarding scenarios similar to points A & B have been discussed in general and the notes/documents created as a result of those discussions.Q4) If none of the above situations has occurred, then what is the councils general current policy on scenarios similar to points A & B.Q4) Who within the council has ultimate responsibility for enabling or preventing a school proceeding with scenario A or B and what are their guidelines for decision making.Finally, what plans do the council have/may have had, to install their own solar panels on to their schools estate (and any other building they may own) and what is the current status of these plans.

column6: Preparing for Part Night Street Lighting
column7: The policy of Part Night Street Lighting [PNSL]  was introduced to Cowick on 01/04/14During end of August/bignning of September it was noticed that many street lights throughout Cowick were coming on during daylight hours - I understand that this is known as 'day-burn"/I understand that the reason for this was that the area nodes to control the street lights in Cowick lost contact with the individual streeets - which resulted in them reverting the the fail-safe mode - lights on.This of course, results in the desired savings by implementing PNSL being lost.Q1 Can you tell me how many area nodes were initially installed to control the street lights in Cowick?Q2 Have any additional area nodes been installed to rectify the system failure in the summer?Q3 Can you identify each and every area node (street and lamp-post number) being used to control street lights in Cowick?Q4 If no additional area nodes have been installed since the summer, what actions have been taken by both DCC and the system manufacture/designer/installer to prevent a re-occurance of 'day-burn"?

I am seeking information relating to young people who are:- 	Up to the age of 25;- 	Who are currently looked after and/or accommodated by the Local Authority under Child Act provisions and/or leaving care provisions;- 	To include children and young people who entered into your care as 'Unaccompanied Asylum Seeking Children' (UASC)  who then went on to join members of their family in the UK who were seeking asylum;- 	This would include children and young people: whose parents have been detained through immigration or criminal procedures; who have been taken into care because of child protection concerns; and/or where private/public family law proceedings are underway;- 	These young people will have normally have been included as a dependent in a family member's asylum application or claimed asylum in their own right with the Home Office. They may have been placed in foster care, or other forms of accommodation or they may be detained but are still being financed by your own Local Authority. They may or may not have an allocated Social Worker but will normally be accommodated or financed or both by the Authority's Social Services Department either under compulsory measures of care or through voluntary or discretionary provision.I respectfully request information on the following:In each of the last two financial years:1.	How many asylum-seeking children under the age of 16 are being supported / accommodated by your Local Authority?2.	How many asylum-seeking children between the ages of 16 and 18 are being supported / accommodated by your Local Authority?3.	How many asylum-seeking 18 - 25 year olds are being supported / accommodated by your Local Authority?4.	How many (of the combined total of (1) - (3) above) are female?5.	What are the predominant nationalities of the children identified at (1) and (2) above? For example, please provide us with the top five nationalities.6.	What are the predominant nationalities of the 18 - 25 year olds at (3) above? Again, if possible please provide us with the top five nationalities.7.	In relation to (1) - (3) above, how many of the asylum-seeking children and young people were taken into the care of the local authority owing to child protection concerns?8.	In relation to (1) - (3) above, please provide a breakdown of the reasons children and young people were taken into the care of the Local Authority. For example this may be due to a bereavement, imprisonment, health of the primary care giver and/or following abandonment.9.	In relation to (1) - (3) above, how many children and young people were subject to public family law proceedings?10.	In respect of (7) above, how many interim care orders were granted by the Court in favour of the Local Authority? How many full care orders were granted in favour of the Local Authority?

column6: What are the councils plans and or arrangements for the MIPIM
column7: Councils plans and or arrangements for the MIPIM (Le marche international des professionnels de l'immobilier) property event which will take place in Cannes in March 2015.1...Is the council and or anyone acting on its behalf planning to send officers and or elected members and or representatives to the MIPIM property festival which is due to take place in Cannes in March 2015. 2...If the answer is yes can you please state how many officers and how many elected members are going to Cannes. Please specify numbers of officers and the number of councillors. 3...Has the council and or anyone acting on its behalf booked any other accommodation for this trip.  This accommodation will include but will not be limited hotels and or motels and or bed and breakfast establishments and or similar.      If the answer is yes can you please provide full details. In the case of each hotel and or motel and or bed and breakfast and or similar can you provide its full name and address.  In the case of each hotel can you state the number of single rooms and or double rooms and or suites booked.  Can provide a breakdown by room type. In the case of each premises can you please state how many council officers and or members and or representatives will be staying there. In the case of each premise can you please state for how long rooms have been booked.  In the case of each of these premises can you state the cost of the booking to the council. Please provide details of  any accommodation you are planning to book.  4...Has the council and or anyone acting on its behalf booked any other type of accommodation in relation to this event.  This accommodation will include villas and or apartments and or flats and or houses.  If the answer is yes can you please provide full details. In the case of each of the premises can you please state provide the full name and address. In the case of each of these premises can you please state how many council staff and or elected members and or representatives will be staying there. In the case each of the of the premises can you please state for how long the council has booked the premises. In the case of each of the premises can you please state how much the booking will cost.  Please provide details of any accommodation you are planning to event.  6...Has the council booked a yacht and or other type of boat for the duration and or part of the event. If the answer is yes can you please identify the vessel.  Can you please provide an explanation for the booking.  Can you please provide the cost of the booking.  Please do include details of bookings you are planning to meet.  7...Will the council be hosting any event during the festival.  These events will include but will not be limited to seminars and or conferences and or meetings and or social functions including drinks and meals.  If the answer is yes can you please provide full details. In the case of each event can you please provide details of date and venue and cost to the council.  8...Can you please provide details of any invitations accepted by those visiting Cannes. In the case of each invitation can you please provide a copy of the invitation. In the case of each invitation can you please provide date, venue and location.

column6: FOI - Request on Child Sexual Exploitation
column7: Please could you supply me with answers to the following questions, separated for each financial year: 2012-13; 2013-14; 2014-15. 1.       How many cases of child sexual exploitation were referred to the local authority in the financial year a) 2012-13 b) 2013-14 and c) 2014-15? 2. column7: 1.	How many young people (16-18) Not Known on your system at the end of December 2012, 2013 and 2014? Numbers and Percentages. 2. column3: Highways Capital Development and Waste Management
column6: Private roadway at Buttercombe Barton and responses given
column7: Our clients understand that DCC paid Sally Watts £10,000 to acquire the private Roadway and part of the Tarka Trail, but that certain other rights were granted, and consideration given for the acquisition.In the planning statement (for application 3699/2014) DCC state (at point 6):"That a private right to ride horses next to the path exists along the former railway to the SE of the golf course, but this will not be open to the public use and will have no destination as it leads only to private land"At the point the statement was made we understand that no such track existed, and that it was part of the sale arrangement reached with M Watts that DCC would create a new track alongside the new section of Tarka Trail.Our clients' complaint is that this amounts to a misstatement, and was misleading.  Can you please confirm the arrangement reached with M Watts in relation to the acquisition?
